Z-Ss6MuDQRfGU8rEKBt2Fw.text: Three of us had a brunch today. Two of us ordered the Brio Hamburgers and one of our group ordered the Sicilian Omelet. The omelet was very tasty, but two of us got sick eating hamburgers. Presentation- 8 out 10 Hamburgers were so dried and burned. A lady (she looks likes the manager of the Brio) asked us, if we ordered medium well. The server never asked us how our burgers like to cook. Arugula were wilted, French fries were too salty and hamburgers had no seasoning. Sadly we wouldn't order the hamburgers any more. Beautiful place and rotten hamburgers

fHBYVqRMszQUFTPidJ-gyQ.text: Sorry....but this place was an utter failure.  I know all places have bad nights but there were too many issues from different parts of the house to ignore.  First..and foremost..the waiter. Careless..and almost like he didn't give a rats ass we were there cause he deserved a tip anyways.  My wife asked for the a pasta dish and NO mushrooms...of course it came out with mushrooms. Mother in law ordered the steak with veggies and mashed potaotes. Whoever was on the line was horrible. Veggies and mashed potatoes were ice cold and never should have left the kitchen. Another order of the fish was a letdown with over cooked and dried out fish.  Come on..the line failed, the person on the gill failed, and the server was a joke. Another example of over trendy and overhyped Summerlin crap.

HuNN2Sx2t9sGC2lZwWY-7w.text: I took my mother out for a nice dinner anticipating a pleasant experience, instead it became the opposite.  We waited 10 minutes too long before our waitress Hollie came to serve us.  She never introduced herself and the only reason I know her name it is because it is stated on the ticket.  I asked her specifically if the spaghetti bolognese was an entree that we could order and if it was made the same as before she said yes it is.  We had put in 2 orders and it came out with a different kind of pasta.  The gentleman that brought it out to us explained to us that it is made differently now which Hollie never told us after I had asked her specifically if it was.  The waiter was kind enough to change the order for us and we got what we originally wanted.  Hollie never stopped by the table to apologize for the mistake, as a matter of fact she completely disappeared for the entire dinner until we were finished.  Only then she asked if our meal was ok.  She never checked on us and didn't offer any bread, which we had to ask for, or was around for us to get more water or drinks.  The worse part is that she wasn't friendly at all and if anything made it very unpleasant for us dine there and made us feel discriminated.  Employees like her shouldn't be in the hospitality industry and she is costing you money by not providing a great experience for your customers.  If we had a better service we would have gotten more drinks and stayed for dessert.  It is very unfortunate that she represents your company and that we could have gotten better service somewhere else.  The food is good as always but we won't be coming back to the Summerlin location.

v3Eybtf_ftdovHvicJmhNA.text: An old friend of mine turned me on to Brio and I fell in love! I have never experienced bad service at the Tivoli Village location. The down fall for my husband and I is that the bill can add up quite quickly, by the time we have added drinks, salads and a few of those little mini desserts. It's worth it though, the peach sangria (get the pitcher) is yummo, and those mini desserts are even better!  My husband can be a picky eater too, and he is always able to find something on the menu that he can eat. The kids menu is pretty good too, the kids hamburger is huge and they love the fries!

vZyoTbNGkngPNxFk4Sb5Ig.text: What the heck happened to this place? The service is now terrible. The girl who sat us was rude. I stated ahead of time we wanted a booth. I recently herniated three discs so sitting in a wood chair sucks for me. So of course they tried to sit us in wooden chairs. She had a mini fit when I reminded her I asked for a booth. Trust me it sucks to be young and have had an accident I don't need a 19 year old treating me like I'm being difficult. To top it off it took twenty minutes for a waitress to come by. She seemed shocked no one had been by to take our drink order. By this time we had our menus sat to the side and were ready to order our meal.  There's to many good restaurants in this town to deal with bad service.

oresEKsBpmRMeNgZSx7kpw.text: Tivoli Village location has horrible service. That alone made this place so terribly annoying. I have eaten at Brio all across the U.S. because its consistently good food and service. Not this location unfortunately.   Waiter took 20 min to acknowledge us. Was nowhere to be found during the meal and filled our glasses once. I had to get up and look for the guy in the front of the kitchen to get him to come back to our table. And to top it off my $20 plate of Chicken Limone was nothing more than chicken on pasta. Missing the lemon completely on taste and only present in presentation.   I should have ordered what I normally order but I was feeling adventurous. I live in this neighborhood and am here daily so I expect to come back and have better service. You need to if you are going to stay afloat in Tivoli.  I'll revisit and update, hopefully with better news.

-yMhU4IsWKYW1DodQmDRng.text: Excellent food, and an even better happy hour with dishes starting at $3.95, great place to come in a group and share there happy hour tapas. I enjoyed the spinach artichoke dip and the black pepper shrimp. We had a great server, Justin, great customer service! And to top it all off, the tiramisu... Words cant explain how delicious it was. It is very affordable during happy hour however the regular menu is a bit more pricy

6exEsvTnzlVcsraelNxoTQ.text: I visited this location and ate the Roasted Vegetable Spaghetti (Add chciken breast)on the recommendation of the server. The meal was very good. The service from Amanda F was great, super friendly and very efficient. The atmosphere was pleasing, modern, and the dining area was clean.

y4Utuw0bouYWir4m3mJRCQ.text: Let me start by saying that I like the Brio. It's really a nice venue and they have great outdoor patio seating. Also, their entrees are a cut above for an upscale fast casual restaurant, and their prices are reasonable. The entrees on my previous visits have been consistently good. Not so much on my latest visit. I ordered the Ham & Biscuit Benedict, $10.50 off the Brunch Menu. It consists of two poached cage free eggs, Cherrywood smoked ham, housemade biscuit and hollandaise, served with brunch potatoes. First, I was disappointed in the fact that my breakfast was not hot and was served cold. Bottom line, hot food should be served hot. The Cherrywood smoked ham had no flavor due to it being over cooked, as a result it was tough and chewy. Likewise, the house made biscuit was hard as a rock. On my previous visit their brunch potatoes were a big hit with everyone. This time they were over seasoned and very salty. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hollandaise was good. Two other people in our party had the same entree and made same or similar comments. Service was great. Our server was friendly and attentive. In closing, I recommend the Brio. However, I do not recommend this entree.

stpmACFhRz622ae_jJVgZw.text: My family and I literally didn't even get to sit at a table but the "We're just getting a table set for you." Yeah okay lady. 20 minutes later and still not seated! Nice. It was someone in a suit type thing that came up to us. Assuming she's a manager. The host and hostess both ended up seating a couple that came in 10 minutes after us. HA. What a joke. Off to cheesecake factory we went!

6cve1u8c6sMuFHLg3ZBcjA.text: My friend and I met at Brio for happy hour at the bar area.  Our server Jennifer was so friendly and attentive to our needs.  Made menu suggestions knowing I was a vegetarian.  She engaged in conversation knowing I was pregnant and was very sweet about it.  She also sent out an unexpected delightable, a small dessert with two candles, pink and blue.  I was throw off, how sweet Jennifer was to take the time to get a dessert from the kitchen and bring it to me.  Pink ad Blue candles, because she knew the sex was a surprise to us!!   Jennifer exceeded my expectations and make my experience memorable.    I work for Marriott and this is exactly what try to enstill in everyone's service delivery.  Well done!  I will be back!!

oyVxnsMNIyjktphdMq4CeQ.text: Came for happy hour and could not have asked for a better experience. It is worth mentioning, however, that happy hour usually PACKS the bar area... and in our case had to wait about 20 minutes for a table. If you are planning to come here for HH, show up right at the start so you can get a table right away.  We enjoyed some white peach sangria, mango mojitos, and appetizers, all of which were great. The spicy shrimp and Brio burger are by far the best dishes, but anything on the menu will be great for sharing at the table. Next time you are looking for an early dinner or share some drinks with friends, do stop by this awesome restaurant.

GR6xAayP7exUn-0SQzBqsQ.text: Our waiter was friendly, and recommended a few dishes for us to try. The food was good, but the restaurant was so dark we cld barely see what we were ordering nor what we were eating! One of my fav parts of dining there was the complementary bread basket ~it was good-hot fresh bread and crisps.

pUBmGeZV7ug13oK8LiME4A.text: I come here for happy hour often and in my opinion they're the best in Vegas! Great happy hour prices, wide selection  of drinks and plates, and big portions! This location doesn't hurt either ;)

OaG1GhhIjuO5BzM0MrtrDw.text: Brio is A-OK. Really nice patio seating with great friendly service. The chopped salad was decent...fresh and well dressed. The eggplant pomodoro was ok...could hardly tell the cooked-to-death mush inside was once eggplant, but it was edible. The pasta it came with was very good, perfectly cooked with a very nice balance of garlic, seasoning, and oil. Next time, I'll have a simple pasta dish; they seem to know their pasta. The desserts were very good. I had the mocha pannacotta, and my friends had tiramisu and choc lava cake...all very, very good.   I can't give it more than a solid 3-star rating (this review ain't bad overall...it's just that mushy low-flavor eggplant that's sticking in my craw...maybe when I go back I'll be able to push it to 4 stars if I'm a big fan of whatever I order then). Still, it's a decent enough eatery at a decent enough price to go back.

vr7PPxgOg59umr0uy31jMg.text: Excellent Service!  Alberto made great recommendations.  Food was delicious---excellent red sauce---had calamari, tomato soup, margarita flatbread and spaghetti.  Enjoyed our experience.  Will be back and ask for Alberto!

CSYp7OBvEPj2NipiAFQgRQ.text: Have had many good meals here. Great service. Tonight was not one of them. We ordered Grilled Lamb Chops and Gorgonzola Crusted Bistecco. Sauces didn't melt in and the meat was very tough for both meals. Sorry.

jsIbgM5t2S4LSs2Ez3UbIg.text: I typically shy away from chain Italian especially in Vegas but Brio is always a favorite for a casual meal with great food. I love their beef carpaccio, the presentation is awesome, it's like boat of beef. I enjoyed the chicken and quinoa salad. The chicken was a little cold and overdone, but it totally satisfied my cravings. I love their bread too, for some reason it's so addicting. The service was nice, cook time on the food was a little long especially for a party of 6 (mostly salads), but I love the environment and the parking is easy.

anObQNpBp8_eHT77Ri9TdA.text: We only went for happy hour, but we spent $35 between the three of us and left stuffed. The ravioli was out of this world! I will go back just for that and also the eggplant fries. Everything was so good! No drinks this time, but I'll try them next time :)

ruBZcg1ayaAYR89CRiFUww.text: Spent last Saturday cruising the Tivoli Village Farmer's Market and once we'd loaded up on Kettle corn and asparagus, we decided to grab a bite to eat.  Having dined at the Brio in Town Square, and enjoyed it several times, we decided to give this location a go.  The patio was lovely at 11am on a Saturday. We managed to get there before the rush, so we had our pick of seats and it was quiet and very relaxing.   Our server wasn't the best in the world. He was a tall slim guy (though all the servers seemed to be super tall and slim) with a huge band-aid on the side of his neck. I assume this was to cover some kind of tattoo, but it wasn't that appetizing, i'll be honest.  However, because he was so soft spoken and meek, I thought maybe he had some kind of life-saving throat or neck surgery and cut him some slack.  His service was super slow and he forgot about us a few times, but I refused to let it ruin the brunch and let Mr. Potential Cancerous Goiter and/or Criss Angel Tattoo off without griping.  The peach bellini is TO DIE for. So good and comes in a giant pint glass. I thought it was going to be a simple bellini in a champagne flute, but no, this was like a booze slurpee. For $7. I'll have two next time.  I had the eggs benedict, which was absolutely delicious. The grilled asparagus that came with it was gone in 30 seconds. I like my poached eggs on the medium-well side and mine came so runny they were almost cold inside (which I realize is how some folks like them). But the manager, who happened to be walking by, had them remake them, despite my protests. She was really attentive and personable. I should've gotten her name -- she's got long dark hair and blue eyes, kinda on the wee side.  I'd definitely go back to this location, especially  for brunch. There's some berry stuffed french toast I've got my eye on...

zf2o3T9h8uGP_cL7tQy-3g.text: I'll save you time having to read the rest of this review with this right here:  Good food Small portions Big forks  If you want to continue...this place is pretty tasty and for franchised Italian I'd place it above Carraba's and way above the Italian Denny's they call the Olive Garden.  So why 3 stars?  I felt the portions were really small compared to what I can get at a mom and pop Italian joint...perhaps two ravioli entrees for one person would have been sufficient. Also, although the flavor was excellent, I found the sauce accompanying the lobster and shrimp dish a little watery, but the shrimp on top of the raviolis were cooked perfectly. My date liked her Ravioli alla vodka but felt it was small for a dinner portion.  Also the warm bread wasn't bad but wasn't anything amazing and the butter wasn't soft...and the atmosphere is a little dark, but I guess that's what they're going for.  On a bright note, the food came out fast, the waiter was attentive and I went during "Ravioli Week" so the 50% off was a great deal...had I walked out hungry paying the normal price of $55 (tax+tip) for two small ravioli dishes I'd have felt ripped.  Did I mention I like their big forks?

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli alla vodka
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster shrimp ravioli
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bread basket

gI2_nNkdvDllqRXhSYmHbA.text: The food is great but the hosts are nasty. At the Brio's entrance two young guys (host) giving arrogant look and waited until we ask them for the table. Excuse me, not me, they have to be hospitable to ask if we want to have a table. Anywhere in Italian restaurant hostess speak first not the guests.

74PrwY9sOo255Kg64NZL2A.text: Went for dinner at Brio after a symphony at Tivoli event, I had made reservations. Once at the restaurant thank God for the reservation because it was extremely busy, the hostess was a little on the not so nice side but it was fine, we waited for about 15minutes and then got seated. We ordered the eggplant with shrimp and oh my God this appetizer is delicious. For dinner I got the salmon dish which was pretty good and the bf got the shrimp and lobster fettuccine which was delicious also. Definitely recommend this place, food is great.

c228JXROHs_oqS7THRL-pg.text: Food has never failed on my visits to Brio. Since we had such a rainy day yesterday I craved non other than than their famous Lobster Bisque-a harvest colored creamy goodness in a cup. I always order this and so should you.  Sauvignon Blanc was crisp and cold, warm sourdough bread basket was a perfect compliment. We shared some Caprese-sliced buffalo chunky tomatoes, olive oil, drops of balsamic vinegar and arugula was fresh and a perfect start.    The hubby can't resist a wedge salad and I can't resist trying it. The creamy blue-cheese dressing was mild and the big slice of ice-burg was covered in bacon bits, tomatoes and onion. MMM.  Service was friendly and atmosphere always lovely.  I'll be back.

hMQ2ejhzr32XOYAGI-jR8g.text: I love this place atmosphere. The food was delicious  and service was quick. Also one of my friend can't  eat gluten but they had gluten-free food. Definitely we will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

00LwaikD0E7RyTIjEfN6Vw.text: As good as it gets.We're in town for the Drags and staying near this area. Our server Frank was friendly, informative and efficient. The food was delicious and presented well. The Salmon fresca was absolutely delicious. The chopped and wedge salad both had a perfect combination of ingredients and dressing. We plan on eating there again tomorrow. Highly recommended!!

toZjxB6uUiByqCXWbMFeZQ.text: Seated immediately. Food was tasty. Waited 20 mins to place order for apps and wine(single glass of wine came out after food, only because I reminded it hadn't come) at happy hour when it wasn't even busy outside. Over an hour and a half total at the table, never once got asked if we wanted to order dinner and/or dessert. Took 30 mins to get bill after we had noticeably been done eating, well, done eating all that we were able to order. Never a single water or soda refill either. By the time we finally got checked on, I asked for check as it was getting busy and no way I was going to wait even longer to maybe get dinner. Love the happy hour menu, but not sure I'll be back.

3ufTK2lKfyWUP0GhrdYTSQ.text: Wanted to give Brio another try with my family joining me Thursday evening for dinner and drinks. The first time we went the food was very good, but the service was terrible at best. Had to ask for everything from utensils, napkins, water numerous times, and they forgot part of our order and still charged us for it. This all occurred in the bar area on a weekend so we decided to give it a try in the dining room on a weekday. Totally different experience... the food was very good and the service was excellent. Glad we gave Brio's another shot.... we will just avoid the bar area and go to their dining area during the week!!!

QuRQu6-38RgNH4gxD85-5Q.text: We went on the Saturday of a holiday weekend and was surprised to get a patio table with shade. We sat across from the fountain so it had a great vibe. We initially had a concern due to a holiday special two for one for brunch and was told by the waitress that it only covered the specific brunch items not the brunch menu. The manager came over to clarify that it did indeed cover any items on the brunch menu up to $15. I ordered the Pesto Chicken and Quinoa Salad and loved it. The menu states all ingredients and the calories which is helpful in making decisions. It was so filling that I had to take some home. The staff was super friendly and the bread before the meal must be one of the best in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan Chicken Quinoa Salad with an herb creamy dressing and lots of veggies

pi80l5aR7ElGJhXF7LncoQ.text: -Sunday Dinner -  The Good:      The ambiance is very classy and comfortable. The food is presented nicely and is tasty. Options to eat inside or outside .  I enjoyed the teas, although my husband wasn't to crazy about them (to each is their own).  The Bad:  This place is a bit more upscale then traditional restraunts. Prices for plates range in the 20+ neiboorhood.  It was also noisy.  The Ugly:           Slow service.  This place was busy , we did make reservations and we're seated promptly outside as requested. The location of the seating was close to the walkway along with many other tables. The servers rush powerfully through these isles making for a very uncomfortable hazardous experience to anyone seated along the walkway .    The service also wasn't great, after we were seated we weren't greeted for quite a while .   The wait in between was bad to, we waited almost 10 minutes to order desert, after ordering we waited another 15 minutes for a piece of cake. It was a bit irritating so we caught our server and said forget it , please just bring the check.  Then proceeded to once again wait a while for a check.    Overall yes I will be back, we enjoyed the environment and the food.  We will just be more cautious of our server.

B753hNCAhRCC7IhxmSaivw.text: We had been to the sister restaurant in Town Square and food is always good there. Was running errands this side of town and decided to stop for happy hour. The staff was friendly and service was prompt. Food was delicious and portion was good size. Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shrimps, Spinach &amp; Artichoke Dip and Magherita Flatbread

GQ-vZQkOe8lD8RMmmNhyCQ.text: Great food....HORRIBLE service. Placed a take out order and showed up at the time on their website & they VERY RUDELY told me it wouldn't be ready for another half hour. Disappointing!!!!

lSh8exTqKV69zu8lwT4qxg.text: This is probably the best Happy Hour in town. I've been a handful of times and I'm always impressed by the friendly staff at the bar and how delicious the food is. The Warm Margherita Dip is addicting and they make great cocktails! However, we had dinner in the dining room last night and it was a complete mess. We waited 25 minutes for a table, despite having a reservation. The male host really wasn't even apologetic. He had a huge attitude and said that reservations made on Open Table aren't "guaranteed." That's funny because I've made reservations through Open Table for years, and at some of the nicest places on the Strip. Never heard that one before! Then dinner just took FOREVER and our waiter wasn't that friendly. It was at least 30 minutes before we were able to order. But like I said, we ended the night back in the bar area and they were incredibly accommodating and fun, everyone had a blast. Moral of the story: stick to Happy Hour at Brio. Go somewhere else for dinner.

Av8eWbB5YzEgSGl02eqxMQ.text: Sad day for me today service has never been bad today it was awful what's up brio I don't know how many people I've told about the great service there and today I got treated like a dog yesterday my bar tab was $17 and I left a $10 tip the same guy behind the bar was there they treated me like you didn't even know me we have gone there probably 25 times in the last 4 months oh well maybe we'll try one more time see if it gets any better

sOZXw-cZHydWFja0QsFtqA.text: Came here two days in a row! First on a Friday during Happy hour with Nieves D. One of the best HH I've had.   HH specials are for food & drinks and it's from $4-$6 which is a pretty good deal with the amount of food they give you! For foods we got Beef Cappaccio, Crispy Eggplant fries, black pepper shrimp, Crispy cheese ravioli, and Roasted garlic spinach artichoke dip. All oh so delicous! My favorite would have to be the Crispy eggplant fries which is pretty crazy because I do NOT like eggplant at all. Also I think the Crispy Cheese Ravioli was to die for. It wasn't too cheesy, it was the perfect amount of cheesiness!   For drinks we got White Peach Sangria, Sangria Rosa, & Mango Mojito. I really liked the Sangria Rosa. Now it's really not real sangria because real sangria is fruits marinated in wine but they just put some fruit in a cup & add wine with vodka. Still good tho.  Best bartender there, hands down is Geoffrey. He accomodated each of our needs. When the door was open and the wind was blowing our hair all over our faces, he shut the doors. We were right under the AC vents which was blowing cold a** air right on top of us making us shiver uncontrollably, he made the waiters turn the vents off. He also made us his speciality shots, on the house!   2nd time I went was the next day for brunch. Not as good as Happy Hour. I got the Salmon with Angel Hair with Lobster Bisque. Was not that good. It had a sauce that was kind of on the sour side.  & the lobster bisque was on the salty side. There was a fly buzzing around our table that was annoying me!   This place would be a solid 5 star rating for me if I did not come back for brunch the next day. None the less, I would probably return for HH again!

Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH

BKiWI5SBJEGt1s36A4ZIVw.text: Very professional service and food. I came for the cool location. Outdoors can actually get noisy so if you dont like it too loud, avoid.

4AwfuBb5dW7UorXsvme6aA.text: Amazing food. Best risotto I've ever had ordered risotto with shrimp, did not disappoint. Amazing wonderful beautiful delicious. Also ordered lobster bisque, Lasagna, A few other things. Everything was excellent, delicious. I make my own lobster bisque from scratch and have for many years, this was as good as mine. Rich and creamy, lobster flavor perfect, fresh. Little pieces of lump lobster in it wonderful.

1lqaXQYg7m3bGpEtRAvnrw.text: Went in for happy hour . Seated ourselves in a booth . Sat for 12 minutes before we were greeted . Sat 10 minutes before water , then asked to order . Waited about 45 minutes for our appetizers ...   Sat another 10 before we received any utensils to eat our food . Wanted ketchup ... waited 10 minutes before our waiter told us they are out of ketchup LOL .   Honestly it was slow service and ok food .... waited wasn't nice or rude .  Probably don't be back .

kBnert3Lp3tyHMtYiQhyWQ.text: I chose this place as my wedding lunch reception back in October. They were great and the food was delicious. My guests loved everything they ordered and the staff tended to everyone in a timely fashion. To this day, my friends and family still talk about it. I'd highly recommend them for reception lunch or dinner.

Q9HH2NrwZIPC5Z08vBckTA.text: We made reservations for our kids for homecoming very far in advance. When they got called for their  table, they gave them one outside. When I questioned the host about it he said he wouldn't seat them inside until 9??? I told him we had made the reservation over 3 weeks ago. He said the app we used allows them to choose where they seat us. I told him to go ahead and seat the girls to which he replied something muffled but I heard the word "rude". I asked him to repeat himself and he doubled down saying clearly that he didn't like dealing with rude people. My husband and I had made a reservation on the same app for the same time but waited 15 more minutes to get our table. Turns out, my husband and I were afforded the opportunity to eat inside the restaurant. When we walked to our table, we noticed the place was empty. When we finished eating, there were still empty tables that hadn't been sat the whole time we were there. The girls outside were ignored most of their dinner. It looked like their server may have had her hands too full and the girls were cold. I'm bummed because there aren't many gluten free restaurants in town so we are already limited in our choices. Hence the month ahead reservation. At this point, there's no food in the world that tastes good enough for a crappy attitude employee. If you can't handle the heat, get out of the kitchen. I guess they have enough business that they don't care if they lose any but we won't be back. Especially not for a special occasion. Tsk tsk

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iv7TexkMojgqPVnlPu8Jpw.text: Nice place..great svc. brad the  server wa great . Yes, food was good. veal marsala with pasta.  the. ac could have worked better. My friends chicken dish was fine; No free birthday dessert,   boo.

06J0wiTosadSg9cAMI44FA.text: Food was cold today and pizza should be hot.  Service was so slow,  by the time it was fixed I wasn't hungry.  Sad cause food and service usually pretty good.

p-OybvgnmN6o0_ilFehC9w.text: I would give this place more than five stars if I could. The food is so delicious, and their outside patio is awesome! I love the pasta alla vodka. They have so many amazing appetizers too. The shrimp and eggplant, and calamari are my favorites. The service here is beyond great. My husband and I spent three hours here on our first date, and eat here at least once a month.  Everything has always been perfect.

1RZsYOvV94CDGHADNfWlYA.text: The only reason I put 4 stars was because we sat in the happy our section outside and it took awhile for a waiter to come help us,but once Frank came all was well. He was a very nice waiter and our food and drinks came out fast. The service was great and the food was delicious. The happy hour menu is definitely worth while. We ordered the Brio burger which was perfectly cooked. We also ordered the eggplant fries, spinach artichoke dip,the sausage and pepperoni ricotta flatbread and the creme brulee for dessert. Everything tasted wonderful. We would come back again for everything! I loved the food and the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gci1wtY9_ylfSL4YbrEkeg.text: I ate there on the 4th of July and the service was excellent they had a special running with salad dinner and dessert only $30 the food was excellent worth quite a bit more than the $30 we paid for it my girlfriend me my mother and father all we're stuffed afterwards and decided the food was the best we had a long time the dessert was absolutely incredible the service was speeding the server was polite and pleasant all in all a fantastic restaurant in the Fantastic location Tivoli square is a beautiful little shopping area so much nicer than some of the other locations in the valley

41rryGpVIJWrKuVulM3Ivw.text: The dining room is comfortable and offers a variety of seating. Also there is a shaded outdoor patio. Happy Hour  lounge indoor and outdoor seating  is a great deal with food and drinks. On this visit we had dinner in the dining room. The room was conversation friendly. For a starter we chose the Bruschetta Quattro which was wonderful. Our entrees were the Chicken Limone and Cioppino. The Chicken was a large portion, very moist and perfectly cooked. The Cioppino arrived with 2 clams and 1 mussel that were not open. Our waitress apologized and reported the problem to the chef. She returned with a large plate of clams and mussels and again apologized. The Cioppino had a good variety of seafood and I would order it again. Overall Brio has a large menu with something for everyones taste. The service is professional and timely.

5NGJH8Z_gDQxr63284YVnA.text: I can't believe I'm doing this but they deserve it after my latest dining experience. I went to Brio last Sunday because I needed that steak salad again. I was so disappointed this time! The salad greens were as delicious as ever. I don't know what's in that dressing but I could drink that stuff! But the steak this time. Oh, that steak. It was terrible. I've noticed the portion size of the steaks shrinking over the last few months but this was nearly half the size it used to be! And the perfect medium rare at which it's typically served was more like well well. Dry, hard, completely void of flavor. I honestly don't think I'll ever order it again. And that's sad. So very sad.

8Q3uMdPqFL5xvfC0ufo_lg.text: Service was amazing, server was an act in himself with my shot-drinking girlfriends at brunch. Lobster bisque was incredible. Loved everything!!

cXkeafsKB1IPf0iu89nQOA.text: Dined at Brio last night with my husband to celebrate our anniversary. When we checked in with the hosts, they asked us if we were celebrating anything and we informed them of our anniversary and they congratulated us and made us feel like we were royalty. They sat us in a nice big booth, so big we could have had other diners join us! I ate the Gorgonzola medallions and let me tell you, they were AMAZING! The meat was so tender and tasty my mouth is watering just talking about it. My husband ordered the Lobster and shrimp fettuccine and he loved it, he cleaned the plate off. the manager kiya (im sorry if i chopped that up) came up to our table while we were eating our entrees and checked on us and made sure everything was on point and she also congratulated us for our special occasion. Our waiter Pedro was one of the best servers ive ever had! He was attentive to us the moment we sat down, friendly, and made sure we had a great experience. The atmosphere at brio is lovely and comfortable. Im glad we decided to go to brio to celebrate, we definitely plan on going back very soon. Thank you Brio!!

ea8jta2spziMUgH13bKVsA.text: I love going to Brio's happy hour ! There are select plates for $3.95 and mojitos for $5.00. I typically get the burger ,crispy shrimp and the pizza. It works out great because my coworkers can order one item each and we just share of each others plates. The Mojitos really hit the spot after a long day at work . They are nice and sweet! The patio area also has comfy couches you can sit on but I would suggest bringing sunglasses when dining in the patio area because the sun can be  quite strong. Brio has the cheapest Happy Hour I have experienced. You would think for the price they would skimp on the food but their portions are big enough to share!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KnY4Uj8csKvKvsJ2rLmpSg.text: Worse meal I've ever had. After a hard week at work, I was hoping for a nice meal to relax.  Was told their salmon is no longer fresh but farm raised,  server told us not to try their cod.  We ordered the fish and chips.  It came greasy, dipped in oil, and my husbands portion was partly frozen,  we were told it was fresh.  Yeah, freshly frozen.  I was afraid to order anything else but my husband opted for a cup of soup and I had the Caesars salad.  Part of the lettuce was wilted and couldn't eat it.  Hostess had the nerve to tell us we weren't charged for the fish and chips.  Why would we when it was so bad we couldn't eat it.   No care in their preparation and customer service sucked,  now I know why the place is empty but weeday nights. Horrible,

-F-PAjbY9vHB2dUsPIzlnw.text: Great lunch at brio! Get the quino and chicken salad and skip the fruti de Mara. Really nice atmosphere

0IBOWlBas_hePe6SPKu0EA.text: Service top notch! The food was right on point! App's were fast and delicious.  Live music added so much!!

jswlIY33vbTYHfN-jZqUAw.text: Ordered Togo they didn't provide me with everything I asked for. Spoke to a manager she sent out a gift card. Next visit I ate there.. my server was so hard to reach and on top of that my son had a bug in his drink. The server didn't apologize nor did the manager and she also knew about it. Food is good, but I don't recommend this location. Town square a much better option.

xMZ7o7p2JNo1ahJj41xVWA.text: I used to go to the brio in town square every time I was in town, but this one is just as good, without the crowd. And it's closer to where I stay.   PS...I've recently stopped eating meat. When I ordered my usual dish (a pasta with chicken, pine nuts, tomatoes, idk what it's called but it's delicious) but asked for it without chicken, the waiter asked if I wanted to sub anything in it's place. Yes please! I asked for eggplant. I think I enjoyed it more with the eggplant than I ever did with the chicken. Hopefully if I end up at another location at some point they will do the same.

6R6pidn-bZ8doVRID7hKCQ.text: Terrible service! Called in an order was told 15 min so I waited 10 before driving giving 25-30min time I understand it's busy dinner hour on a Friday.  When I walk in the hostess is polite tell her I'm here to pick up etc.. she takes my cash money says I'll be right back going to grab the food... now this is where we start going wrong.. their are to go orders in the corner but I don't say anything, she comes back says it's almost done perfect!.... 10 min go by 2 people who ordered amazon come and go me on the other hand nothing, so I ask excuse me  any info on that order she asks me was it on amazon... I just gave you cash and you said my food was almost done how And why are we talking about amazon. She says the manager is taking care of it so it will be another 10 min! Nope I ask for my money back she has the nerve to ignore me go sit a table. I keep asking for my money without becoming angry because it's just food but ALL OF SUDDEN. My food appears no manager (even tho he came up looked at me and walked back) NEVER AGAIN BRIO SORRY SERVICE !!!

2Wl2Py3WYPMCesuJuJ2IRg.text: I always enjoy this very pleasant atmosphere at brio and my spaghetti with spicy sauce I come here for a special occasion to spend time with my family

qIFrCDO0JgFJwtgKR06gvg.text: Happy hour specials are great :) that's what keeps us coming back. Service here is normally on point. Last weekend we definitely had a hiccup. 4:30 after work on Friday. We were brought appetizer plates that had already been used and a clean plate was put on top. I addressed it with the manager and he comped a couple of the appetizers. Service wasn't very good. We were on the patio and I had to go inside to request service twice. Bummer :(   Food is delicious and I absolutely love Peroni. We will keep coming back for that. Hopefully service will be on point next visit.

u36K5rvvFFzRn1QbDwFTCQ.text: My 93 year-old Father-in-Law, husband and I have lunch every Thursday somewhere in town and Brio is one of our favorites.  Not only is the Valet parking virtually right outside their entrance to make it convenient for Dad's walker (and stamina), the greeting we received by the host and hostess was genuine.  From the moment we sat down the waiter and other staff were very attentive and made us feel welcomed.  From the outrageously good sourdough bread to the coffee at the end of the meal, we enjoyed our time together in a relaxing, beautiful atmosphere.  Thank you Tom (our waiter) and Jesse (manager) for a special day at your fine restaurant.  We will continue to come back more often.

oEzgXYD6pfHWSGhPTMcMuQ.text: We have been going to Brio in Tivoli Village since it opened. It's the place we bring the many guests that come to visit us in Las Vegas and they always tell us we made a great selection in choosing Brio. We recently went to Brio with friends from Florida. From the moment we were seated we were impressed with the attentiveness of our server Bre, the presentation and flavor of the food.  Our guests were raving about the service we received and the beautiful atmosphere . Having spent several years in Italy during my military career, I know excellent Italian food when I taste it and Brio has it all together. A nice  touch was added by Brio Manager Prado who stopped by to ask if we were satisfied with our service and food. With so many restaurants in the surrounding area to choose from, there is little wonder why we choose Brio when we are looking for an exceptional night out

brtMoc3ou6U7dmPp4I4_kw.text: Every time I go to this location I've always received the best service, the food is very good as well. One of my favourite menu items I always get when I come in is the Carpaccio, very fresh , good quality beef with a small salad in the middle with crackers for the beef. I always try to leave room for the desserts as they always have something that catches my eye, and I'm usually not a sweets eater.  I really like the decorations and rustic Italian theme they have throughout the restaurant and the location is a very good location by nearby shops and restaurants.

a4ffp7bIlUj1Zdz0N-ZN8w.text: Service was good. Our server Cinamin was friendly. The restaurant setting is absolutely beautiful especially outside on the patio. Personally, for my taste, the food lacks something. I had the chicken limone and just thought the chicken lacked seasoning. However I did enjoy the shrimp and eggplant appetizer as well as the white sangria.

RQuiNlXcb4O8CI0PMp8VOQ.text: I went for dinner Thursday night and all I can say is wow, food was amazing and service was awesome, I had white sangria and sangria rosa I believe was the name of it, my date ordered the lobster bisque and the calamari and it was to die for   For our entrees he got the lasagna and I got the balsamic short ribs with creamy polenta on the bottom... the whole meal was superb. Then to top it off, our awesome waitress suggested dessert so we got the chocolate cake with vanilla gelato  it was the end to a very good dinner. Three things will draw me right back 1 - the food is awesome 2 - the restaurant is beautiful  3 - service was excellent (I forgot the name of our waitress but she was super nice and attentive)

R0w8uA5QGunvThKzDGNaBw.text: Stopped by yesterday for Happy Hour; the bar was packed. Seating was only available outside. The staff was giving disclaimers about how busy they were and service would take some time. Despite the disclaimer the server did her best to serve me with a smile and provide a satisfactory experience.   My only complaint is the lack of misters on the patio. This is Vegas, misters are a necessity.  By the way the eggplant and shrimp is the best

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fm6uws7bFa-pJYRJbYPWLA.text: So the management team from Bri Tuscan Grill contacted me after my review. The manager  listened to what I had to say and was truly concerned that it wasn't the best experience. Which I appreciated. They asked that I try the restaurant again and give them the opportunity to show me their great service and gave me a gift card. I appreciated the call and will definitely give the restaurant another chance.

A2chDAlTrqKe4DLDQ7pytw.text: We have enjoyed several favorite dishes at Brio for years. Since the new management all of our family's favorites are off the menu.   Miss the delicious Brio steak salad!! This is a favorite of mine and many girl friends. The new one is so boring.  Also the salmon Fresca was amazing. No more.  And the saddest loss is the bruschetta Quattro !! . Sad when places change their menu so drastically.

sqk1T1ZaAMA-otePfbxXRg.text: I've been going to Brio for HH for a number of years....a couple times a month....nice venue,good service.   I went tonight and the HH menu has completely changed....not for the better.   The crisp flatbread pizza is gone; it's now 4 pieces of frozen pizza.  The great hamburger is gone. The spinach dip is gone.  The calamari was so heavily breaded you couldn't taste any calamari.   So sad that they messed with a good thing.  I, nor my friends, will be back.   The menu is much smaller now than it used to be.   Usually, by 5pm, the place is crowded....not tonight....almost empty.  It was raining, but I think they have lost long-time customers....they certainly lost me!  Too many other good places to go.....won't waste my time coming here again!  So sad.

prNwKYoYeRWicxc_wJ076g.text: Took my Mom to Brio for Mother's Day. I came from out of town and hadn't made reservations. We showed up about 10:15 AM. It was reservation only but there was seating in the bar. We were pleased to see that our table in the bar was of normal height and not having to sit at a bar height table. It actually felt like we were sitting in the restaurant. We started off with a Mimosa (I ended up having 2) and a Bloody Mary. At eight dollars a pop, the Bloody Mary was worth it and the Mimosa was pretty small. It was small but it was delicious. Fresh OJ, perfect amount of champs, too. Service was impeccable. Friendly, and quick. I ordered the vegetable omelette and my mom had the shrimp and polenta (what Brio calls grits). Both were very good. The omelette was straightforward, fresh veggies (mushrooms broccoli, peppers) in an egg white wrap. Served with fresh fruit which was fresh and crisp (pineapple, split grapes and strawberries). The brown sauce on the shrimp and grits was tasty. I'm giving this five stars because the service was excellent, the food was good and the drinks were delicious (albeit pricey). Total bill $61.00 + tip. Mother's Day, no reservation, Tivoli Village. Not bad. The overall experience on such a busy day could not have been better. We will definitely be back for their happy hour.

5FKw1wR26nAFi8CdOC6dMw.text: Horrible service, it was my second time I was excited to bring my mom here for her birthday but the service just sucked!  We came in around 7pm & was seated right away. Our table was far from everyone else kinda in a corner but 20 mins after they sat a bigger party on our side. But it felt like we didn't matter, kinda felt embarrassed bringing my mom here for her birthday.   Our server couldn't remember her name but she would forget things, they were having specials about steak and lobster that we were interested in she had told us she'll bring us the brochure never did, when we asked her for it she said there wasn't any left but I don't think she bothered to check... It took 40 minutes for our food to come out, at the 30 min mark she asked how was everything? All they brought out was our soup & salad, we had asked where our food has been she had no idea.. she knew we were frustrated so she had her manager Hannah apologize to us... but what's apologize going to do when everyone is starving on top of that getting horrible customer service?? She also kept refilling the coke my sister had ordered but not once refilled our water until we finally had ask the MANAGER.  Over all not a good experience coming from a restaurant like this...

K3bxtDk9uDAlSEXjKHRYpA.text: Black pepper shrimp are craaaaaazyyyyy. My favorite dish with a couple of beers. Happy hour is super worth it. Service is good and atmosphere is very much my style!

1WoXb8M09MKBRglriK01aw.text: Big fan of this restaurant! First time at this location and it won't be my last. We started with the Roasted Garlic, Spinach, and Artichoke Dip with a Parmesan Flat Bread. One of the best I've had; the ones I usually get are too salty and lacking in flavor, but this one was perfect.  As an entree I got the Pasta Pesto, my father got the Pasta Brio (his go to), and our friends got the Ravioli di Bello, and Balsamic Braised Beef Short Rib.   The Pasta Pesto was amazing. Didn't want too hardy of a sauce and too much food so this dish was perfect. It had a light sauce (since usually pasta dishes have too much). The Pasta Brio...there is no wrong with this dish! Again, not an overwhelming sauce, portion is bigger than the Pasta Pesto, but perfect for eating it the next day. I can't vouch for the Short Rib and Ravioli, but I know our friends enjoyed it VERY much.   Our waiter was great. He made the experience even better. Great recommendations, very personable, made us feel very welcomed. Also, it was my Aunt's birthday 2 days prior and we mentioned it casually and he ended up bringing a small dessert for her without us even asking. Haven't had service like this for a while.

iCOAPqVuWB0f4gBehfvbDw.text: Brio hands down is fantastic. From this location, patio, bar and restaurant, food and drinks, we always find ourselves coming back here. We either sit on the patio or at the bar when Mandi is working. She's so awesome and pays equal attention to all of her guests. Very down to earth with a fun personality. Her espresso martinis are one of the best. Trust me on that! The food has never once when disappointing and the flour less chocolate cake is one of the best! Also to note they offer a rewards program! They have an AWESOME Happy Hour with food and drinks. Plz check out the menu as there is almost something for everyone. The patio is casual with tables and also offer laid back lounging with cushion patio furniture.   Also note the patio is not puppy friendly so no pooches allowed there.  Other then that this restaurant is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable omelet

pOLtk4Bak_MOvbEIckjsIA.text: I ate here tonight with a few of my team members from work.   I remember eating here about 4 years ago but wasn't impressed at the time so I hadn't been back. Tonight I was pleasantly surprised.   The location is one of the best things about this restaurant. It is located in the heart of the beautiful Boca Park directly across from the complimentary valet in the south entrance round-about.   We ordered a round of the Watermelon Berry Mojito special. The drink was poured well with balanced flavors and fresh ingredients (not from a premixed bottle). The fresh watermelon in the drink was delicious. At only $5 a glass I was impressed.   They bring complimentary bread and Parmesan crackers with butter for the table and we ordered the red pepper bruschetta. The bruschetta was tasty and had a good bread to topping ratio and the bread wasn't overtly crusty which I appreciated.   I ordered the Pasta Alla Vodka which was a ricotta-filled ravioli in the shape of pouches with spicy tomato Parmesan cream sauce and basil. Surprisingly the ravioli pouches were soft and creamy and appeared to be house made. The sauce was all around pretty tasty.   One coworker ordered the Crab Cakes which came with roasted vegetables, crispy fingerling potatoes, and creamy horseradish. He ate the whole thing and said he enjoyed it very much.   Our two other coworkers ordered the Pan Roasted Talapia and the Ravioli di Portobello. They said they liked it as well.  Our server Frank had great energy and had good suggestions for food and drinks. When we had completed our meal Frank took the time to shake each of our hands.

m9vqgzdT5OnFOLe4NF51_g.text: Brio changed up the happy hour menu. It's not as good as it use to be otherwise they are very consistent , the service and decor live up to my expectations, I am vegetarian so there is a decent amount of tasty dishes I can try I would rate it 4.5 if I could but overall it's a good place to grab some lunch at. Get some Shrimp Capri it won't disappoint your taste buds.

8nA8UhqJ1942RU-o5itkHg.text: This review is based solely on their Happy Hour, which is one of my favorites in town! I usually go here whenever I just want to grab some refreshing sangrias and a quick bite with a friend.   Their HH is Monday-Friday 3:30-6:30pm and their reverse HH is 9pm-close. Keep in mind that it can get busy and seating at the bar, tables and booths are first come, first served. However, there have been a few times where it gets too packed in the bar area that the server will accommodate my party and I and we get to sit in the main restaurant area even though we are doing happy hour, which I really appreciate!   Their cocktails range from $4-6 and each food item on the HH menu range from $5-6 which are GREAT deals! The drinks are delicious and can be pretty strong (especially their sangrias lol) so they don't cheap you out on getting your alcohol on!   White peach sangria, the Moscow Mule, and the Black Raspberry Cosmo are my favorites and a must try!   For food: Very shareable! We usually like to just order a few items and will be stuffed by the end of the meal. Our favorites include the Black Pepper Shrimp, Brio Burger (omg so good!) and the Margherita Flatbread. All super yummy, filling, and satisfying.  Their service is always really great and they even have a rewards card that you might want to get to stack up some points.   With that said, if you're looking for a good place to get your Happy Hour on, definitely go to Brio!

dq30Vus4Fs05foTg0BNPcg.text: I even have a Brio card. I never had such AWFUL service as we did today.  I looked around, and it was empty. It was lunch time on a busy shopping Saturday, and yet there were hardly any customers.  Yet our service was HORRIBLE!  BIFF our server took our order, never came back with any bread. Soup order should COME RIGHT OUT?  It never did. My usually patient husband got so fed up after asking Biff for our bread, and he said yes , but walked the OTHER WAY!   My husband walked out!    We ate at the new Giordano's and it was AMAZINGLY GREAT FOOD, and GREAT SERVICE...   Wake UP BRIO!  You should treat your customers, like you want them to come back!

xkLvNtwIy-hTcwNXUEjTMQ.text: Boys love brio. Cinnamin was fabulous! Food was fabulous!! Bringing out pizza dough to keep crazy kids calm, fabulous!!! Thank you Brio.

2txdnnHyOW_GYjrX-A3_PQ.text: The new management is horrible the menu is completely different my food came out horrible. I'm very unhappy with my visit. I would not come back to this restaurant anymore.

GtZKJwAKSMmQA6UW2MSo-w.text: Really 2.5 stars...  Ok. I would definitely say do not come on a holiday. We came here for Father's Day. I made reservations a good week in advance knowing that it would be busy. We were seated 10 min after our reservation time which was 11:30. Our server did take our drink order fairly quickly about 10 min after we were seated and took our food orders about 20 min after that. I knew it would be busy so I expected to have some kind of wait. We were seated right next to the kitchen and so I could see what was happening. We finally got our food around 1 pm but the part about it that bothered me was that I could see my kids pizza sitting underneath the light for a good 20-30 min. In my opinion, I feel that they should have served that pizza right away since they know it's for a kid. So we finally got our food and it seemed like everyone enjoyed their food minus my kids because the pizza was rock hard. I made a comment to the server about it but he didn't respond. Ok, it's whatever at this point. I think there should be a better system when it's a holiday or just in general. Food shouldn't be sitting underneath that hot lamp for the long anyways! Overall, service was lacking (I was trying to find my server a few times to ask about the pizza and to get refills) but we only saw him twice after he gave us our entrees. I'm assuming it's better when it's not a holiday but I would definitely skip it on a holiday.

yCuk1URMLQcxNk56CrucxQ.text: The absolute WORST SERVICE EVER. The bartender seemed stressed out because she had guests at the bar and bar area and it took her frustration on the customers. ( wait, isn't that your job? To wait on guests?).... She seemed unfamiliar with the computer system and everything was just incredibly slow. Asked for bread about 5 times until asked a manager and he rudely brought it. Then another manager showed up to do nothing just to refill water. I'm not a chain restaurant type of person but was in the neighborhood and opted for this place as it looked nice from the outside. What a regretful experience. Food was mediocre, nothing special whatsoever.  So in a few words: Mediocre food Horrible service  Good bread Weak drinks Attitude from entire stuff. Do not waste your time and money going to Brio. They just do not have it together. Very unfortunate.  **** UPDATING THIS REVIEW TO A ZERO ****** nobody cares, nobody has reached out to me. No wonder their business is TERRIBLE. I emailed the " bot" that replied to this review and still waiting.

r6csKSwMNsqKeCYk-_mdKw.text: I love the food here, but the service is never good. We come  at least once a month, have different servers and it's still the same story every time. The water never gets refilled, we have to wait way too long to order and way too long to get our check.

4A954GizIdo5ATeJjLNLNA.text: Came back with a friend and had dinner here. Ordered the pesto pasta dish. I must say for under 700 calories it was delicious - especially for it being pasta and all the yummy stuff that came in it. Tried the Strawberry Fresca alcohol drink and that was good. Would like to try the Peach Sangria next time. Had to order the spinach artichoke dip from my last visit. Was as good as I remembered it. Thank you!

Ol18n1VZexShrG6xkvW1cg.text: Happy hour rocks!  The food is incredible and the price is right!   Beef Carpaccio - Field greens, capers, mustard aioli, Parmesan 3.95. My favorite!    Margherita Flatbread - Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh basil 3.95  Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread - Ricotta, Mozzarella, Provolone, housemade tomato sauce 4.95  BRIO Burger* - Provolone, roasted tomato mayonnaise, housemade chips 5.95  Tomato Mozzarella Salad - Vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh Mozzarella, field greens, basil, balsamic drizzle, lemon vinaigrette 4.95  And more.  Also, The Patio is great when the weather is nice.

WT8q-yRPOY9IWMjHsRan1w.text: My first time trying This restaurant and I looooved  it... First and foremost I had the best server his name is Frank he gave me and my family an excellent service, he was fast, he asked questions to see what I will like to eat, without asking he noticed that my moms water was almost finished he kept on coming and refilling our water. Frank is super friendly and has 5 star customer service skills. Thank you Frank.... it's not easy to satisfy my parents when we go to restaurants they always find something they are not happy about  the food but they loved the food in Brio it was delicious and we will be back soon...

63cWsa0ft_IBQNunvM3HCg.text: I feel I have given Tivoli Village long enough to get their shit straight. I don't know if the cost of rent in this place is so low it invites the kind of "who cares if it fails" culinary experimentation, or if it is so high restaurants are forced to try and sell you crap at a premium.   As an outside observer, it would seem as if Brio Tuscan Grille is the only restaurant that has managed to survive the Tivoli Village curse. Unfortunately, its mere survival does not preclude the fact that the restaurant as a whole is, well just blah. One look at the main photo on its Yelp page speaks volumes, the burger looks like something I would expect at my third cousin's "backyard birthday bonanza" for her 6 year old - they even cut it up in sections for the kiddies.  The food is not bad, and quite honestly I am impressed with the portion size of their appetizers, as they simply whet your appetite, not drown it. The unfortunate part is that the appetizers are only good if they are half off during happy-hour - I can't imagine paying full price for that. Which leads us to the rest of the menu, where the price points are where you would expect them to be if you were dining on the Strip. Not that I don't have great hope that Tivoli eventually becomes a great dining destination worthy of the high-dolar restaurants, but if it is Friday night and your place is half empty - well I'm just saying.  The service itself was okay, but one doesn't feel an abundance of warmth from the staff. Don't get me wrong, they did everything right and in a timely manner, it's just that there was no warmth there.  I won't go as far as to say that Brio Tuscan Grille is a disappointment, I just can't imagine waiting in line for this place, which is probably why there isn't one.

_RYNV4gavN30cbg3vOvOyA.text: Brio is the perfect place to have that romantic date you've been meaning to have with your significant other.  I went to the Summerlin location for Valentine's Day and was impressed. They take both reservations and walk-ins so lucky for us since we didn't make a reservation. The estimated wait time was 80 minutes? But we actually got in earlier, probably 30 to 40 minutes?  Anyways... We ate outside near a heat lamp which wasn't too bad in today's weather. We ordered calamari as our appetizer which was fine. I mean, it's calamari... Not much else to it. For our entrees, I got the pasta brio which is grilled chicken with rigatoni. My boyfriend got campenelle carbonara which kind of resembled chicken Alfredo. I also got a flirtini - probably won't get that again. It resembled cough syrup to me, but that could just be my taste buds.  All in all, for $67 this was definitely not a bad place for a date. We will probably check out the one in Town Square once the weather gets warmer since they have a fire pit outside.  Happy eatings!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flirtini my martini.
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari... yummy.
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Campenelle carbonara.

T9ZDox2BliEM48oZho_NlQ.text: So we are not big Town Square people, my man doesn't like crowds much so we don't go as often as I would like.  We were there for a specific item and decided to have a few drinks.  While having these drinks we wanted food.  Looking though the options we decided on Brio.  Which amazed and thrilled me, he doesn't like Italian (because he never knows what to order and picks the wrong stuff) I love Italian especially because I get it so rarely!   I got the caesar salad, yummy.  Perfect amount of dressing to food.  He got the Wedge Bistecca Insalata, he loves wedges so he was happy.  He finally followed my lead and got what I ordered, the Lobster & Shrimp Fettuccine.  His mouth watered when he saw it and he finished my leftovers when we got home.  So finally we can eat Italian and he will be happy, I can't wait to come back!

JWIMJA7tCv2FYRnxx2cyoA.text: Popped in here today for lunch with some coworkers- it's a lot closer to work than I thought! They were in an italian mood, but I was limiting carbs due to the night's Yelp Pizza Party, so I did not partake of any pasta during my visit.   Service was fairly good- our server was very friendly and made a bunch of helpful chit-chat with us, mostly bonding with my dining companions over their love of carbonara, and discussing the best places in LV to get it. I appreciated his honesty in that he did not try to BS us about how the dish here is the best there is or anything, but he did say it was good- he personally does not like the use of spinach in the dish, preferring beans, but it's not offered that way here.  As it is, I debated between a few dishes- the shrimp mediterranean in particular, caught my eye. But I ultimately opted for the soup and salad combo, with the wedge and the lobster bisque- the salad arrived already doused in a sea of dressing, which surely took it far beyond the listed calorie counts. The bisque was an odd dish- the first bite wasn't that great to me, and I considered asking to switch it out for the tomato, but as I ate more of the dish it grew on me. Guess I'm just not a lobster bisque person? Duly noted.  My coworkers both opted for the carbonara- and both were underwhelmed with it. The dishes were huge, and they easily could have shared a single order instead of getting separate dishes, but one dish had overcooked pasta that was borderline mushy while the other was a good al dente. Both ladies were underwhelmed by their selection and had buyer's remorse, of a sort- commenting that they wished they'd gone with their original choices, but felt like the dish would be better here given the conversation with our server. Womp womp.  Seems like this place is best for a happy hour visit- I may need to take advantage of that, but I don't think I'm likely to return for lunch.

oiEdzukdxn-z-BoULElCNw.text: I went to Brio for dinner today and I had the pork chop with veggies and it was pretty good. Although you might need to order 2 pork chops since the 1 did not fill me up completely. But everything was tasty especially the creme brulee for dessert.

bNV8YMfW3Q_j-YIYYWJaWQ.text: Let's get one thing straight - I love Brio at Town Square, so after going to the Kidville CYME today (8/22/11,) I headed over here at 11:30 AM. The place was pretty dead, save for a handful of tables. Literally, you could count the tables that were full on one hand. My three siblings and I were sat at a booth right next to the kitchen (annoying) and given menus.   Our waiter would periodically pop in to say that he would be with us in a minute and after a little over 10 minutes, we finally got to order our waters. 5-7 minutes later, he ask if we still needed time with the menu or if we were ready to order. We were ready. After the wait, my sister and I were talking about just getting up and leaving - it's aggravating to be discriminated against because we're young. Don't put us in the back by the kitchen because we have two kids with us and don't ignore us because you think you won't get a good tip. Bad service, like what was exhibited, equals a bad tip.  Anyway, I ordered the lunch portion of the sweet potato & chicken risotto with the bistecca salad ($12.95.) My sister got the fettuccine rustica ($9.95) and then our younger siblings got the kid's ravioli ($4.95) and the kid's fettuccine alfredo ($4.50.)   My food was okay but extremely salty/ msg-ish. It had that overwhelming umami flavor that comes with excessive msg so that made me leery. I actually got really full quite quickly and couldn't finish it all. Also, the risotto was kind of unappetizing with the cubes of not soft sweet potato and green beans. It was edible, but I wouldn't order it again. My sister complained that her pasta was also extra salty and she left most of the "goodies" in her bowl. The kids liked their pasta - it actually came in the same size bowls as our meals with the same sized portions. I was actually worried that the waiter didn't write that they were kids' meals.    We got one water refill about 5 minutes before we got the check. We would have ordered dessert but my sister said she was really sick of constantly waiting for our waiter so I paid $40 and we bounced. Go to Brio at Town Square at Happy Hour if you want a great deal and great service. Come to Brio at Tivoli Village if you want to be ignored and leave unsatisfied with your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kids meals are an excellent deal! 8/22/11
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato &amp; chicken risotto with bisteca salad. $12.95 8/22/11
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid ravioli. $4.95 8/22/11

Tnu-NMW49-bW5QkgNk5Jbw.text: My husband and I went here last night for Valentine's Day and ate from the Valentine's Day prix fixe menu. I had the lobster bisque and the crab stuffed shrimp and lobster tail. Both of these items were DELICIOUS. My husband had a cesaer salad, the filet mignon, and the fingerling potatoes. His steak was devoured pretty quick, but I did get a chance to try his potatoes and they were great. For dessert, we got the dolcini trio consisting of the caramel marscapone cheesecake, creme brulee, and a seasonal banana pudding. The pudding was my favorite-so good! Our server was Jenny and despite the fact that they were extremely busy and she was hustling, she never let our drinks get low and she was very attentive. We will definitely be back in the future. We had a great experience!

HXUwtpIynwHqlj-q1yHs_g.text: I love the food and drinks here but the bar back showed more attentiveness and better customer service than my bartender Jennifer did. She took my drink and food order quickly but never followed up with me. She was working hard to help others but didn't give me the time of the day, for some reason. Customer service is much better at the Town Square location. Not once in an hour and a half did she ask me if I needed anything.

rEHmYgX25BfLwqEa66PppA.text: Went for dinner with my bestie n had great time. Food was delicious! We Had my favorite beef carpaccio as appetizer. My entree was shrimp & lobster pasta which was so yummy!! Service was good n the place wasn't crowded this time. Dinner was very yummy as usual.

lvpBFNHtDcMyRBzWiqBYYA.text: We went on a Wednesday for $5 Martinis and for Happy Hour in the bar area.  Almost every seat was taken, except for 2 chairs at the bar.  They were located on Rampart Blvd in the Tivoli Village in Las Vegas.  We ordered 3 appetizers and a couple of Martinis:  Spinach, Garlic and Artichoke Dip:  The dip came in a small bowl with parmesan flat bread.  Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant:  The bartender recommended this dish and it was very good.  The egglplant was lightly breaded.  We needed some complimentary bread to soak up all the sauce.  Shrimptini:  We ordered one each.  There were 8 good sized shrimp on a bed of lettuce in a martini glass.  My friend ordered a Pomegranatini with a slice of lime and a Flirtini with a cherry.   She liked the Pomegranatini better and would order it again.  We would order all 3 appetizers again and will be back soon.

VgI36ajIEQAzE_k6qKt06w.text: Very disappointed today when a party of 6 of us went to lunch at Brio and they would not seat us -- the reason given was that they could not accommodate 6 people.  Many times getting seated at Brio for lunch is frustratingly slow (even when no one else is waiting to be seated), but we've never been turned away altogether.  Seating seems to always be a problem here.  We had to go elsewhere for lunch.

mAh45M2Rf16TKTWk_dsxoA.text: Happy hour food and drinks are amazing! Great prices! Shrimp tasty and dirty martinis all night long

bh7Z4yAPY5YUBvT-DhuP6g.text: Came on a Monday and had to wait 20 minutes. After waiting, walked inside and half the restaurant was empty.   After being seated and ordering, we waited 40 minutes for our food. When I asked how much longer our food would take she said "it takes 15-18 minutes to make your food" in a very snarky tone.   When the food came out the steak was cold and the salad was soggy like it had been plated and left too long. The 2 pasta dishes we ordered were fine.   In years of dining out, I've never had to speak to the manager of a restaurant to complain about service. The manager wasn't very helpful either and said she would check with us to make sure everything was ok but never saw her again.  The restaurant was obviously understaffed and mismanaged.

QYj5jIxFGUDz-MzwwSdEiA.text: Chopped salad was great and so was the flatbread. Open tables outside but we still had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. Atmosphere and service were good, I would recommend.

zXjnHCmLP5qtCK7cy255Ow.text: Came last minute for a bite to eat and it was brunch time. MImosa was good but no specials on drinks for brunch. My husband's omlette came out wrong and my daughter's cheeseburger was over cooked. However our server brought out 2 new dishes and really made up for the mistake! On a Sunday afternoon when they are busy, I can get over the mistake especially when they do their best to make it right. Carlos deserves 5 stars for that! Thank you.

jKwOPuHuIdLA3D8JB68qDQ.text: I have to say this place gets ALL FIVE STARS!  Delicious!  I've eaten at a lot of places in Las Vegas and Food is good, service is great (in particular our waiter Justin), everything is top notch.

ewkjYNDGqOM9NO6_w_PSvg.text: Attended happy hour here last night. The pepper shrimp was delicious and had the Razzbertini - very refreshing. This was my second time at this location for happy hour and it was a little too empty for my likings but I won't let that affect the rating :)

19C4bZPiEwAtezbd_4fI8Q.text: My husband and I decided to sit at the bar today because we didn't have the kids and it made our experience so amazing! Bri was one of the beat bartenders in Vegas we have ever had the pleasure to meet. Thank you bri for turning around our opinion on service here!!!! We will definitely be back just to spend time with her and indulge in the delicious food! To top it off we ran into Alyssa who was an amazing server in another restaurant months ago. Good job Brio for hiring experienced personable servers and bartenders it makes the difference especially when we only have a couple hours alone!!!!

2L6_zG4zhZAu2d7k5PXMZg.text: I love Brio.  Their outdoor patio is so much fun when the weather is not hellfire.  I recommend that you sit on the patio, order a bottle of wine and cheese, and enjoy the best Las Vegas has to offer.  I've been to Brio numerous times and consistently had wonderful experiences.    Only once was there something that concerned me (undercooked meat).  Should they have caught this problem before serving the food to my guests and me, yes.  However, the chef and server both apologized and made things rights.  No harm was done, and I've never had any other bad experiences.  This is a place I love to visit.

1mrfN6TfeAqrCbjQqBaAVw.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Amazing food! Sat in the bar area on 10/17 got here around 8:10pm, everything seem to start off right bartender greeted me within 2 mins, gave me a happy hour menu. I ordered from the happy hour menu and my bartender walked away when he brought my drink over I had to ask for the regular menu. I ordered an Cesar salad, flat bread and lamb chops to eat. All my food came out in an timely manner but my bartender NEVER checked on me. My lamb chops were VERY tasty but came out cold. I had to physically get up and find an manager to come talk to in which they remade my lamb chops and they came out nice and hot! My bartender was aware that I sent back my dish but never followed up. The manager did come back within mins to check on me! Since it was extremely slow and the service suck that's my reason for two stars, I really wanted to rate 1 but the food was too good
