lrgsn10J0be54RZnPcCS0A.text: Was there while ago with my girlfriend, we ordered Vodka pasta and fillet mignon. Server was nice, complimentary bread, to be honest, I touched a bit and did not even pay attention onto. bread was cold, and hard. And it did not go well with butter either. But what made us our day was the main dishes.  Vodka Pasta - Flavor that I never tried it before. Creamy, flavorful, usually if you eat pasta, it sometimes does not have flavors that smothered into the pasta. At least the pasta that I tried, it was just so good and the cheese inside really harmonized well with the pasta and sauce. Which was one of the best pasta I have tried.  Fillet Mignon - Ordered Medium Rare, and it was cooked perfectly. I have never tried fillet mignon that is as juicy and tender as the one that I have tried here. And also, their side dish, I don't know what its called, but side of the potato and sauce on the top was just a killer. Something that you must try.  overall, it was a great experience and after I have tried all the other steakhouse, I will for sure come back to eat pasta and steak again.

mYt3zsLYnlW6sxatAMm1Gg.text: Literally had such an amazing server Gus!!! Went in on the 4th of July! We had happy hour right before it was over and he was awesome!! All of our drinks continued to be filled!! I never get such awesome service and as a server myself I am extremely picky! I live in Henderson so about 30 away from here but would come back for him!!!  Thanks;)

8nVEZmx0_1wP8bi1fffWMQ.text: Service was above average. Super nice and attentive.  Food was super good. Didn't make me feel like shit like I'd normally feel after eating at Olive Garden or other Italian places.  It was clean and fancy. It's worth the higher prices.  I had lobster and shrimp fettuccini and lobster bisque. They were both really good. The bisque was a little saltier than I prefer but stil was super good.  I'd recommend coming here on a nice fancy

jU8DRfqGPInAfgUaXjCQLw.text: Went here for Easter brunch with my wife and a good friend. We sat outside on the patio and had a wonderful meal. The service was extremely courteous and friendly. Our food was served pretty quickly, and most importantly, it was delicious. We split an appetizer of bacon and tomato jam bruschetta with ricotta cheese and I would do it again in a heartbeat. I wish I could have taken a jar of that jam home with me. It was one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten. For my main course I had Gorgonzola-crusted lamb chops. They were cooked medium well, I asked for medium, but they were still great. The Gorgonzola crust was delicious and the mashed potatoes on the side were also quite good. It's a little pricey for brunch, but if you're not on a budget this is an excellent choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Applewood bacon and tomato jam. This is SO good.

GLTgeuzkpswNuqzJ8dHtog.text: I wish there was a way to leave minus reviews.  Much against my better judgement I went back to this restaurant with my 25.00 gift card sent to me by supposed manager Kaya Bozhinova due to my horrific experience in June.  Not very generous (after dropping 200.00)  but what the heck.  Everything that could be wrong went wrong.  We had a reservation but once again the receptionist and greeter tried to seat us at the bar at the far empty end.  When we objected they magically found us a seat in the main dining room saying it was full, which it was not, there were 3 empty tables.  When we asked to speak to the manager Kaya came and apologized and asked if there was anything she could do and said she had been out of town so people didn't know how to be hosts or seaters?  Odd (later we were told there were two managers, one man and one woman? I think they just pick on people to be managers if customers complain)  She offered us a drink, I don't drink so I asked for an appetizer.  The drink and appetizer took 25 minutes to come.  We then asked to share a meal the meal came and it was not split we had to ask for plates and split it ourself.  We never got bread or water refills.  Now comes the really fun part when the bill came the "generous" gift card registered as 20.00 not 25.00 and the drink was on the bill.  Once again we called for the manager.  She said oh did you get 2 drinks? No!!! Then I showed her my email that stated the gift card was for 25.00 and she tried to blame the poor waitress.  How could the waitress do that it was a plastic card you ran through a machine.  In a haughty nasty tone she said she would give us the whole meal for free, since the balance was 2.00 that was once again really kind.  She also said see you again, NEVER EVER WILL WE SEE HER OR THIS RESTAURANT AGAIN.  The food has also fallen in quality.  Go to Mangiannos.

QMdXcQFFZao99La1aV19Hg.text: Great dining experience.  I typically love Brio for business lunches but decided to bring a date for dinner.  She loved it.  Started with the bruschetta quatro.  4 different types of bruschetta.  All delicious.  I ordered the crab and shrimp cakes.  Very tasty with large pieces of crab and shrimp throughout.  My date ordered the tilapia which was cooked perfectly.    All with a few glasses of sangria thrown in made for a lovely date.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta quatro

ig0bdJ_EItrf-xvbTDbPFA.text: We were a party of two and both loved the meal. I had the Caesar salad, and it was great. For my main meal I had Grilled Chicken "Under The Brick". Not a morsel of chicken, or the mashed potatoes was left on the plate. So good! For dessert, they brought over their "dessert presentation". I opted to have something that wasn't on the presentation, the Chocolate Layer Cake. It was incredible. This is a no-brainer for next time! Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Layer Cake!

8bGoy7xMdquc3CA0snvQoA.text: The wifey wanted to come back to Brio after her and her girlfriend came the week before for Happy Hour.  Honestly, it was just OK.  I agreed to go because since its opening I still hadn't been to Tivoli Village.  I'm for 'yuppie-ism' in many cases, and seeing how rich people sometimes like to spend their money just amazes me (and somewhat annoys me at the same time).  But to each their own.  Who am I to tell the local Summerlin millionaire that the restaurant chains they visit are often vastly inferior to the local Mom & Pop Italian deli down the way?  They'll probably just scoff then go back to their yuppie gym (I'm looking at you David Barton) where apparently only people with 8+ abs, and Armani workout clothes can sweat it out.  Yes, I am in fact wearing last, last, last season Adidas sneakers (but in my defense they are a rare blue pair) and a pleather jacket.    Tivoli Village was nice, but I was right in that it caters to specific clientele.  I like window shopping (unlike my homeboy 50 Cent) and wow, 'what-I-cannot-afford-even-if-I-tried' syndrome took over.  But I digress on back to eating (and fantasizing I was P-Diddy's hidden 16 year old bastard son).  Seems like Brio is one of the only restaurants that has survived the turmoil of Tivoli Village.  A number of eateries here have come and gone over the year.  Now I can only comment on their late night Happy Hour after 9 PM in the bar area.  I will have to try the regular restaurant some other time if we ever go back.  The hostesses were nice, showed us exactly where the bar area was in no time.  Seats were open, and we were told to sit anywhere in the bar for Happy Hour.  We chose a nice little table towards the wall section.  Our waitress was quick, and asked if we were interested in some drinks or if we were going to stick around for Happy Hour.  We told her we indeed there for Happy Hour and were immediately offered one of their bar plate menus.    There are a decent number of dishes available during Happy Hour, around 10 or so.  The pricing is good, between $4 - $6 each.  There are a number of drink specials as well.  I stuck with a Peroni beer for $4, not exactly a value, but apparently it's cheaper than normal.  Really?  Damn markup must be massive!  The wifey and I wanted to share the Black Pepper Shrimp plate, but according to our waitress they were out of the cream sauce for it.  Huh?  How hard is it for a kitchen to whip up a cream sauce exactly?  I certainly hope you have an ITALIAN kitchen that can make cream sauces all day long!  Alfredo, anyone?  Was just beyond me but OK.  We opted for the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip instead.  We also got an order of Beef Carpaccio, and two BRIO burgers.  Plates took around 20 minutes to arrive, average for most restaurants.  But it wasn't exactly busy when we were there so I don't know what the holdup was.  I gotta say though that our plates weren't exactly news to write home about.  Yes, I know it's Happy Hour, and yes I know the pricing is considered 'cheap', but come on now.  These were some ugly looking plates!  Poorly executed for the most part.  The Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip with flatbread triangles was alright.  It seemed to be sitting under the heat lamp for a bit on the long side, top layer of it was hard.  It tasted ok, but should I be ashamed to say it tastes like something I can pick up at Costco?  Let me get on with the BRIO burger.  Wow.  $5 for this?  A thin burger patty with Provolone and roasted tomato mayo on what looks like a Costco hamburger bun?  And a side of housemade 'chips', once again, that could be from Costco?  Now before you get your panties in a twist, I adore Costco and shop there weekly (and drink a kale shake almost daily).  I'm just saying, if I can make the same stuff from ingredients at Costco, why go to Brio?  Why?  And this BRIO burger was plated funny too.  A 5-year old can make a plate better than this.  The burger, no lettuce, no tomato?  Cut into four pieces, and chips stuffed in the middle of the plate?  Rookies!  It didn't taste the greatest either.  Burger was overcooked and dry, the cheese was near non-existent, the roasted tomato mayo was barely there, and there was too much bun!  For the price I could have gone to Wendy's right nearby and gotten a bigger burger.  Just so-so for me.  The best item of the night was the Beef Carpaccio.  Ultra thin slices of raw beef, topped with dressed field greens, capers, a mustard aioli, and shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano.  This plate was DELICIOUS.  Beef was nice and cold, greens had great crunch, capers and the mustard aioli added a nice bite, and the cheese gave it an extra layer of flavor.  We heartily ate this up.  All for $4!  Next time I won't waste any effort and just get two orders of carpaccio.  And maybe a Peroni.  Rant done Brio.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best of the bunch
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiddie food!
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meh.

cJ8WUyDz3YQb_d8wNPNgrQ.text: A group of seven of family went to Brio for a birthday/reunion get together. The meals we had ranged from pasta to pork/beef to fish. I had the beef medallions with a marsala mushroom gravy, which was excellant. The pasta, pork chops and braised beef short ribs were also liked. The pesca piccata was somewhat bland though. The appetizers we had were the eggplant topped with shrimp and the calamari. They were large servings and very delicious. Good wine, good food and good coversation was had by all. The resturant has a large dining room with adequate seating for larger groups all the way down to couples and family dining.

yuHsMAGETF9KznsCYtxbnw.text: This place is great. Delicious food, delicious drinks and friendly staff. The Sangrias are bomb and I had a strawberry rum Fresca thing I can't remember the name of that was divine, in fact I had two. The salmon salad is my go to and it was perfect. It was a beautiful day and we sat outside.

B0BTl7zAymmjCfDbfwKmwg.text: My wife and I have been to Brio in Tivoli Village and Town Square for happy hour, lunch and dinner many times over the yrs, sometime with our friends, too, and always have good experiences.   This evening my wife and I went for an early dinner. The pleasant hostess took us to a nice and quiet corner table. The dining room was not crowded, yet, so was pretty quiet, although the bar area was hopping, as the patio was a bit too cold, even for the tough young crowd. Our server, Kim, was very friendly and helpful, and got our beer orders (Blue Moon, $5.25) started immediately. Good thing she did that for us, too, because the barkeeps were kept super busy by those happy yuppies, who "never seem to have to work!"  Boy do I envy them!  ;-)   The wait staff quickly brought us our favorite bread basket with warm and delicious rolls, which we enjoyed over our beers. And I started feeling great!  BTW: Brio's STILL  DON'T serve Blue Moon on DRAFT, yet, only in a bottle! SIGH!   For dinner, my wife ordered the "Sliced steak salad" (15.95), and I had the "Mediteranian shrimps" (15.95). Both were delicious! The steak was tender and juicy and in good quanty; shrimps were cruchy fresh and very tasty! Their presentations were quite appetizing - I totally forgot to take any pics of our dishes, being distracted by our hunger and discusions on our travel plans for 2014! Trust me, our dinners looked good!   Our sweet server Kim (no, she is NOT Korean) was attentive and pleasant; her crew was efficient, keeping our water glasses full, and putting our finished dishes discreetly away. Kim also did us a great favor, taking the time to straighten out the mistakes with my Brio's reward account and honored my $15 reward credits - very nice of her!  During our dinner, the hostess (perhaps also mgr) came by to say hello, and later helped the waitress out with our check. [i.e., taking it to/from the cashier, but NO, she did NOT really help out with the $Check, You Silly!]  ;-)   - A nice business practice!   The Brio brand is characterized by its reliable, good italian style cuisine of VALUE; spaciousness, comfy ambience; vibrant bar scene; excellent service. Hmm...table cloths also add a touch of elegance. Of course there are other comparable restaurants, but I think Brio stands out in ITS CLASS.  - My friends say, it's like dining in a "Mid-Upscale" restaurant at Olive Garden prices.   For me, the Brio's in general and this locale in particular is one of the places I would go on a whim for happy hour (their $4 tasty small plates, Wed Martinis...are hard to resist at times) and/or for a tasty meal - NO SURPRISES!  Jan 2014

fGiSkBITszAGEVbXLDeIQw.text: Okay experience. The food is really bland and overpriced. Also this location is not very well designed inside. Kinda felt like I was eating inside of an old casino. Service was great however, and their strawberry shortcake dessert was yummy.

d_nVZAIWKvlNU8fUMO0BBA.text: WOW What a experience I had with my fiance. The Chef Sous Michael specifically came over our table to welcome us. (This does not happen to me)  Michael has a warm, friendly personality that anyone would like. We spoke for a while and I felt I knew him for years because of his magnetic personality.  I ordered the Grilled Salmon Fresca and my fiance ordered the sliced steak bruschetta and this food was the best I have tasted in years.   I want to compliment the Brio for having personal like Chef Michael.   We liked it so much we are going back Saturday !!!  Thanks again Chef Michael  !!!!!!!!!!

s7Nz6ittEuIfdeMPOa5jBg.text: I've been to brio at town square and selected items are good.  Others not so much.   I was totally turned off by just coffee and dessert here.  Coffee want memorable and cheesecake was old and disgusting.    Our server was coughing up a lung and should have been sent home   I am giving it two stars just because my experience at the other location was ok.  Otherwise it would not even get two!

jsCFW9rMQqx0h7IEUwkVkw.text: you can never go wrong with Brio. They have a good variety of options and pretty much everything on their menu is very tasty. I would highly recommend this place for happy hour. You can not beat their prices on their food and drinks services: Good prep time: 15 min atmosphere:  trendy, clean  Best Thing:  free bread !! :)

2dEt7z_g-d5ZHmgYUJJVcw.text: Brio is a hit or miss. Living in Vegas we get spoiled by all kinds of foods and standards I must say this Brio is he best in town. Food delicious and very flavorful. Service not the best no matter the occasion they don't disappoint

xcFjpwu8QqHMoag7FmptTw.text: I made reservations for four online through Open Table and all was ready upon our arrival.  We were early, the other couple was fashionably late, but the servers were accommodating and courteous. I had the best wedge salad ever, along with a bottle of Duckhorn Chardonnay which was split among two of us. My main entree was a mushroom ravioli which I devoured. Really couldn't say what anyone else ordered as I devoured everything in front of me. Great place, atmosphere and service. Looking forward to my next visit.

wD4u3S057g1nZwye5Ab5lw.text: Great food great service, love there big appetizer and big plates. I was there for dinner and the place was full. Love it definitely will come back.

Pql8FAUXYLnZLrSZ_juK-Q.text: Absolutely terrible service. No management presence. Indifferent server. Mediocre food, only after first served undercooked chicken (is that even Safe?). Won't be back.

OGey37DSAw5z6LLqafSt5A.text: This place was pretty good. The service was great which is why I said four stars rather than three. I had the carbonara the spinach was so thick it almost tasted like soggy salad rather than a pasta dish. But the cheesecake was great at the end.

NBGmo-wyGuGJC3KAG3N53g.text: Ah the happiest of happy hours! I'm not sure how it took me so long to try one of Brio's happy hours, but I'm so glad I finally did. My girlfriend and I came here on a Monday evening around 6pm and were easily able to snag two seats at the bar. I personally loved the service and set up at this location. It seemed a bit more intimate than the town square one.   As for food we shared the tomato mozzarella salad, beef carpaccio and black pepper shrimp. I honestly loved everything I ate. The salad was very fresh and well balanced on the ingredients. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of spice to it. The carpaccio was delicious and not too thin like you tend to get at some other restaurants.  100% I cannot wait to come back again and try more of the menu options. You also can never go wrong with $5 drink specials. Thank you Brio!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato mozzarella salad
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black pepper shrimp

RNFTQr71Tn3td8RszRG-Og.text: We came in the other evening for a birthday celebration. The ambiance in this restaurant is nice, one of our waiters was friendly but beyond that all bets are off. We ordered a ceasar salad to start and while the dressing was decent it was clear that the bagged romaine was not fresh.  I ordered the Shrimp Capri which read on the menu jumbo shrimp with a sauce of some sort of lemon sauce which was practicall non existent. The so called, wild caught jumbo shrimp were not fresh. The cassarecce pasta was good.  If in fact these shrimp were jumbo I'd expect to get 4-5 shrimp but these shrimp weren't at all jumbo....yet still there were 5 shrimp on the plate.   My grandfather ordered the chicken Milanese which clearly was derived from previously frozen breaded chicken. While it was Romano chicken I'd expect a restaurant of this caliber isn't purchasing pre breaded chicken.   My fiancee ordered the chicken Milanese....her chicken was tasty and tender but her vegetables were packed with liquid so I had to assume those were also previously frozen.  Far from fresh, not the best tasting food, you'd have to offer us another run for free to try Brio again. Too bad as we were really excited to try this place

HhvCmLanvuWjGp8HLEz0Rg.text: I visited this location on a quiet Saturday for lunch. I sat in the bar area at a wobbly table and that's my only complaint(the wobble). Chef Michael personally brought us bread to start. We ordered salads (sounds so boring I know) but trust and believe me that they were really really good. I had the wedge salad for which they make there own parmesan dressing. It was delicious to say the least. I was hesitant to order because salads can be hit or miss (emphasizing on the miss) but I was genuinely very impressed. Nice presentation, great flavor, crazy good dressing. I'll admit there was nothing revolutionary about it but that's ok, I felt warm and comfy after eating and that's all that matters, right??? The bartender was our server and he was very attentive to our needs. My company and I both had stiff drinks for under 7 bucks each, oh and water too(go water, go water). After the meal Chef Michael came back by with more bread!!! Im trying to diet so reluctantly, I declined. What a nice touch though, I love to see a chef popping out into the restaurant to check on guests. Nice place, I will be back.

tOtsbA7Z-C7GZlMSOdYyuA.text: We celebrated our grandmas 85th birthday at Brio, in Tivoli and everything was perfect.  We had a large party so we had two servers, Frank & Joe and they were both extremely friendly, polite and on top of everything.  The food was incredible.. it not only looked beautiful on the plates but everything was piping hot and full of flavor.  Usually when we go out with large parties something goes wrong, the service lacks or food orders get messed up, food items take too long to come out, or they come out cold, or you can't get your drinks refilled fast enough, etc.. which is why I felt compelled to write this review.. everything was perfect on that night and the staff should be recognized for doing such a wonderful job on a night that meant so much to our family.

iYGnus0diMN892H6R6W1LA.text: Very disappointed. Our service was extremely slow and our food was less than average. Our server and manager both were very flip when we asked if they were short on staff.  "That's how we do things".  Our server told us that having a section to himself was how he made his money.  Too bad he doesn't understand that a lot of people tip on the level of service, we did accordingly.  People also come back when the food is hot when it is supposed to be hot (soggy steak salad with cold steak).  We have  a lot of choices of restaurants, it will be awhile before we choose this one again.

5rP9gX0C4BADc5N_7FMwqA.text: I'm so disappointed that they have a new menu for Brio Happy Hour!! I was really in the mood for a Brio burger tonight. I told my son, this place have the best Buger for a reasonable price in town . We get to the Brio, the waiter informed us that they took off the he Brio burger off the menu!! So sad & so MAD!! All the portion of the food has been reduced!! ( Another disappointment)! I just can't believe my favorite place have been bought by a different company!! So very SAD & So very DISAPPOINTED!!

iOhRcNpDFaLEMMaXFwwECg.text: This is one of my favorite Restaurants.  I love the food and great service . You need to go see John at the bar , he is absolutely amazing. Ask for Natalie , she is the General Manager and she will treat you like you are part of her family.  I love everything about Brio Tivoli !

pdXihI7W_eR0gkWOq4_U0w.text: Great atmosphere, good food. I ate the Medetranian salad and loved it. They also make great drinks .

iJ0tj9kC4QE4nn6SxZRFpw.text: Changed Happy Hour...menu sucks now. Very limited No more bar burger and it was delicious! Spicy Shrimp and eggplant appetizer cut portion in half and charge the same. No dips . Very limited. Drinks seem to be the same.  Went from one of the best HH in the area to just blah! Wondered why it wasn't busy when we walked in. Now we know....

3dJdkgYHcT7CnF3vVi6WKg.text: Really miss the old management.  Unfortunately the new management discontinued some of the more popular dishes.  The waiter said that they are more focused on "organic" food, which is great, but why not keep the old menu and make it organic?

RNXpGvzx1C4QXV9_1plGpw.text: Our food was good, atmosphere was nice it was an early dinner so not that crazy busy. Overall I would definitely like to go here again. I had the Pene Alla vodka which was very good and we shared the beef carpaccio which was delicious! My cousin had the steak and my sister in law had the carbonara which she really enjoyed.

zQ799uXg72Ixs5X1Iw4Wdw.text: Jose G. was my bartender he was very attentive and informative. I stopped by to get a quick bite to eat before work and he superseded my expectations.

nrWok9kvDj2jTmi3VAncng.text: Simply Delicious. We ordered the spicy shrimp eggplant and calamari for starters, then tried the shrimp & lobster risotto, and the seafood linguine. The service was impeccable. There was a large party that took over the patio due to the rain and the manager deducted $30 from our check for the inconvenience

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Lobster Risotto.

FHa4wEec2YvxyarUWKC9YQ.text: First time coming here, our server was Stacey and she was amazing. Made the night even better. Food was delicious and she recommended the chocolate lava cake which was amazing!! Will definitely be coming back.

eLDss3qtTjqieL51RumXRg.text: Ummm... Five stars for Brio's happy hour, am I taking crazy pills?!  It feels odd, but I must have hit this place at the right time because the service was incredibly fast, the food was beyond expectations, and the price was stellar, $3.95 for a Margherita flatbread pizza? I'm in!  I came here after working an event, just looking for a quick snack before hitting the long road back to Henderson. I bellied up to the bar and almost fell off my chair when I peeked at the menu saw the prices; the most expensive item was the Brio Burger for $6. I didn't order this, but instead went with Black Pepper Shrimp, Beef Carpaccio, Tuscan Tots and a Margherita Flatbread.   Everything was very good, but the Black Pepper Shrimp was the winner of the meal. Seared Romano crusted eggplant with seared shrimp on top and some insane cream sauce, definitely not a low calorie option, but worth totally worth it. The beef Carpaccio is must order, it wasn't too fatty and cut paper thin it will literally melt in your mouth.   The Tuscan Tots were sneaky. I was thinking these would be your basic tater tots, but they are small mashed potato balls that are coated in breadcrumbs and filled with bacon, mozzarella cheese and fried, I'm done. The Flatbread pizza was great, covered in fresh veggies and flavorful basil, but compared to everything else it was probably least favorite out of the bunch, but still worth ordering.    The price point was the best part of the whole meal, with two cocktails each and with all the food mentioned prior, our tab didn't break $40.   Happy Hour goes from 3:30 - 6:30pm and then again from 8pm to close. Great atmosphere, no smoking and great food.... duh, I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan Tots!

T3nrKFCquo43st18LXd0qQ.text: I'm writing a review solely to the HH.  I was able to try a few items when a friend hosted a BBQ and had the food catered. I was really surprised at how good down of the dishes were, and went to the restaurant the next day.   Their happy hour deal is AMAAAAAAZING, since you can try their signature dishes for a potion of the price. Too bad it's only on weekdays, but it is definitely worth checking out.  I was not fond of the alcoholic beverages whatsoever...the mojito didn't taste like a mojito. They hadn't crushed the mint leaves so the flavor was one noted. We had to ask for mint too, since there were two leaves in there.   The Manhattan was just terrible.   Let me move onto the food though... Flat bread pizza - 5/5 stars Shrimp and zuchinni - 5/5 stars  Beef carpaccio- 5/5 stars   Everything else was 3-4 stars delicious!

Ea3nUc5iHckTpe1NkV4O_w.text: One of my favorite restaurants. The pastas are second to none, the bread is number one and the service is OK. ones in a while the food is a little greasy but over all I am coming back for another dish. Like to experiment new specials.

matY011Zn_ZmuNjIAEzu6g.text: We enjoyed Brio last night for Christmas Eve dinner.  Shared the calamari appetizer and it was very tasty, lightly coated in flour and fried, served with a marinara sauce and a cream sauce. We tried the Shrimp Verduta, Crab Cakes, and Veal Milanese, there were no complaints about food or portions at our table! The chocolate cake and vanilla gelato was a perfect ending, not too sweet, and enough for us to share.  Service was excellent, our waitress Jatae was pleasant and helpful.  Cocktails were generous and priced right.  Thanks Brio, we will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari appetizer

LHWEcaBy7gRIrXnn_PCfXA.text: Came here once never again. I ordered and my food came straight out. It must have been another persons order who had cancelled. The food was warm at best. The staff were very friendly was the only positive.

E9zYXrvkzzer5f2W5U7Pww.text: I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!!  I happily recommend it here, because I have recommended it to many friends, all of whom have loved it as much as I do.  The servers are professional without being stuffy - -always pleasant and helpful, and you never feel they are pressuring you to run up the bill.  The food is divine.  The portions are large, so I often just get two appetizers.  They have both indoor and sheltered outdoor seating, and can accommodate large groups.  If you get a loyalty card (no cost), you can receive email offers for discounts and special meals.  Both the Las Vegas and Miami locations are equally good, and both are located near excellent shopping, making them great choices for lunch when I am running errands on a weekend.  Both locations also have valet parking.

Qa9ULIKgkyUsEx8ywz--Yw.text: Let me start off by saying this isn't just your average Yelp review, we actually had our wedding reception at this Brio location this past Sat, Aug 16th 2014, and we could not be happier. We live in Los Angeles and were planning a wedding in Las Vegas, so I was very nervous about planning this via email and telephone, however the GM was extremely kind and helpful. First off, lets start with the fact that this location doesn't even have a "wedding"/or banquet room, the first time I called the manager informed me about their other location closer to the strip that had space to accommodate large parties and I explained to her that because our ceremony was in Summerlin, we wanted our reception to be there too so that guests wouldn't have to drive so far back and forth from the strip. She completely understood and welcomed our business. So, instead of taking up the majority of their restaurant on a Saturday night, they gave us the patio as well as a wrap around lounge area. Again, I was a little skeptical about the idea of my reception being on a patio, but we were running out of time and options within our budget and we booked Brio mostly because of their kind professionalism and because the food sounded delicious.  So, we began planning our menu, I emailed the GM probably around 20-30 times in the course of 3 months, and every time she responded within 24 hours and never seemed bothered or irritated. She allowed us to have table decorations and when I explained I was worried my family member would miss the ceremony due to setting up the tables, she offered to have some employees set up the dining area for us, and never even mentioned a service charge. Amazing. Also, she accommodated us with our menu choices completely and everyone in at our reception said the food was amazing and that they were going to look up the nearest Brio in their areas.   I'll save you all the sob story, but basically we had some hiccups at our ceremony (insane photographer) and we were about ready to tell the limo driver to just keep driving and not even take us to our reception when we pulled up to this amazingly beautiful, twinkly lit patio that took both of our breath away. We ended up having the most amazing reception. We danced. We drank. We laughed. We cried. It was everything I wanted for my wedding and I have Brio to thank for it. Not only did our reception at Brio make up for a pretty lousy ceremony, they also told us "not to rush" and to "stay as long as we're enjoying ourselves". That is amazing. The servers not only went above and beyond all night long, they were attentive, personable, extremely quick and one of the girls even danced with my brother who has Down's Syndrome. She was such a sweetheart. I have never experienced such great service along with such amazing food in such a beautiful restaurant. Brio truly has it all. We are eternally grateful because you gave us the most beautiful wedding reception we could have asked for.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. our reception on the patio

tjONoH0q051WHIWDQeROmQ.text: Something magical didn't happen this time or I was not in the right mood for Italian food. We usually go to the one in Town Square but this time it was faster to go to this one.  Food was OK but lacked flavor. Mine was too salty and wife's plate was a little under-seasoned. Kid's portions are gigantic. Not that I mind taking stuff to go but I could split one portion for both of them.   I think I'll take Brio off my "occasion dining" list for sometime. At least this particular location.

CRrC9vJyJ054F7U71PxRWQ.text: Had our friends birthday dinner here the other night and it was great. Fast service. Food was delicious. Anthony was our server and my wife and I ordered the salmon salad to share and he came out with it already split for us. Our water was refilled every time we got half way empty. Thanks for the great service Anthony! Definitely recommend this place.

W7q62BN1UaY9p4hQio4zBg.text: Enjoyed dinner with friends.  We had halibut special,  chicken risotto, cod,  short ribs.  All were good.  Service was good,  nice surroundings.  We have been here several times and will return.

HeVCPgD88StPciHXTuZxYA.text: Brio's Happy Hour is getting worse and worse.  I would have given Brio a strong 3 stars or a week 4 months ago.    I still think their Sunday Brunch is solid and the dinner options are fine.  There are certainly better options out there for both.  Their wine list has always been stale and conventional.  The most disappointing thing is their changing quality and quantity of HH items.  HH was the best thing they had going for them.  The first month that their Happy Hour was going the portions were much larger and it seemed as if more care was taken...when their burger was first added it was great for the price.  The patty has changed and it is now a crappy burger covered up in a good I-N-O style burger spread.

aCsWVGl5Xx76Ng2YOvbvvg.text: I hate to say this, but this place is lame.  We made reservations for 5 at 8:30. We came in and waited to be seated. There was no host/hostess at the front. Waited for a solid 10 minutes and finally 2 hostesses came and apologized for the wait. Why are there 2 hostesses if they are BOTH going to be occupied at the same time? Fine whatever.  Got seated outside. We made reservations for 5. Got four plates and sets. I asked for one more set... And I got the "Oh did I miss a set?" Yes you did. No biggie.   Service is really bad. Not even mediocre, bad. Waited forever to get our orders in, very disappointing. I ordered the lasagna, but 20 mins into it (after we were served calamari and carpacciio, the only decent items on the menu), they came in to let me know they ran out. 20 mins later? Whatever, fine. They told me they could make me a spaghetti with bolognese sauce. I opted for that. Everyone's meal came earlier and they all waited for mine to come out (even though I insisted they go ahead and eat). I finally got this "bolognese" but it was like a pasta stew. Everyone knows bolognese is meat sauce and it's not supposed to be mushy and soggy and filled with sauce, but meat. It looked like they threw on the lasagna ragu. It was terrible! Even the meat of the sauce was not edible.  At this point I was done. My mother insisted that I let them know I didn't get what I ordered. I assumed that my voice wouldn't be heard considered the already bad service... but the Manager was the only redeeming quality of this joint: She offered an apology (that's all I expected), and dessert around the table. She didn't have to do that and that was nice. For that, they get one star.  Without it, it wouldn't be anything.  I would NOT come back here again and do not recommend this place for anyone who wants a romantic or nice italian experience. Bad food, bad service.

U3iAF-9-5DpFqLvoZ1gYiQ.text: LOVE this place!!! The Salmon salad is superb. They have gluten free menu, great wine, great variety of foods that are all delicious! Desserts are worth saving room for!  They also have a frequent buyer app which is awesome! $10 off after first visit & discounts after every few meals.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

pKljjak4e9DVX1CdiwmEDQ.text: Tivoli Village itself is a prettier side to the Las Vegas area. You can't go wrong :)

UmETHzv1OtNIu7vn8SO6BA.text: On a Mommy Daughter date night & the level of service reviewed by Adeline and complimented further by Stephanie, made the experience fabulous. They well exceeded our expectations. The filet was perfectly prepared, service was quick, & the ambiance on the patio ..amazing!
