CE0l5jUTa6QroCfivH_3NA.text: There is a thin line between taste and haste I rarely get to Summerlin met a friend at Brio we ordered the chicken limone Got Served the pesce Piccata decided to just roll with it... the presentation was delightful the dish was so uninspired even after asking for crushed Chili Peppers short of dumping Himalayan salt fresh ground pepper maybe a bit of garlic or something on it I just found it the most bland dish I have had in ages

NvGZ4y8Ih7ml28IHTw2LYw.text: Happy hour not so happy!! We arrived just as happy hour was starting.  Bar was not full by any means.  We saw our server a total of 4 times over 2 hours.    Food was room temp.. Drinks were not flowing.. I even had to pick up a drink order from the servers area at the bar since the server was no where to be found.  Not a good experience there are better happy hours around that area..

0zZfOM98dAgJroaorLTOyA.text: Excellent service. Our server was amazing. This is my favorite place when I'm craving Italian. So many choices, and I love that they have dessert shots. I highly recommend this place!

MIslUigZY3AwTYLo7gmGBQ.text: Wow! NIGHT and DAY compared to the Brio in town square. They have great customer service and the food is also prepared better. I'm not sure why there is such a difference but I love it. I was pretty much done with Brio after many not so great visits to the other location. Thank God I decided to give this a try. Crystal you were wonderful! Thank you!

NczmMnPRzfHq6rMjpkJ7nQ.text: Love this place!  Good location, great service most of the food is excellent. Try the Chicken Milanese!  Salads are fresh and the pasta is made in house and among the best in Vegas. Oh the fresh bread is piping hot out of the oven.   Now for bad news. The lasagna is terrible. The portion is twice what any natural human being should eat the pasta is over cooked and ingredients are unbalanced - too little pasta too much cheese and sauce.   Definitely come to Brio - seriously good. Avoid the lasagna!

z_0GMOUjLUKN_yEFkCB2GA.text: My boyfriend and I came to Brio, already lovers of the chain restaurant (townsquare our favorite pick), thinking it would be the same great experience. In the beginning we were told 30-40 minute wait and since it's Homecoming weekend in Vegas, we understood and the lady manager took my name and handed me a pager. We sat RIGHT OUTSIDE and waited not long after were pleasantly surprised that another woman manager with a bun came up to us with a flatbread to take a piece while we waited. We were so grateful that she not only offered us a snack, but thanked us for waiting. Patronage is a huge thing in local restaurants and being thanked for waiting is a rare commodity.  Well an hour passes and we finally get up And walk inside. We ask how much longer to be told they were paging us for 15 mins?? Apparently they gave us a broken pager that was fully lot and functional. Thanks to the First Lady manager. We're surprised at this considering there were 4 hostesses and 2 managers, not one of them would've walked outside to call our name?   At that point they handed my boyfriend a new charger and expected us to wait more. At that point I walked over to the bar and say down. THANK THE SERVING GODS for Kelly at the bar because she made up for my irritated and highly agitated night. 2 stars is for her and her ONLY. No more Tivoli Village Brio for us.

qEgRs_HccVfigxzYuqyfew.text: We come here often with family and the portions are generous. The flavors are authentic Italian and they will customize a dish if there's something you don't like. We had the pork chops, which were excellent, and the ravioli. Their meat dishes are actually better than the pasta. Of course we also love the appetizers, especially the calendar, which is flaky and not rubbery.

qxLRlPJXTv4Kt6BYhW6XWA.text: I have been to Brio several times in the last 6 months. The food is consistently very good. The bruschetta is amazing! The service is always good and the prices are reasonable.

ycdt0wp0ybkPnFJJ_t1BqA.text: My husband and I have been coming here since it opened and loved it. Since menu changed we were extremely disappointed but we wanted to give it another chance. Went there today and my husband ordered the risotto and they came back and said it wasn't ready! Really they have been open since 11:00 and we know chefs get there early so what's the deal? Then server asked if there was something else he would like and he said the salmon and she said sorry we are out of salmon!!!! So we got up and left and went to Cheesecake Factory. Won't be going back to Brio's until they make necessary changes to get their loyal customers to come back.  Since our last review management reached out to us and we have to say this last meal was a pleasant experience food was very good! We will be back for sure. And John our server is always very pleasant!

f_p0EcyJgnAh_ZrvunUFDw.text: Average at best.  We went during brunch on a Sunday and stood at the front counter for a good five minutes without a greeting.  Then when we finally got seated and it took another 10 minutes just to be greeted by a waitress.  From there we get our menus and complimentary bread and wait another 15 minutes for our waitress to deliver our drinks and take our orders.    Next, we were not given silverware or plates for our bread.  And unbelievably our waitress could not be found and was not even in eyesight until 15 minutes later.  So we ended up eating bread off of our menus (which she for some reason didn't even take away once we ordered) with no napkin or anything.    The utensils finally came along with our meals.  The food itself, an omelette and brunch quinoa salad, was just alright.  The portion size was good but the eggs themselves didn't seem anything too great and probably not worth $11 each.  I guess you're paying for the ambiance of Tivoli in that case.  Buta gain the waitress struggled when we asked for some extra condiments and it took her so long to track some down that we were halfway done with our meals by then.  We overheard the waitress talking to another party about getting some food comped since her service was so bad for them, so I'm guessing we just got stuck with a new waitress who was having a bad day or something; but still, it gave the restaurant a very poor first impression from my point of view from her service.    I hear the Happy Hour is worthwhile so I could be back for a drink or two in the future, but it's not likely I'll ever come back for a full meal, especially at the Tivoli location.

3KBKXx_Bgc_AIhkANnssfg.text: Got food poisoning from there shrimp, I've been puking and has made my last 2 days in Vegas Miserable

lhcgjklxXF_3kUuyHKHtKg.text: Great server! She was attentive but not overbearing as we had to wait almost an hour for another person in our party to show up. When our food arrived, my food was cold and it was the special of the day. The other two people with me said their food was very good, especially the port chop. Being in Vegas, the atmosphere is wonderful, especially if you sit out on the patio which stretches around 1/2 the large building.

ylql77Vkhc6Gv0sfbLDIZQ.text: Beachbody dish: 2 fillets of Blackened Salmon, medium rare, over chopped salad Plenty of good protein with a healthy serving of veggies  Another good protein snack is the beef cappacio, ask for no salt / light capers to cut down on the sodium  I miss their linguine frutti de mare (shellfish pasta on red sauce).  Basket of bread is complimentary after you place a food order and use your Brio rewards (give either Brio # or the registered phone #) to earn $ off or free meals.  They have a generous rewards program and it's worth it.

ZMQpxBXXEs2B5RQoVDi_0g.text: Took my girlfriend to this restaurant for her birthday and she was pleasantly surprised. The eggplant shrimp appetizer is fantastic. The service was exemplary. Not too crowded on a Sunday afternoon. The entrees were good and value seemed in line with food quality. Would recommend to others.

OiPxdsyknJ2VmceK9Mdy-g.text: We really enjoyed happy hour here. The Sangria was excellent and would highly recommend it. The pricing for the happy hour really makes it a worthwhile stop.  However, I did not like the spinach and artichoke dip.  The rest of the appetizers were decent.  Overall the restaurant is much better than the happy hour at the bar, but the price is right to hang out, have a Sangria, and a few appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tots
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke dip
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i1BCvYDPYNwGIz3Gjof3_g.text: TUSCAN GRILLE - so why is there only 5 pasta dishes on the latest menu??  Which they change like the staff every 5 months - always removing the favos of the regulars of course and wondering why it nowhere near as busy as it was a few years ago.  Yes - I've been going for 5 years now.......sometimes every week...for awhile  But 6 months ago stopped - because they just cant seem to get anything right in this place!! Always an issue with ordering and getting it wrong as ordered.....then WAITING again while other people eat at your table - which is the ANTITHESIS of why people go out to dine!!  The chefs - don't understand English well - so they don't read the orders correctly....been an issue for years now.....ex staff told me so on many occasions  Went last night - same situation - I mean COME ON!  Got my order wrong - had to wait while my wife ate hers - which came with NO SAUCE  - chicken Limone - its ALL ABOUT THE SAUCE - yet the last 5 times - there is little to NO sauce...have to ask for more...then it take 10 minutes....food is cold.  Same crap. BRIO - Are you guys saving pennies on the sauce???? Is that WHY there is none????  Tired of the excuses and constant wrong items arriving at table.....it was not busy....it was Thurs....  This location's days are definitely numbered....

lavC-d7d2XUSIv9VDyIFew.text: We had a great dinner on a Friday night. We ordered the calamari, which was delicious. The lobster ravioli with shrimp was also excellent. However, for the price, it would have been nice to get a soup or salad with the order.  The service was a little slow. And the hostess center seemed to be managed by teenagers. Twice I saw the young men seating people just grab silverware and menus and walk off, leaving the customer standing there. I would have been helpful if something was said to the customer like, "Follow me to your table" or "I'll show you to your table."

PyAavVscv1BS3CTPPeladw.text: Started with the Lobster Bisque which had just the right zing of spice followed by a caramelized pork chop cooked to perfection. My lovely wife had the Mushroom Ravioli de Bello which was outstanding. The seating in this restaurant and outside patio was spacious with space to pull out your chairs without touching the adjacent guests. Service in the restaurant was fast but not so much in the bar. Overall it was a great value and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Ravioli de Bello
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chop

ESGM1FsJ5aip5ZJsltEw_g.text: In a word: disappointing.  In two words: very disappointing.    Food: average.  Typical BRIO (one step up from Olive Garden). Service: bad.  Really bad.  UNFORGETTABLY bad.  When in college I worked as a waiter.  I well know how hard the job can be.  And I give food servers every "break" I can.  But ours was just plain BAD!  Yet, I sense, it was not entirely his fault.  He was not well trained.  I dislike Yelp reviews that drone on about every detail of one's unpleasant experience.  So I won't.  But, in summary: waiter had no knowledge of the wine list, did ask if we wanted our salads before or with entree (we chose before) but forgot all about bringing them and, finally (without asking) cleared the table of bread, butter, and my dining companion's plate long before I was finished eating.  (He asked if I wanted my "leftovers" to go while I was still chewing my last mouthful!)    I chose to dine at BRIO specifically because I love their chopped salad.  Oh, how I wish I had had the opportunity to enjoy one.

GqYPfqhO9VJvff29sBYLcQ.text: My mother and I tried Brio for the first time today. The customer service was outstanding from the moment we stepped foot in this place. Our waiter took his time to let his General Manager Jesse know it was our first time and he personally came to greet us and suggested his favorites on the menu. The food was amazing! To top it off Jesse even had dessert sent to us on the house. BEST cheesecake you will ever taste! I will definitely be coming back!  Thank you Jesse and your team for exceeding our expectations!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M1HVjv1z0VTg317Yf-raBA.text: Pretty good for Summerlin restaurant. Been to the one at Town square. Service very nice a little short handed. It must have been homecoming for local high schools. Really like the short ribs.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short ribs and creamy polenta. Very good food. Service very good and nice.

73dRtsvWp0fQgA9eK5hMig.text: Came in with a group of 12 for happy hour, it was cold outside so we chose to move in and they wouldn't let us together. The manager Carlos said he couldn't accommodate us and our waiter acted like we were an inconvenience. Food and drinks were great prices were great service was incredibly disappointing

HYUMTHhsB7ZDr_f5mgtgCA.text: I'm posting two stars only for the wine. If you loooove Olive Garden, you'll love Brio. Except in place of bottomless soup, salad and breadsticks, you get one tasteless salad. I ordered the pasta  bolognese and a Ceasar salad. Ceasar dressing should have a bite of garlic and the saltiness of anchovies. This mess tasted like it was pre made and sat in the walk-in for a few hours. Equally tasteless, the pasta. Here's a thought- garlic. It's Italian food for Christ's sake. And if your diner does not eat the salad, before removing it, ask if it was ok. And when you sweep your section, look at all your tables to see if your guests need anything before running back to the kitchen. That's just common waitress sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ever hear of garlic?

nxldlBag9GUEk-8pg53m0A.text: Well tried to have lunch here but waited 10 min when finally someone showed up to seat us. There were 2 groups ahead of us. After they were taken care of someone walked in behind us and instead of helping us next she looked around us at them and helped them next. Needless to say we left and ate a wonderful lunch across the street at Echo and Rig.

1xMEVGEEYL2kc2mD4Bzntg.text: I enjoy coming to Brio from time to time. The interior decor is astonishing. High ceilings, beautiful tables, lots of choices for seating. It's quite appealing.  The food is delicious. Calamari is crunchy and very flavorful. It comes with two sauces, one being marinara. Yum! I usually order the Lobster and Shrimp Fettuccini. People, this entree is beyond this world. My taste buds went on a ride and never came back! Also, the lobster bisque is quite fascinating. Best I've ever tasted.  Service is delightful. I usually get the same server which is just my luck. Happy to say I'm pleased with the staff here.  The price is a bit on the higher end, although you pay for what you eat. Which is royalty.  There is free WiFi, no password needed. No bike racks nearby. Outdoor seating is optional. Reservations aren't required but they always help expedite your seating.  Overall, I'm pleased with the service, food, and amenities here. I'll be back in a few weeks.

vps8siuUELHMaKQp_WTm-A.text: Came for Mother's Day Brunch, party of 8.  We were prepared and had made reservations a week ahead of time.  We were surprisingly seated right away.  Was greeted by our waiter FRANK L.  He was on it all service long with us.  We ordered calamari and lobster bisque to start along with their bread.  Both dishes came out quickly and tasted good.  Frank made ordering fun and easy.  Called all the ladies dolls and sweetie.  He was just on his game.  I thought this was just a show because its MOTHERS DAY.  But we all were very impressed.  He was a veteran and served our country and mentioned that doing this was something he loved better and I can see it with every table he served.  He sincerely loves his job.  Every dish we ordered was delicious and no complaints from Grandma, who is always the hardest critic.  Shrimp and grits was a hit!!! Seafood pasta was tasty.  Being a busy day, Frank checked in on us frequently refilling our drinks, and was on top of it during our service.  We found out through conversation he had a 1 month old daughter at home and then we knew why he was soo good to our son and always had a compliment for him.  He even brought out some mash potatoes for him without us asking.    The food was great today but the service was even better.  Thank you FRANK L for making our MOTHER'S DAY even more special for us.  If you decide to eat here, ask to be seated in FRANK L's section.  You will enjoy your experience so much more.

OqNZbX0sYtGxRoyd_Mgfig.text: This is probably one of my favorite places to hang out with my friends, great food great drinks. Love the patio experience at Tivoli been there numerous times. I also enjoy the one at Town-square me and my friends enjoy sitting at the bar sharing a good bottle of wine. However I've never felt so disrespected or discriminated before like I did tonight. Me and my girlfriend sat at the bar at Tivoli village around 7 pm the restaurant was pretty busy, the bar was empty, so it looked like a good idea we were completely ignored by the bartender a least for 10 minutes. When he decide it to talk to us he was very rude, he didn't even introduce him self. He just said are you guys ready? He proceeded to put our order in with no other attempt to talk to us. At that point we decided that we no longer wanted to eat at the bar. We talked to the hostess and moved to the patio, he was making an angry face we can clearly see he was upset!! After we moved outside no one ever checked on us not even one time. His name was Joe. The WORST bartender we ever had! (Tivoli village ) after we complained to the manager (Joe) he comp our salads but he said we will have to pay for the wine. Terrible service, shame on you management team and bartender!! We were not looking for a free meal but rather a great dinner with friends!!

P16L5GT2NGuRuxjxpMHafQ.text: I have eaten at both locations in Las Vegas and they're both excellent.  Pros: Food is always great. I've never had a single bad dish and tried many. Lasagna is my absolute favorite and it's smothered in cheese, it's incredible. Drinks are always good and if you sit on the patios you get great views at either location.  Cons: None, place is pretty great  I will definitely continue eating here as often as possible

QppDHDtUk0iskoy7f6QURQ.text: AMAZING!  Everyone absolutely loved their food.  Often times pastas are uninspiring more often than not, but not at Brio.  Ambiance is excellent, service was also top notch and yum yum yum to every bite we took.  We will be back again and again!

SN4PmxNaHlEsRA153UkcPA.text: I give the food a 3, and the service a 1. We went for happy hour and our service was a joke. Empty plates sat on our table, it took forever to get our drinks, our food was cold, but was otherwise pretty good. It took so long to get my husband's glass of wine that our friend had to walk to the bar to get it. My Italian margarita had so much sour in it I couldn't drink it, the mango mojito tasted like club soda. After dinner my friend called and told the manager about the service and her response was, "I'll talk to the food server." I won't go back.

-AaGjSPA7VxNnl5HEgLYVw.text: Refer to my review of Brio Tuscan Grille at Town Square: yelp.com/biz/brio-tuscan... My fiance and I first experienced this location at their grand opening event benefiting AFAN (Aid for AIDS of Nevada) in April 2011. We were immediately impressed with the set-up and interior of the restaurant. Compared to the Town Square (Las Vegas) location, it has an "open" feeling since the whole seating area of the restaurant is under one beautiful canopy of drapes. The outdoor seating has a beautiful view of the center of Tivoli Village. I thoroughly enjoy both Las Vegas locations and merely choose one based on where I am in the valley at the time!

mXRI7zisxpnB1SaZUO2Zvg.text: Great Happy hour with decent prices. I have never had complaints on food and the drinks are always on par. 4 star because the bartenders ignore most of the time, and typically have to wave one down to order a drink or food.

Rfl86535t2_LTxxuFD8_mg.text: Went here for dinner a few weeks ago with my co-workers. Everything was first rate, the drinks, the food, and the service from Michael. Can't wait to go back again!

N7G0d4imhp51k2Z3GGYm3g.text: This was a top notch dining experience. The food and service was excellent. A tad on the pricey side but worth it for the quality of the food.

QYXQ0w0GhyQEDQqZsR6mvw.text: Portobello Mushrooms stuffed ravioli  heavenly Spicy shrimp and eggplant         Wonderful  Service fantastic

TwxpAEc8MzFYab-hbcYPuA.text: The service here is horrible! We sat we for 15 minutes before our drink our cane. We had to sit another 45 minutes before our meal came. There restaurant is empty. Nobody ever came to check on our drinks prior to our meal arriving. The meals came and he checked our meal one minute after the meal arrived and never came back to check on our meal or drinks. Our bread (2 servings)was never replaced

mjqA3z-fy5LCkvlW81Noxw.text: I haven't been here in a while and I don't remember it being this bad.... maybe it was because it was late afternoon & after the lunch rush so the staff was more interested in chatting than their jobs .... We sat on the patio which was filled with empty, dirty tables and remained that way throughout our lunch... Our server couldn't be bothered to open the door and actually come to the table but would just stick his head out, yelling... Didn't offer boxes, ask about the food or even return quickly after asking for the check... My son hated his food and we would have ordered something else had the waiter checked back before we'd finished eating...I could maybe understand it if he was super busy but it wasn't busy at all!! Upon returning after running my credit card he made a big show of shaking each of our hands which was weird because until then he couldn't have cared less about our service or food. Maybe he hoped the show would make us forget the terrible service... It didn't! Sadly I left a 15% tip, which I never do but I don't even think that was deserved. Won't be going back!

2d4bzSKlfGeOUk8g02JxGw.text: GREAT happy hour! Drinks are $5 the peach sangria is my favorite. I tried their strawberry mojito and that was not good at all. Also a good variety of happy hour appetizers to choose from. I wish they could incorporate more items that aren't fried. Very spacious and clean. They also have the best lobster bisque! I can never remember which pasta dishes I get when I go for lunch/dinner but I have never been disappointed. They also have an outdoor seating area.   My boyfriend and I have a favorite dish there which is the seared steak salad or sometimes for a healthier version we substitute it the steak for salmon. great mixture of greens and the dressing they use is so delicious. A good amount of food for the price you pay.   Comparing it to the TS location I believe this is a little smaller but I like both. No complaints!

5u77cTja1USRN8aTiOX21g.text: We went here last night to try the restaurant and see what the new Tivoli Village was all about.  The complex is beautiful.  There was a live band playing in one one coutyards with people mingling and dancing.  Very cool.  If and when additional phases of this complex are completed, it will be a wonderful destination.  The restaurant carried the theme of the complex, with beautiful flooring, stonework and large spaces.  The vibe, ambience, seating and service were all excellent.  We had a 6:30 p.m. reservation and had to wait 15 minutes for our table, the only drawback to an otherwise perfect evening.  The wine was priced reasonably asnd the beer was ice cold.  We ordered the quartet of brushetta.  It was beautifully plated, visually appealing and delicious.  My wife had the penne alla vodka, which she really enjoyed.  I had the veal Marsala, with a very dark, rich sauce that was a bit too thick for my taste but otherwise excellent.  We look forward to going again.

2skwa83o65AL2JrkYPEkfQ.text: Of the two locations, this is the better. Happy hour is the only reason that brings me to Brio. For Italian food, there are better venues around Vegas. As for HH, this is one of the better.   The offering of drinks tend to sway my judgement. The Town Square location lacks drink offerings. For $5, a decent size list of specialty cocktails has something for most.   The two food items I ordered was enough to tide me over. The beef carpaccio with mixed greens is one of my regularly favorites. The shrimp with eggplant was a solid option as well. As an in between snack to banish hunger, a better deal is hard to come by.   One drink and two appetizers for $14. Check please.

9AYrQb6-hXygFqYErTbONw.text: My first time there this meal was one of the worst I have had in a long time my wife ordered a rib eye medium it came out dry over cooked sent it back then it came out ok but for $32 it was not high quality I ordered shrimp and lobster linguine the shrimp did not taste good seemed like they were very poor quality the manager offered a free dessert which I choose the cheesecake to take home so i just tried that wow horrible so I decided to leave this review $75 dollars later so many other places better could have went to Flemings for $20 more or Cheesecake Factory for less

rkVVKFiz82RNccov68mwGQ.text: Over priced pasta dishes and horrible service. Happy hour is the only hour I'll return to this place and only because I'm out voted by friends.

icTVXqgymbXssv9kTjZ3tA.text: Great attentive hostess and waiter. Fantastic atmosphere!  Great artichoke dip with fantastic flatbread.  Lobster bisque is fantastic along with an entree of Lobster Shrimp Fettuccine making for a great meal. I could sit and eat here all day, the Lobster Shrimp Fettuccine was perfect from the perfect noodles to the balance of everything .  Compliments!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hUOLFVJWwG-_d2jSEBQNjA.text: Brio is back with the great service. We had plenty of bread and drink refills before our dinner came out....5 stars!

15uR3txZxhN7v7kxglfx_Q.text: As a former employee for brio, i can honestly say their food is top-notch. I was there tonight for happy hour and the bar was really full but the bartender jim (james g) was outstanding and handled the high volume of customers with a sense of urgency and still made time to be personable to not only me, but almost everyone at the busy bar.   The food is always amazing, and that goes for the happy hour food as well. Im glad i live close by now so i can visit more regularly here.

1WboZf5ocuZjU-lrMXv7WQ.text: Food is great, but the service needs attention. The waitress (am I allowed to use that term since it's gender-specific?) was very friendly. Unfortunately after she took the order, she returned much later to ask if we would like dessert. I guess what happens between the initial order and the time they are ready to clear the table for the next party does not matter much. The guy who actually delivers the lunch was ill-prepared to serve us because the table was covered with dirty dishes from the appetizer round. Hello? Clear the table and then bring the meal. Got busboys? Use them. It also never pays to respond to the typical question, "Is there anything else you need?" because you never get what you need. A simple request for red pepper flakes, which should be within reach of every table in an Italian restaurant, was completely ignored. I guess he had other things to do such as deliver water to each new customer regardless whether the water is requested or not. (I thought there was a water shortage in this town. Never mind....) Considering the location (Tivoli Village, the "Rodeo Drive" of Summerlin) the service was at best cordial, but hectic. Maybe adding more staff during the Christmas season, as many offices are having their office parties these days, would be helpful. I am sure we will be back, as I say for the great food, but dear friends, bring your own red pepper flakes if you like your food spicy.

Lk4o3k62bwLug3FVB42W7Q.text: This review is long overdue. My husband and I went in for our date about 3 weeks ago, Armando was our server. He did an outstanding job. He was very fast, never had our table empty, whether it was refills or more appetizers. He really knew his shit. Unfortunately, the plate my husband likes was sold out and Armando suggested a different one, which was really good!! He could slow down a little when he talks, and he would be perfect but, everything was satisfying!  THANKS ARMANDO!

vdRDErhdP5NopWT0KeO-GA.text: The Brio  (location #2 west of the strip), is a new favorite stop when we come to Las Vegas. Service was outstanding, our wait staff highly informed and knowledgeable about all the menu items. We were there with a group of 10 and the service didn't suffer at all.  I couldn't recommend this restaurant higher.  Can't wait for my next visit...

Ai_WTAlEkmhRlwCfY56wHQ.text: I could eat the carpaccio all day. It's THAT good, and not filling. The server was also really nice and down to earth. She would even joke with us. I haven't tried any other food at this location, so take what you want from this review.

g9Zo2-fXQFyF2tgnVgUX3A.text: Wow - this place has gone downhill quickly.  My son came into town, and we picked him up at his hotel on the Strip, and drove the whole way out here because I had bragged on how good it was.  Well,needless to say, the service was terrible.  The food was mediocre.  We were overcharged ($15) on the bill - and we will NOT be back.  The bill was over $100 for 3 people, and the Pasta Brio which is usually quite good was dry, unflavorful, and very disappointing.  My son also ordered the Brio Pasta, based on my previous recommendation, and he did not even finish the dish.  We had to ask fro butter and bread three different times, and never received it.  Also, if you are desirous of traditional Bruschetta, do NOT order the Bruschetta Quattro - it is bruschettas with red peppers all over them.  YUK!!  When I order Bruschetta,I want chopped tomatoes, cheese,cilantro and italian seasonings on toasted bread.    I was embarrassed to have bragged about this restaurant that I have been to MANY times in the past.  However, I would not recommend it to anyone now.  I know my son was disappointed....and it made me sad because I wanted to enjoy a wonderful evening with him.  Shame on Brio for their decline.  We will NOT recommend or be back.  RIP OFF!

hXiTkPxCtjR-jC04LVDxzw.text: $2.95 tuscan taster menu is where it's at. A great happy hour. My personal fave the spicy shrimp and eggplant. I think I need another order. Loved the brio burger and pepperoni flatbread too :) yummy.

2eyKcI92jJ52bexiFNiS9Q.text: Food was great. The ravioli in vodka sauce was excellent. Tiramisu was really good too. Place was packed on a Wednesday night. My boy Donovan said it was Cougar city for anyone who cares. He also said happy hours are great. They also have drink specials like $5 Martinique on Wednesday

1R0-vicSVQAV0dW5XE3TTQ.text: Go to happy hour!! Cheap and very, very good. And the appetizers arrive FAST. You have to sit in the bar to get happy hour prices, but it's worth it. The place is fairly upscale and the restaurant is expensive. The bar packs fast, so go early. Happy hour lasts until 6:30.

AvYfYc4w20iT2RNqSK8qxA.text: I figured this was another one of those places that spent more money on decor than quality of food boy was I surprised.  We started with the bruschetta sampler I snagged a steak one with tomatoes parm and a nice hint of balsamic that was great the best thing I had that night.  Also got one of tomato and goat cheese ones which were pretty tasty too.  Next a salad with their creamy parm dressing which was balanced very well also.  Just enough cheese, onions, maters it was great.  Some others had the lobster bisque and said it was fishy even to seasoned fish eaters.  On to the pasta they had a fruit of the sea special which was great hint of spicy red pepper flakes a light sauce that didn't drown out the seafood.  I did have one problem with the dish I got 4 mussels maybe 3 oz of fish. Cut to the size of baby scallops and the scallops that were supposed to be in there were AWOL which is probably why the fish was cut that way.  Now the 4 shrimp I got in there were tender tasty and perfectly cooked just like the rest of the seafood were great but for me I would like to see alot more fruit of the sea. Service was friendly but not best I've had.  Overall a good place great tasting food and one of the few places that I've seen give more than a few raviolis in those dishes wanna go back and try the lobster raviolis and if that plate is smaller than mushroom ravioli plate I'm gonna be pissed.  Also the kids plates are really good and the portions are pretty big.

K58kNoH7WUqtn13NKCl4hg.text: This place is a pretentious joke. The service sucks, the food is mediocre at best, the management is rude and snide, and I felt sick after eating here. I enjoy dining at quality, high-end restaurants, and this is not one of those.  If you are looking for something more than a terrible, over priced dining experience, I suggest looking elsewhere. Vegas has much more to offer than this.

blkV_4T2bT5AWX8SCzitsw.text: My mom and my sis and I came here on New Years Day for brunch.  Although, the place was pretty busy, our server was very friendly.  Our food came out a little slow and we didn't order anything complicated.  I had their grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection - delicate and moist.  My sister and I also ordered their Bloody Maryl, which was also very good. We really enjoyed our visit here.  Hopefully, Tivoli Village will fill up soon to bring more people to Brio and the other restaurants.  Right now, there's really no shops to go to around there.

PeosKNBFNh5LSXtY3jKF7Q.text: This was my first trip to Brio and it won't be the last. The bar was pretty packed for a spy on vegas open bar from 6-9. We managed to snag the last 3 seats at the bar at 5:45 which was lucky considering it was standing room only by 6:30. The service was definitely above average, quick and courteous even when they were swamped with all the event goers. I can't comment on the drink prices during happy hour because we were taking advantage of the free peach sangria and cucumber gin gimlets but the $2.95 tasting menu in the bar area is fabulous.   The Ravioli Caprese arrived with 3 generously sized pieces of ravioli in marinara sauce. Not only was this dish tasty, but for $3 I was impressed by the portion size. The Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant was my favorite of the dishes we ordered. The portion is smaller than the ravioli but the flavor makes up for the size. So good, and only $3. We'll order two of those next time. The Margherita Flatbread was a little bland for my taste but between the other dishes and the bartenders plying us with free booze it's hard to complain.

6P34Oep_WNg5mWs-2cLAfw.text: First time trying Brio was at Tivoli Village during happy hour. It was nice sitting outside until sunset cuz I felt like I roasted out in the sunlight. Aside from the tanning, the happy hour specials are f*ing great. There's a wide variety of $3 appetizers & discounted martinis to choose from & it turns out that my favorites were the margherita flatbread & lemontinis.

A_oJwnen6W1KmJYXyqJe2Q.text: I've been going to brio for quite some time, and i really like this place. Beautiful patio, good service, and great food would describe it all. My friends and i are regulars already!

PRLN-wjFxYPAsAbZLkisXQ.text: I love this place their choice selection for italian food and pasta is great! I came for happy hour, and I tell you their happy hour really makes you happy! they have a $2.95 happy hour menu for your basic appetizers, finger foods, and a regular sized burger. Although they don't have a happy hour menu for drinks. I think the over all quality of the food makes up for it all. The BRIO burger is awesome, and definitely a steal for the price! The buns are toasted, and the meat is so tender and juicy. Full of flavor! We also ordered a bunch of chorizo fonduta. I would highly reccomend that along with their margherita flatbread. You will definitely get full fast, and still have some left over!

aVkQEYSSiuXt1a2MexqRnA.text: Delicious Italian restaurant with a great atmosphere located close to the airport.  This will become one of my favorite restaurants to come. to.  Relaxing, good service and after dinner, you can walk around looking at some great retail establishments.

m9yWYlbnhqrLed-z0JXZKQ.text: Love the happy hour. Out door seating is awesome, fast service and great food. The flat bread pizzas are great, but my favorite was the beef carpaccio. Only had the apps, but they were tasty enough we didn't need to order entres.

yXx7p_ITowSO4H8Mm54mSA.text: I have been to the Tivoli location three times--once on opening day, once last week for lunch, and today for Sunday brunch.  Opening day was pretty good for a first go--service was exceptional (thanks, Justin!), but the food was cold.   Last Wednesday for lunch was excellent all around (Mediterrean salad and mezza chicken, both great).  Today for brunch--food was excellent (pork chop, white chocolate raspberry French toast, and spinach mushroom fritatta), but service (server was John) was sub-par at best.  Lots of servers, bussers, hostesses, etc., but there was a great deal of confusion amongst employees.  Go to the Town Square location until they get the bugs worked out here.

kHcY4m58cHSQxcQxx3HDtQ.text: Have you ever gone to a dinner party & EVERYTHING tasted great...even though you had made that same thing yourself before and it was just OK?  That is how I feel about the food at Brio.  I have been to the new Tivoli location a few times now and love the happy hour. Be aware that because this is between Kona grill and Sun City, so there is a wide age range.  It had been a while since I had a 65 year old man hit on me, but it wasn't creepy...(is that creepy?).  Service is great each time but if you sit outside the sun just blares down during the happy hour.  The house white wine is nice and light and a reasonable price.  A nice place.  My friends and I really enjoy everything we have tried.

0QUFN1q7TV_4-4Y-2DGUUA.text: Amazing!!! Had brunch for my moms birthday. Service was great. Our server was personable, nice, and patient considering we had 2 kids in the party. Food is always amazing, I'm never disappointed. I eat at brio all the time, love it everytime.

oay38o9MQHqvyOr0zxFE2A.text: My fella took me here on an afternoon we both had off for a nice much  Their bread basket is delicious and fresh!!!I ordered the soup and salad combo with Field Greens Salad and Lobster Bisque....delicious! He ordered the pasta and egg plant off the lunch menu...also too darn tastey to describe! The hostess lacked personality and looked a bit put off and uninterested in being friendly with guests. (Although she did seem chummy with tithed staff.)  Our waitress was super friendly and stayed on top of our iced teas.  We enjoyed our experience and will likely return.

M7omBvDr9xcB7k03hx2QuA.text: No need to fully gorge on their menu... the flatbreads are excellent enough if are in for a light lunch with a glass of wine. Conducive enough for a group of friends who are more attuned to catching up than gorging.... best thing is they don't rush you to eat your food.

KyPO_Shycn4tfpRifj4m3Q.text: We just had a delicious lunch this afternoon.  I enjoyed the lunch combo Chopped Salad & Spaghetti Pomodoro, perfectly made & only $12!  The lunch portion on my pasta was perfect for me but would be way too small for my hubby.  My hubby loved the Lobster Bisque & Salmon Salad, very yummy.  My son noshed on the cheese pizza from the kid's menu, very reasonably priced for the size of the pizza $5.95.  Service was excellent from the moment we walked in to the end of our lunch.

uP1dqhOJpoC29ZJOmxhjdQ.text: Lunchtime service was horrible! Extremely slow and it took just as long to get our check as it did to get our food.  I expressed my concerns to the manager and he blamed the hostess for seating us outside.  (Poor management style,  in my opinion).   I chose not to leave the server a tip, as it was not deserved. He felt differently and gave himself a tip, as I discovered on my credit card statement. I contacted the manager and they credited the difference to my account. I appreciated the quick response,  but this location has left a bad impression.  The customer service is lacking to say the least.  The food is always great, but not sure it's worth the hassle when I can't trust the staff.

1__J0GWln35bAOsZwxmE3w.text: Please return full size eggplant and shrimp dish  to Happy Hour menu . Went today and this dish is less than half portion plus almost no sauce, price is the same as full size happy hour portion a month ago . I go to Brio happy hour pretty often and always order shrimp and eggplant, this time such a disappointment!  Managment please consider returning full size shrimp and eggplant dish!!!!

RRGVEKLtPevmg4jZKiUjwA.text: This restaurant is located in Tivoli Village, an upscale mixed-use retail and office development. The restaurant offers classic Italian fares, such as Bruschetta, pasta pesto, pasta carbonara, etc., in addition to a nice selection of appetizers, fish, chicken and steak dishes. I tried the pasta carbonara; one of the best I've had this side of the Atlantic. The serving was generous enough that I had no room left for dessert, so I am determined to go back for more...

VC_mWV-sdEtd8mhg339WMg.text: Yum! We came to check out the new menu and it was delicious! I had the beef carpaccio and the shrimp Capri. The staff was amazing and accommodated our special requests.

TAHurdVRx9O9Kee5yGMDfQ.text: Found this local gem just outside the craziness of the strip in Tivoli Village, Summerlin.  Food was great but what earned the five star was our server, James.  When asked about the house favorite he made several recommendations but then volunteered that the employee favorite, the Chicken Milanese but sub in the Vodka sauce for the red sauce.  James took great care of us all night and all his recommendations were great.  My Fiance had the employee special and I had the Shrimp/Lobster Fettuccine.  We started with the Cucumber Gimlet w/ Hendricks and Rasberry Mojito on the side of the Roasted Garlic, Spinach, and Artichoke Dip.  Couple glasses of red wine finished off the dinner.  Can see why spot is a local favorite.  Thanks James, we will be back again.

qVqshgTohNzU9_vEO5RI0g.text: First time visiting this in their Vegas branch, although Ive been to the Dallas branch several Times before. The service, decor and food lived up to my prior expectations. Good for groups too. The pork chops I ordered was probably the best I've ever had.

g9K71YaDEDXMUg5FfRzMPQ.text: If I could give 3.5 stars I could. We visit often as we work at Tivoli. We came for dinner on a Sunday night. Chicken Parm was good. Could have been great with more melted mozzarella. The short rib was a total no go. This is the second  time the majority of the short rib was fat and lite to no meat. Posting the before and after pic as I had to share my chicken parm because there was no meat on the short rib.

bhU-iXDaXiMzkq9KAmIctA.text: My to go orders have been great and if something is wrong the managers are more than happy to make things perfect. Eating there is great also, I usually eat alone when my kids are in school and it's a very clean, peaceful place! Everyone is friendly and speaks to you, I appreciate the great customer service here, I really do!

_KY88nBAN1UH5LwUluZxSg.text: Met my POPs for dinner here while in town for the evening. Started at the Bar with a lovely Mendocino Petite Syrah.. moved to a table where our crew joined us after shopping all that Tivoli Had to offer . What a nice experience. We each ordered something different and all were delicious . Therefore, it's a safe bet that since we had 5 completely happy satisfied bellie's.. whatever you order will be perfect. The staff is absolutely wonderful. Everyone smiles and greets you no matter where you are in the restaurant.  Since this is a regular place for my POPs.. I will make it my destination dinner each time I come to town.  Cheers!

v-Ry08OK7LOpHWWtUoEVHQ.text: For the location, I expected more. Slow as a sloth service for NOT A BUSY NIGHT. Recent menu changes are disappointing. I'll drive over to Town Square for service.

W6imLia1Kofw4KClAbBgzw.text: The ambience and good spirited nature of the entire crew makes this restaurant a great place! The food is great and Amanda D or server really made us feel at home. Make sure to attend on happy hour, felt bad for Amanda do you had to deal with some guys who no one could help! The food was great and we really enjoyed ourselves thank you

XM1RG4smAM7wYXIp1ubwTQ.text: Brio, what can I say? This place is a solid four stars, always! I've been to many across the country and they are all great. I wish I had one close to me.  If you've never been here, it's worth a shot big time, similar to Maggiano's but a different taste in a good way.   Great service and thank you Matt @ this location.

J8AwJoArRnJep9nHbHU4ZA.text: Brio was once a very good restaurant with delicious food and now is a very big disappointment.  The menu has changed and the prices have really been jacked up.  We paid $38 for two glasses of wine.  We ordered the calamari appetizer.  When it arrived, there was only a few pieces of calamari with none of the rings or squid tentacles and it had deep fried pepperoncinis. My friend ordered the ribeye steak and had to send it back as it was overly salted and almost well done. I ordered the shrimp and lobster fettuccini. The pasta was slightly warm and the sauce was almost non-existent. The kitchen seems to have always put out the food too fast. We hadn't finished the calamari when the salad was served and then hadn't finished the salad when the entree was served. The food has definitely gone down hill, the prices have gone up and we won't be back.

xvmdm_KaGnbe6rXWJoJBBA.text: Wow used to be a big fan of this place until they completely changed the menu to trash. The waiter was an ass hole. Came by "hey do you want anything to drink" 1 second goes by and just walks away. Also rolling his eyes. I'm really disappointed.

sCPkCXiUqa4LZym2U6U6QA.text: My line sisters and I needed to find someplace to eat and exchange secret Santa gifts & we picked Brio. We came a little earlier than 3:30 but they let us sit at the bar area & wait. They gave us waters while we waited for HH.   We fit 8 people in the booth - pretty squished but we fit! As soon as 3:30 hit, our server came over to take our order. Each of us ordered 2 plates and some drinks. I got the Brio burger and the black pepper shrimp. I normally don't like burgers but I really like brio's burger! I think the bun is pretty heavy though so I usually take the top off. I think my favorite dish off of the HH menu though is the black pepper shrimp. It's sooooo good! It's like a curry dish with shrimp and eggplant! Order it. You definitely won't regret it. For drinks, I got the white peach sangria. I went to a different Brio and thought these were pretty strong but it wasn't as strong here.   The service here is also really good! They did, however, took a long time to bring one of my sister's burgers... and didn't bring it over until we were almost done with our meal. They also forgot to bring a flatbread but compensated with bringing a bigger flatbread. Lol

dBHB1jAgS53e0B41kknCtg.text: I have been to many restaurants and this had to be the worst of them all. I was celebrating my anniversary with my girlfriend and decided to enjoy a nice dinner. We are at The Brio location in TownSquare and loved it. We decided to try this Brio since it was closer. We received the worst service, long wait and the waiter was giving us attitude when we would order or have a comment.   I ordered a spinach and artichoke for an appetizer and also a Salmon for dinner. My girlfriend ordered the Pasta Brio. The Spinach and Artichoke was overall good but the flatbread that it came with were stale and was not good at all. I told the waiter and he brought over a manager. The manger stated that that does not look like how they should be made. She gladly brought us a new spinach and artichoke dip and flatbread. The waiter spoke under his breath that I could not interpret but it was still rude nonetheless. The salmon was dry and tasted over cooked and the mashed potatoes that it came with were completely bland and dry. The pasta Brio's pasta was undercooked and hard.  Overall, we have been to Brio multiple times prior just at the TownSquare location on Las Vegas BLVD and were constant customers. The bad service we received and to end the night with really bad food ruined our Anniversary dinner and will not be coming to that location again. I am not the one to write reviews of every location but it was worth the need to share with the public of how this experience was.

mGKosao5Wgl0wnVc6isXUA.text: Excellent food and great customer service! Our go-to server is Frank and he's amazing! We actually go to Brio more frequently just to be taken care of by Frank. After a long day at work, it's nice to just sit back, relax, and have a good meal served by someone who remembers your favorites just the way you like them! Frank's one of a kind! He's the type of person you'd follow just to be his patron. He's that good. In a world where customer-care rarely seems to matter these days, Frank is old-school . . . welcoming, charming and on-point! A True professional. He's the real deal and he makes the experience worth coming back for.

MQCg1UllKn6qRAWewcoTXA.text: Far better of late! We go once every couple of weeks now for the consistency. It's predictable in a good way and close to home and office. *Best* service is with John at the bar. Lobster bisque, mushroom soup, carpacccio, and the lasagna are faves.  But... Some minuses still include odd servings if you get food to go or ask for your wedge salad chopped for you; your still only getting half the dish?! Table service is consistent; consistently slow.   I keep hoping for more. -----  Previous review:  Ordering to-go: Half the food you order in-house but the same price and they expect to be tipped. Tasty, sure. Predictable in a good way. But having ordered both the soup and salad in-person, spending the same money on tiny to-go containers is unfair. Management contacted, let's see what happens.

neCX3E3DNnIjDMOiUuP1lw.text: I really don't get the high average of reviews here.  I think people are being blinded by the location. Sometimes a great ambience will make you feel the food tastes better than it does.  The ambience (decor and furniture) is top shelf.  BUT, the food here is really quite mediocre.  Just a step above a Sbarro's, with more flair.  I've received plates that were not to temperature (too cold), and inconsistently prepared (like the roasted, planked chicken I used to always go for, until I got the feeling that it just wasn't what it used to be.  The location at Town Square still does this dish fairly well).  The pasta is fairly good.  The salads are decent.  Other dishes are decent. The bread is quite good, and the only offering I've had so far that I don't feel I could make just as well, if not better, at home.  (When I go out to eat, I expect to partake of a meal that I could not do better at home!)  I think the menu is a bit too large, and they should do more rotation, and do more specials.  But this is not the reason for a 3-star review.  The real issue is the service.  The service is more miss than hit, in my experience here.  I have rarely felt that my server could care less about me and whomever I was eating with.  And because I work in the area (and professionals seem to gravitate to this place for lunch), I've had the experience of being here numerous times.  I've gotten out of it a few times, though, by suggesting other nearby spots!  (Like Vintner Grill).  I just have never felt especially welcomed or treated with warmth or enthusiasm here on any occasion whatsoever.  Even though I am quite a friendly person!  The girls up front are usually clueless, can't answer any questions about the menu, can't tell you if someone you're waiting for is there, make you feel as though you're bothering them if you sit and wait in the lounge chairs by the door for your party, wear the most ridiculously short skirts or dresses, or cleavage tops, and are snobby, and apparently catty.  Even the young guys give you "I'm too sexy for this place" vibes.  It's so not luxury.  And so at odds with the ambience of the environment.  I just don't GET why you would--out of all of the options at Tivoli Village (e.g., Echo & Rig)--pick this place.

6Evx-2ucVr1xZUpDZjlkTw.text: Love the brunch on the patio. The salmon salad with shoestring potatoes just hits the spot. The egg whites vegetable omelet with fresh salsa is one of the best egg white choices out there.

fHauwSu3TmYCBCubzdv3AQ.text: My family eat here pretty frequently. Every time we come here, we have amazing service. I really liked our waiter tonight, Frank. He continuously checked up on us to make sure we were taken care of. He served our dishes with a smile. The shrimp and eggplant appetizer and mascarpone cheesecake are the best!

Dmc78PMFDO_V6BGbLQyr4g.text: Soup tastes like it just poured from the can. Salad is small and tastes super-salty and acidic, they put some marinated kale all over. Service is slow and pushy for sells, if they make mistake- don't expect apology, they will try to make you buy something else to keep the dinner price up.

w3p-3blAuuFWwtDO-zyF0w.text: This location is very pretty, is great for people watching (if you sit outside) and has some good food! The patio area is gorgeous and they do have some delicious appetizers and drinks. It's a great spot for meeting friends.   Their brunch is also delicious. I was surprised that we were able to get brunch reservations for Easter Sunday the day before!   Both times that I've visited the service was great - the second time our waiter was especially good with the toddler in our party.

TVYGkXd-zxxfzj98nu8qgA.text: We called ahead and told them it's my friends Jackie birthday I requested a piece a cake to be sent to the table with  candles they didn't do anything the service here sucks and I would avoid this place

uZhs3YoaMdZFiNXWuCOxJw.text: This is my first time eating here and my second time eating at this chain. I wanted a Cesar salad with the same steak they out on the steak salad. The waiter who was rude from the get go said then I should order the steak salad with Cesar dressing with only romaine. Kind of odd but ok. When my salad came out it's had romaine lettuce, blue cheese Cesar dressing and a vinaigrette on it. We told him this is not what we ordered. He tried to argue with us and walked away mad. My salad was finally brought out correctly.   Bad customer service and slow service

FCKj0Mdy-qPs5nV_NafOKg.text: The staff goes out of their way to make sure we have a positive dining experience. Servers are always pleasant and attentive. The kids menu has excellent and well priced options. Thanks Brio for feeding us!

hjrV7Mj9DzGzhP0aesccyg.text: Before we set foot in Brio, valet is quick and friendly to park my car.  The decor in this place is awesome. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. And the food? I've never had a bad meal. The risotto and Ravioli di Bello are unreal. The carpaccio is huge! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great Italian experience in a modern atmosphere. Ciao!

JDqdt2YKxHBbenZdXQgoqQ.text: Can't laugh at Brio!! Anna might think your intoxicated and refuse you service... go to Parkway Tavern instead!!

8_ZM0_SLUyIty2kkLeib2g.text: This place is definitely a chain Italian restaurant and you can taste that. The meals are neither noteworthy or horrible. The last time I went I ordered the risotto with lobster because the waitress said it was one of the guests favorites. I don't know how you mess up something as delicious as lobster and risotto! First, the texture was runny. Second, the taste was just way off. I barely ate any of my $30 dish. We shared a salad beforehand and that wasn't bad. Our friends liked their dishes. I can't recall what they had. So it may just be a preference thing.

xZ-6e8dSgvPJFDf3epq_Aw.text: Waited about 30 min until our food arrived. The food wasn't all that great but good enough.

epyfZBKUncW5Eo2I2C5D4A.text: Dog friendly patio. Wonderful atmosphere, pleasant staff that executes good service, quality food at reasonable prices. We love the carpaccio. Valet staff is super and remembers us from previous visits.

HnXVi_PbQobWaG4-dYQexw.text: I was coming here since this place (finally) opened on my side of town.  The happy hour is just amazing.  It was $2.99 for like 8 different dishes, but I recently went back and was disappointed to find that happy hour dishes are now $3.99.  The bartender told me they have some newer items, and the portions are bigger.  I wouldn't know as I went for the burger, which did not change in size.  They also told me they added $5 cocktails, which also didn't matter to me as I was drinking a regular priced Stella, if I remember correctly.  I came back a few weeks later and had two apps, the beef carpaccio and the crispy shrimp.  I almost always get the carpaccio, so I was pretty excited when indeed a bigger plate arrived.  Except once I was digging in, I found that they had sliced the meat thinner than before, and so it seemed like the same amount... or LESS!  The meat kind of stuck to the plate, so it wasn't the same enjoyable appetizer that I was used to.  The crispy shrimp were a nice addition to the menu, though.  Tasty, plentiful, and not too much breading.  I definitely enjoyed that.  I also tried a $5 sangria rosa just so I could sample their drink menu, and it was good, but it didn't blow me away.  This is still one of the best happy hours on this side of town, but it's not the "oh my god we have to go there" deal that it once was.

yeV0-eLtt0skVUF3h10fLg.text: Me and my girlfriends went to enjoy some desert on the night of November 16 thinking our night was going to continue to be perfect and it ended up being ruined by that horrible service provided by their whole staff team, we set down and where ignored throughout the first 10 minutes of being there without anyone even offering some water or bringing those napkins or silverware, after we got the servers attention we were able to get some bread and two glasses of water. 10 minutes after receiving the bread and butter we still did not have any silverware to cut the bread and spread the butter, also still no napkins, the manager on the floor passed by and we told him what a horrible Service we were having and he put no effort into showing that he cared or that he felt bad for us, he bravos napkins and silverware after we ask him and had to eat our bread cold. We ordered a Caesar salad to go because we know longer wanted to be there because of the horrible experience and they took an extra 20 minutes just to deliver us our order, we will not Be coming back to Brio at Tivoli Village and will not recommend it to anyone that we know, it's a shame, it was our favorite restaurant .

WRi_yr1tjDUoTNFdd2aBkQ.text: My wife took me there yesterday 01/17/2018 for my birthday and it started out rocky. My wife had made a reservation for 1pm. We showed up a few minutes early checked in and we were told to take a seat. After watching the hostess seat 3 seperate groupd of walk-ins, and about 15 minutes later, a totally different hostess asked us if we were waiting for the rest of our party to arrive. I explained that we were not, we had a reservation. She looked embarassed and sat us immediately. As we walked in and saw several empty tables, I was not happy. Next, the bus person brought a basket of bread but no plates. After a few minutes I got up and grabbed 2 plates off of an empty table. Finally when our waiter, Julio, got the ball rolling it went smoother. We ordered a flatbread pizza for an app and the Pasta Brio for our main course. The Executive Chef took the time to personally bring us fresh warm bread and ask us about the food. Julio brought us out a complimentary piece of the marscapone cheesecake with a candle for my birthday. The excellent food made up for the piss-poor first impression. More training and oversight in those areas is much needed. They just were'nt that busy. That's why they get 4 stars.

Jf4YC_D2Y0o2FY0NdXqJSQ.text: I have discovered that although Tivoli has shops with price tags that make me want to cry, it actually offers a pretty wide selection of reasonable places to eat. Usually we go to Leone, but today I wanted to try Brio because I was craving pasta.   The ravioli di bello was the perfect dish to satisfy that craving. I wish I had taken better note of what was in it, but basically it was cheesy mushroom ravioli with sauteed mushrooms and a chardonnay (it might have been some other wine) cream sauce. Yum yum yum yum yum. The flavors were developed very well, and it was indulgent without making me want to take a nap. Most of the items on the menu were within the $15-20 range, so you can have a meal with some friends and not break the bank.   Our waiter was a little pushy when it came to add-ons like appetizers and desserts but it really wasn't that big of a deal. I will definitely be coming back for more!

2ABmYA0cH3Fa8hmIDT_k0g.text: The Skinny: in general, below average Italian (2.5) service is very hit or miss (3) value: at $13-15 for an entree you could do much better elsewhere (2.5).  When we attended my Hubby's annual Christmas party, he had the unfortunate luck of winning a gift card for Brio Tuscan Grill. As soon as they called his name for the prize, my heart just sank into the bottomless pit of despair. Not to mention the hubs signed me up for their rewards program so I get a coupon now every year for my birthday.   WTF!?!?!? I swear, my hubs hates me. As if it isn't traumatic enough getting 1 year older.  I can't tell you the amount of vitriol I have for Brio Tuscan Grill but that would take way more than the 5000 character limit that Yelp sets out for reviews.  I mean, it's not that the food is absolutely disgusting. It isn't. It's all edible. But that's about it. Considering the exorbitant prices for the level of cuisine, this joint represents all the things that are repellent about dining in the Summerlin area: generic, pricey for what it is, and a hot spot for the geriatric crowd whose taste buds have been ruined by the multitude of meds they take. And don't forget the f*(king patio dining. Like I said, mediocrity at its finest.  If you must come, come for lunch as the prices are a lot better.  Okay, seeing as I have been forced to eat here more times that I care to, I'll let it loose on a few of the many items I have tried.  Lobster bisque ($6.95): too much sherry not enough lobster = pass.  Salads (including Caesar, Grilled Salmon salad) are pretty bad here. Have yet to ever have a salad here without finding some wilted lettuce mixed in. In addition to that, the dressings are all really generic. And what the heck is up with all the cheese they put on everything? What is up with all this gorgonzola? Pass.  Calamari ($10.45/lunch price): First of all, the plating. Have no idea who thought that putting the marinara and cream sauce (neither one which is particularly good), in the same bowl of the fried calamari. This makes all the fried food soggy. Not to mention the deep fried peperoncini represents half of the plate of greasy calamari.  Mezza Chicken under the Brick ($14.85/lunch): The roasted chicken is fine, the marsala sauce is decidedly meh. The plate is very small for the $14.85 price tag.   Pasta alla vodka ($16.15/lunch): My husband usually gets this. Me, I think it's okay. But given the price and the serving size, it's ridiculous. Pass on this one.  The only dish I have ever really truly liked there and thought that it was worth it was a special they had. It was a truffle oil flatbread with arugula, mushrooms and proscuitto. They had that for about $10.  Given that I would likely pass on nearly everything I tried there, I don't recommend coming here as for the above mentioned reasons. Though edible, their food is expensive for what it's worth. 2.5 starred review bumped down to 2 stars.
