61oTWBnjfA3-ywlFclUHHw.text: Great Italian style eating! Dinner with family valet parking lots included! Anthony waited on us and was very pleasant and efficient !  If you are in Summerlin  county this place is a must!!!

_W10pmbv4lKPZ1k3un19eA.text: What can I say about this place.... 5 stars without a doubt! The food, service, parking, people... I love every single thing about it. This place is a place you would want to take a business associate ... Or you significant other... Or your best friend... Or your... Or your... Just about anyone that wants to enjoy and awesome fresh made meal! I had the salmon salad that was to DIE for. I asked for my salmon medium... And it was perfect!  The service was impeccable and the place was clean as a whistle! I loved that they didn't have a bar scene with a bunch of bar flies hanging around. This place is clean and classy!! I will be back EVERY CHANCE I get!!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sparkling water... Comes w a lime and in a wine glass!!
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread that comes prior to meal
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon salad

lYec11t59h1zAEp9OXuFaQ.text: We used to eat here all the time, but at this specific location, my last three meals came back prepared with old food. We are talking about lettuce with pink edges and smelly chicken with a rubbery texture. Not willing to risk foodborne illness, we have not returned. Their other location at Town Square, however has never disappointed.

w8_Xg6_lA-UeErCBaD3vhA.text: This restaurant is always crowded, which is strange since the food is just ok. Of you are looking for Italian, there are a lot better places to go than here.

0chxdENv5RYkdiya3xoECw.text: I was always a fan of brio since there is one closer to me that's located at town square.  I think i like this one better though.  It is close to valet and it seems bigger.  I order the calamari and caprese salad with fresh mozzarella cheese and basil with balsamic glaze drizzled around the plate.  These were Pretty easy and typical dishes that u go wrong with at brio.

xbNz8503D3XT4xDf8Ef45w.text: Consistently good.  Good service.  Good location.  They messed up my order, but made it right and took care of us.  We left happy.  Even if something goes wrong they make it right.  The food was great.  We will be back again sometime.

LV-fU3oorz6SGAFtvMPCBw.text: I am giving a 5-star rating solely in hopes that they continue the great jazz music during happy hour, and get more of it more often. The outdoor terrace is perfect for it this time of year. The music is the only reason I would come here.   Like most reviewers point out the food is average, but you get your money's worth during happy hour. Alot of old farts here..I am surprised they can drink so much. I had no idea.

j33jAJgUPghE5hbFp-LXMA.text: I don't particularly like chains, but I tried it. The food is ok, but over-priced.  I have had better Italian food for this price range. I don't go here unless friends meet here for lunch.

O_oZM0jI0otpxyuiiCYadA.text: We recently had our wedding reception here.  We are from Los Angeles and had never been to Brio Tuscan Grille so I didn't know what to expect.  The food was delicious and all my guests keep telling us how good the food was, how beautiful the restaurant was and how the location was perfect and so nice to get off the strip.  Everything went so well from booking to finish.  The staff is so amazing and so accommodating.  I can't thank everyone enough for making our wedding so perfect and easy.  P.S.- We had our reception on the outdoor patio and it is so pretty on its own that you don't need any decorations.  It's perfect.

wVh2VPD_bZPXLBfr7SzcKg.text: My kids favorite place to eat. My favorite is the 3 medallion fillets with fried tomato, the kids favorite is the pasta Brio. I love sitting on the patio when the weather permits. Desert is awesome here as well. Wait staff is always fast and nice. I love the peach sangria too.

Ad_UBjl4FEshu1aoKpfOcA.text: Three of us took Mom here for her birthday, to try something new, for lunch.  It's in the trendy Tivoli Square which looks brand new and is stylishly done.  The walls, decorations, art and overall feel screams Italian countryside, complemented by the bright Vegas sun outside.    We ordered one of the chicken sandwiches with the housemade chips, the mezzo chicken "under the brick", the grilled chicken risotto with sweet potatoes and I had the grilled shrimp with orzo.  Everything was good.  Nothing the blew us away.  The food is noticeably rich with butter and salt (fair warning for those looking for lighter, healthier choices) and is served in smallish portions perfect for lunch.  My family really enjoyed the housemade chips which were not salty at all and perfectly crisp.    This place might have gotten an extra star if the service had been a little bit more personable and organized.  The waitress was friendly but she came back after our order and handed me a Caesar salad.  I looked back at her in confusion.  "I didn't order a salad."  "Yes, you did.  This is yours."  My aunt spoke up and said it was hers and she apologized but if I told her I didn't order it, I thought that should have been it.    By the time we started eating, my mother still didn't have her side salad.  The waitress told us it would be right out.  After she'd brought it out, Mom said the girl dropped it on the table and said "here you are" while already looking to the next table and moving on.  Since she believes that service includes making eye contact with your customers when you are engaging with them, I'm mentioning it here.    Otherwise, it was a good experience.  It's reaosnably close to Summerlin, but I think we'll continue exploring other Italian options before returning.

vi1W38ENLhRaCChwxy9vUQ.text: Came here with my wife for our anniversary and were pleasantly surprised. The food is excellent. I got the crabcakes (crab and shrimp) and they were awesome. My wife got a chicken dish where the chicken was breaded and skewered over mashed potatoes (don't know the name of the dish) and it was a ton of food.  My only complaint, but it was a minor one due to a pet peeve of mine is that our server seemed a little aloof. Never around when I actually wanted him to be. Not sure where he was since the kitchen area is all open so you can you the server's stations, etc. I think we could have been out of their 10-15 minutes sooner had he been around. It wasn't just at the end of our meal, but also during. Seemed kind of weird for the type of establishment. I still give it 4 stars and will for sure try it again, but may have to change my rating if I end up having a similar experience.

2_hHXEQwRxMu88AYEexdaQ.text: I love brio. Great food, great environment, great service. But I can only speak for the location at town square. Waited about 10 min for anyone to come up to our table from the moment we sat down. Then they messed up on the appetizer salad and didn't come out till after our main entree. After we were done we waited even more. About 20 min or so till we got some service and that's because I had to go up to a manager to ask. And all this waiting we were watching our server walk past us many times without any acknowledgment that we were in his section. Never would I have thought I would have a horrible experience here. They did at least do the right thing and comp'd a bit off the bill. But free things aren't important. We were just looking for an apology and customer service. (Tivoli village location)

w9hQqBztkGibTGRlDhPfEQ.text: This place was surprisingly delicious. I have to say there was hesitancy when we walked up to the front door and couldn't see anyone at all. However, after the hostess led us into the main dining area the place lit up. Delicious appetizers and a pretty amazing chefs special. Would def recommend this joint!!

TZq9qn-naeqZrIzCyi5w6w.text: I've been here before for happy hour, but last night was beyond irritating.  A woman sitting next to me at the bar brandished her knife at me and threatened to hurt me and "f*ck up my car" and "I'm not kidding."   Dressed ok, eating and she's threatening patrons.  I simply got up and  took my purse and said, "why are you threatening me?" and the manager asked us both to leave.  I had already had two martinis, and an appetizer.  There was no incident until her.  This may be Summerlin, but it's turned into Scummerlin. The staff can't handle anything.  This was just awful.

RV5WitVhJxDYVdrEgagdCA.text: Went for the happy hour (Monday-Friday 3-6:30, Monday-Thursday 9-closing). Must admit was very impressed with the apps for $3.95. Ordered the burger, artichoke dip and the ravioli. Bartender was friendly enough to tell me the eggplant shrimp is the best thing they've got, so I take him up on it.  He was right, the eggplant shrimp was very, very good, and I don't even like shrimp that much. Ravioli was good too, I'd probably get it again. Burger had a charred taste to it I liked. The burger was pretty simple, but hey, it's $3.95.  For the drinks I believe they only have Sangrias, Martinis, wine, and Mojitos for $5. No beer as far as I could tell.  The bartenders seemed nice and knew the regulars by name, the ambiance is good, parking is easy in Tivoli Village, and the prices for happy hour are worth it. Nice spot for a slightly more "upscale" happy hour at cheap prices.

vLDya1cwIpSNw-63IXUGEg.text: Very beautiful Italian restaurant w/gr8 food and good service.  Nice wine list and bar menu w/gr8 happy hour.  Pasta dishes, grilled dishes and appetizers are my favorites.  Eggplant and shrimp, beef carpaccio, calamari, ravioli, lasagna, vodka penne and mahi mahi are recommended.   Desserts are average. Service is slow sometimes.

ls8MhHG2EkUW6RB2-ZLbtA.text: Brio is always a happy dining experience.  For this specific location, I've only been for happy hour, but I don't see how their regular menu would differ from their location at Town Square.    Their happy hour must be one of the best!  They have a list of items for $2.95.  Don't let the price fool you though.  Their portions are decent sized.  We always order one of everything, and maybe even two of some other things.  (Don't judge us!!)  How could you not though?  Cheap, good food is so hard to pass up!  Their service is always amazing.  They check several times to make sure everything is okay and refill drinks before it is necessary.

8HgfVv2zb8XcvZIyaxPjYg.text: Great spot in Tivoli village...especially for happy hour.  I had cheese ravioli and it was amazing - and very cheap!  They also serve mojitos, which are one of my favorite drinks.  The scenery is usually pretty good and Tivoli village is a great cozy atmosphere.  Easy parking underneath and easy access from Summerlin Parkway make this a winner...

GnCATDfhLDKDoU7QmCCmjQ.text: Great food , the salmon was to die for. The waiter was informative and had a stupid attitude when we had questions ,good price  4 star since it was my first time here and I hate rude and very unfriendly waiter

V4VPvutJAQD6kL4enE09Aw.text: I wish I could give 0 stars. The food here is good, but the management is terrible. We brought a (good) bottle of wine to enjoy with our dinner. The server told us she couldn't open it. We asked to speak to a manager. She told us that they had a very good wine list and it was against the law to open the bottle. Since members in our party were in the industry they knew this was unTrue (especially since we purchased one bottle also). Also she made no effort at a service recovery (we would've refused it anyway, but the effort would've been respectable). So terrible management ruined our meal.

2AObadrLJGZIU700Qh7P7w.text: I've been twice . Happy hour in the bar was great, drinks and apps prices great! They pour good liquor and it was fun...visit 2 for dinner. Service was good , food was ok, atmosphere ok too. However the prices for this food is ridiculous, it's very clear that the rent is so high they have no choice! I don't mind paying for a good meal, if it's really good. Sorry N O R As  smokes this place on the Italian food, why go anywhere else

BqmqpUUu75nV7O2j80H2Sg.text: Very Disappointed!  I have been to Happy Hour at the Summerlin location a couple of times and enjoyed the appetizer menu and the prices. Thought it would be a nice place to take my friend for her birthday.  I made reservations the day before for the 2 of us. When I arrived (early)  I told the hostess that I was there and would let her know when my friend showed up. I told her it was my friend's birthday and asked it they did anything special. She said "Oh yes!  She would post it on her reservation list."    When she seated us It was on time at 8:00PM on Wednesday night and the place was not the least bit crowded.  In fact it was very slow.  I asked her if I could see their brunch menu.  She said that it was just their regular menu. I have seen others post on here about their eggs benedict and other "brunch" items".  hmmm. Maybe I just missed it on the regular menu. I wasn't planning on ordering anything from that menu, but wanted to consider it for a later occasion.  When the waiter came, he was very gracious. He asked if we wanted any appetizers before dinner. I told him that I would like the bruschetta. NEVER GOT IT! I also ordered the lobster bisque and it was excellent.   My friend ordered the 7 ounce steak and said that it was very good.  I ordered the "Pasta Brio".  I have had better at Applebees. Seriously!    I had also seen on this site that some had raved about their bread basket and how wonderful their rolls were..  We didn't get a bread basket. I had to ask another waiter for it. It arrived with just little slices of some kind of toast - No rolls.   My wine was a 4 ounce glass of Cabernet. $13. THIRTEN Dollars!!! It was decent, but certainly not worth $13.  Hey this is not a Strip destination spot.  It's an upscale locals restaurant (At least I thought so.)  I may come back for Happy Hour, but doubt if I eat dinner here again, Highly overpriced menu.    PS: Didn't have anything for a birthday - no dessert or anything.  This is the only review for a restaurant I have ever written.

GY3-ZBkLMP02pJgXmMH3pA.text: I've been to the Happy Hour twice in one week!  This is a really great HH, but let me warn you, it's a girly HH.  Because as my husband said, "There's nothing but martinis and mojitos on this damn drink list!"  It's True, 95% of the menu is sugary and girly concoctions, but sometimes I like me a good lemon drop!  Opinions on the drinks: The drinks are nicely made and tasty and they're all only $5.  My favorite is one of the special ones they have on Wednesdays that is like a lemon drop with basil.  The sangria rosa is better than the white peach sangria.  The strawberry mojito tastes like fresh strawberries.  The red wine is a good, dry one.  Opinions on the food: This is the money maker right here.  During HH, they have a special food list where everything is $3.95.  My husband and I ordered a hamburger to share.  Wowza, when it came out, it was like the size of a Carl's Jr. burger and it came with homemade potato chips.  What, what, what?  This whole thing is only $4?  And it was a delicious hamburger with melted provolone cheese and a zingy little secret sauce.  The gentleman next to us ordered the spicy crispy shrimp and a sausage flatbread, both of which were also generously sized for the $4 pricetag.  When I went with my friend, we ordered the ravioli caprese.  Very tasty, but it only comes with 3 ravioli.  Come on...you give out a huge burger and chips, but only 3 ravioli?  I was a little disappointed in that.  We also ordered the shrimp and eggplant which has a really nice smoky sauce to it.  It does get crowded during the HH, and sometimes you have to wait a while to get the bartender's attention, but that is what you have to expect when it's a great HH.  My advice: get there around 3:30 so you can find a seat and put an order in before the rush!

_JaegcR2mmrOJhHkTRoyyQ.text: Love their happy hour. Once of the best ones in town. It use to be 2.95 awhile back ago. They raised the appetizer prices to 3.95... but seriously, it's worth it. 3.95 is still a steal especially for this girl!   Not much of a bar area compared to their other location at town square. It's also quite busy so if you don't go there early, you may not get a seat.   Appetizers we ordered: 1) Brio burger: Cut into 4. Simple burger.. but really well done. A fluffy bread with a juicy patty.  2) Ravioli Caprese: 5 pieces of breaded cheese ravioli. Fried to perfection.  3) Beef Carpaccio: MY FAVORITE DISH. Thinly sliced salty meat. What more could you ask for? 4) Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant: Another delicious dish. 5) Crispy Shrimp Piccante: Boyfriend l  It was more than enough for the both of us but we seriously wanted to try everything.  The drinks are delicious. Just martinis mostly. No beer. But well, it's all good. Cause I have my 3.95 appetizers.

C8Xe4eCQsh-VpF0Ai_afKQ.text: In my opinion this is one of the best Happy Hours in town. Hours are 3 to 6:30.   I had attempted to try Happy Hour here once before but it was packed and now I know why.  All the drinks are $5 and the apps are $3.95.  I had the Strawberry Mojito and the boyfriend had the Mango Mojito.  For food we ordered the Margherita Flatbread and the Ravioli Caprese.  Everything was good.  This is a spot you need to get to early to secure seating but well worth it!  Five stars if  it ended at 7:00!

mTNds5Fr-parkhRmmBbJhA.text: Went out to dinner with my son we had a wonderful time sat on patio and we had a wonderful view even The valet parker was nice and helpful The waitress Shell was friendly and engaging recommend it some excellent choices the food was great even the bus person with amazing hair was wonderful The manager Tiffany came over and introduced herself with a bright smile upon receiving the check we excuse ourselves and went to the restroom. We had yummy leftovers that we planned on devouring I'm at the end of our night at home. When we came back to the table all our food was thrown away accidentally. The hostess Alexis was very apologetic and immediately found my server and the manager. Shell was very apologetic and wanted to accommodate us in anyway. The manager Tiffany came right over and apologize and prepared a whole new meal how great now that is some customer service I will be back! The food was wonderful but this service really made our evening thank you for great  great customer service !!!!!

bOnMr4_aX0lJI0n0Mq7aVg.text: Speedy and professional service. I like the healthier menus. Quinoa Asparagus with Grilled Chicken was my fave.

AJ0eG4AM2pZOwStkXQEVYw.text: We got there at 11, just as they opened do there was nobody there. That was awesome! Our server was awesome too. He never let our glasses get empty, brought our appetizer out almost immediately, was ready to make suggestions on lunch, and brought out a dessert to celebrate my birthday after my hubby made sure he knew we were celebrating! The food was delicious! We loved the spinach and artichoke dip. The meals hit the spot too. The Alfredo sauce was super-rich and I couldn't finish it. My hubby also filled up in the dip so he couldn't finish his club sandwich. Yummy leftovers!!

oWS0k5GkEJh12Ql6O6m7Zg.text: Yum! Went there for the first time last night with my girlfriends and it seemed lovely. Decently priced food, good service, and wonderful ambiance. I got the blackened tilapia meal served with veggies for around $15, got a peach Bellini and glass of prosecco (under $8 each) and a chopped salad to start. Love tivoli restaurants and the patio here allowed me to take in the feel of the cute village.

lubVmXKybmHdbxJUuQaX4w.text: Just had lunch today for my kids last day of school, we sat in the patio and the weather was beautiful.  Everything we order was pretty good, server made us feel uncomfortable at the beginning just because we want to put in the kids order right away before we order our drinks.  It was a half day at school for our kids with no lunch so they were very excited to have lunch at Brio!  I ordered the salmon dinner for my daughter and it was over cooked, she didn't touch it. We requested the burger to not be over cooked and it was good like we asked, however our server seemed annoyed when we asked him to let kitchen know not to over cook it.     My kids eat out all the time and they know how to eat well.   I ordered the three course special and it was great!  Overall lunch was good but be better if our server was a little friendly with kid's request.

c_3k4wYEm0ah5kD2AYH4pQ.text: Pretty much what you would expect from a nice chain.  The food is decent, but not too creative.  The patio is a great location when the weather is decent and the drinks are just fine.  I sampled the Tuscan Stuffed Peppers, the Bruschetta and the Calamari.  The stuffed peppers were the best with a nice mix of sausage and creamy cheese filling.  Calamari was decent, cooked properly, but not outstanding.  The bruschetta was our least favorite - the bread was very dry, without enough moisture from the toppings to soften it.  This resulted in the entire piece crumbling after the first bite. Our service was fine.

jUpjSkV5kUFBX1tkVfRTKA.text: This is an awesome happy hour spot.  Food and service were good.  Sit out on the patio.  Order flat bread and eggplant fries, yummy!

7fs8xeHgaLyAXQAcqfNeug.text: This was a terrible lunch experience. We sat out on the patio by the door. The waiter wouldn't even come all the way outside he would just stick his head out and ask if we needed anything. The food was awful and if the waiter had actually come out we would have told him. Or possibly a big clue would have been no one finishing their food! Awful place, not ever going back!

4AhFiYvPLaKGWUP2dNbITg.text: I like this restaurant but it seems so loud. The couple times I've been here it was always crowded and reaaallllyy loud. I don't necessarily like having dinner at a place where I can't here the person next to me. The food is pretty good and price in my opinion is right. Wish that the restaurant had less of an open design so that the sounds done travel as harshly.

QAkLETo7q9R6x4u8q33EqQ.text: I love the little shopping center in Tivoli Village.  Patio seating, bar, and regular dining is offered.  I came here expecting Italian food (my usual is the lobster & shrimp ravioli) but went with the 5 oz. filet instead.  It was cooked perfectly - honestly one of the best steaks I've had!  It cut through like butter, the flavor was amazing, and I gobbled it down.  The portions are really small at Brio.  I was expecting my plate to be a bit more loaded for the price I pay compared to hole in the wall Italian restaurants found in Las Vegas.  I'm not talking about the filet, but the pasta dishes are rather small.  Otherwise my experience was positive from the food, the server, and the restaurant setting.

o_SdwTw-VVMUvh8tpdvDiw.text: People! What is the infatuation with kale?  I had brunch today and ordered the brunch bowl. It was very good, however, why screw up great taste with bitter nasty kale?  I picked the kale out and enjoyed the rest of the dish immensely. Nice service staff. I definitely recommend Brio for a charming, relaxed and enjoyable meal.

UwXKoMYop9vzbhakiac8sg.text: I walked into this place for happy hour one evening expecting a few reasonably prices cocktails and a couple decent appetizers. I had experienced below average service here in the past, but nothing egregious. Knowing this, I had mentally prepared myself for the culinary adventure I was about to undertake... I sat down with a friend at one of the round tables in the bar area. I noticed the same waitress who had been my waitress the other times I had entered the establishment, the very same one who had given shotty service in the past. She was very busy talking to a woman seated at the bar, they appeared to be friends (I made eye contact with her about five times as I waited). I noticed the bar tender as I sat, Making eye contact with this gentleman multiple times. I sat for about 5 minutes, my excitement disappearing by the minute. Again, I made eye contact with the bartender. He went over to the waitress who was still talking to her friend and asked "are you going to take care of them?" being busy, she retorted "that's your job, my tables are all taken care of". They are arguing loudly, so the patrons in the bar could hear every word, for about 3 minutes. My friend was so embarrassed. Finally, the waitress came over and handed us menus, asked if we wanted waters, and would be back to take our order. We left the establishment. We went across the street to Made LV, and vented to the bartender there about this treatment. He laughed and said he heard it all the time. I wrote an email to the Brio corporate office relating this experience. A couple of days later, brio called, but I missed the call. I called back and spoke to the hostess, who took a message for the manager that I had called back. I received a call from the manager the next day, who apologized and was very sweet,  but also informed me that HER manager wanted to talk to me and apologize. It's been 2 and a half weeks and am still waiting for a call. By the way, first yelp review.   -Russ

hAmT6IfvviRBW7ce6WAO0Q.text: Amazing food and attentive service. The inside was nice and my food was amazing. I even scraped all the sauce off the plate. It was moderately priced and I know I'm paying for top notch food and service. Thy also have a rewards program with deals and specials often.

i14kJxj6gqO8CBA7RxARdw.text: I have not once had a bad experience in either locations an would recommend the lamb chops an chicken parm to die for!! Also for an appetizer you must try the spinach artichoke dip they have its honestly AMAZING!!

QGfZZFruqxdwxlpUDhGRbA.text: Nice restaurant food is great . My advice is don't sit outside , there were Pigeons all around our table , so gross ugh .Their Sangrias suck they are so bitter my friend had to doctor hers up not cool .

BlN3u28ZgMqdJTsvWuTKdQ.text: Conveniently located in a great neighborhood is all I can say for this trip?  Service was professional and friendly -most in our party were happy with dinner - just wasn't my day, I guess?  :-( .  Restaurant and restrooms were noticeably... well, could be cleaner?  Meals were small in portion, wine was way over-priced for the offering or am I spoiled by COSTCO?  ha, ha.  Fry cook for a chef?  Don't order the Salmon.  I've been very please in several visits in the past... don't know if there was a change in managers or the kitchen might just be having a bad day?  I'll try em again - and might pick up the tab next time :-) Thank you Bob, for dinner - the company was awesome!

mPbwVtGt5PdPW4F-YassAw.text: I have only been here for happy hour but tonight we decided to sit down for dinner and I'm glad we did.  We had some of the most amazing food.  I highly recommend the gluten free chicken pesto.  We had amazing service with Kirsten so if you get a chance ask for her.

vbw06F9eqWOwEWav4eE2PQ.text: The Lobster Bisque at Brio is amazing! I always order the soup every time I dine in. I also order the Salmon Fresco which is also good, however, the Lobster Bisque is truly amazing in my opinion.

uGybV-anvyEl6GgKp3pjwA.text: Sorry, but even though the food and service is fine, their lack of knowledge and information for this year's Lasagna Day was not.   In the past, lasagna day was half off their lasagna dish. I called a week ahead to see if this was still True and made reservations when the person on the phone said it was. One week later, we get there and sit down and order. The waiter didn't know about this at all, or what the special was. Before he took our orders, the salads that came with the lasagna were included. And yet after we got the check and I asked about the discount, he said the manager said that the salads were what were given for free.   Unless they come out with better and more clear announcements so that everyone is on board, not four different people thinking different things, I'll have to cancel the lasagna anniversary. =(

xZuO00YdIU81S9Lqq2VJqg.text: I had dinner with the family and decided too try Brio again since couple weeks ago the wait was too long for my brother guys my nieces. Happily not much of wait at all most part soon walked in got seated. They had live band playing outside that night outside on the patio. So the place had nice lively vibe too it especially around the patio/bar area. So I do need too come back because like the whole outdoor, open fire pit, and HH prices looks like steal.   I came in for dinner with the family. We ordered two appetizers too share start artichoke spinach dip and calamari. Both really good. I enjoyed about the artichoke spinach dip was the fact it came with lavosh crackers rather then typical beard. It gave the dish another spin with the crispy lavosh topped with nice hot dip on top! It was nice creamy texture, vibrant green color, and great flavor. The calamari was solid nice crispy moist hot on in the inside comes with two different sauce one traditional marinade sauce and other not sure. Each sauce paired nice with the crispy calamari. Both were great starter before our entrees.  I had the chicken milanese. Break it down same as chicken parmesan. The chicken breast had perfect golden crust on the outside nice crispy and cooked perfectly on the inside! It was nice HOT and moist throughout! It served on bed of noodles cooked perfectly and saute with in some kind of butter sauce. Outside around the bed of pasta had red sauce. I really enjoyed everything on the plate nothing left too show!  The atmosphere feel like upscale version of Olive Garden. The prices are not that really upscale might be slightly more expensive then Olive Garden. It great alternative if looking for Italian food. The staff there from time walked in too our server all greeted us with smile, warm welcome, and fabulous job! If in the near the area would stop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Milanese

xP2tZUiNyyezxdWHMTjF8w.text: This establishment is in the Tivoli Mall. The service was very good. The food was excellent. We ordered Campanella Carbonara and one of the Risotto specials. Both were very tasty. Also a Caesars salad and a nine oz glass of house wine. Price was reasonable.

8fMqMuVx74CoL3IgLoNU0Q.text: Nice atmosphere, upscale decor in Tivoli. Friendly but disjointed service. Our salads arrived but mine didn't.  Was pleasantly surprised by the Bistecca Insalata, crisp fresh greens with the right amount dressing when it finally arrived. My Veal Milanese was a big disappointment, tasted oily and reheated, the angel hair pasta was dry and the veg were either under cooked or dried out and wrinkled. The caper wine sauce was almost nonexistent.  The other 5 in our party were satisfied and enjoyed their meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Milanese

SAQLnYat16Tc2rMaFxmCBg.text: Ahh, Brio. The finer side of dining. It is one of my favorite place to eat pasta and salad. But not at this location. Town Square is much better, and nicer too!   Ambiance: 3 - I mean, since you have the huge one at Town Square to compare it to, with TS's nice, high ceilings and romantic lighting..this location would be average. Tivoli seems like it caters more to families than the couples, adults, and tourists that crowd Town Square, sipping on wine and fancily buttering their bread.   Service: 4 - Our server was extremely funny and had a great personality. If there's one thing about Summerlin..they know customer service.   Food: 3 - First thing that has to get out: Food is a bit too pricey for what it is. I mean $15 dollars for a steak salad?! Come on now haha!   I do admit that I am really into salads lately, and Brio's sliced steak salad is one of my favorite combinations of meat and greens. But I do remember thinking that it was wayyy better at TS.   It was the meat that was -just slightly- better in quality at the other location. JUST slightly. It just tasted better at TS.   Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad. It was average. Brio Tivoli is still a fair place to eat. But if there was a race... Brio Town Square would win.

bpmi99fB1z3FT72nSd6qag.text: The service is great and the food even better. I am not a huge pasta fan, but this restaurant converts me into one while I am there. :) I have eaten here for lunch and dinner multiple times and have never been disappointed.   I would recommend a menu item, but I don't think you can go wrong with anything you pick!

O-mjuoeBaajqlOfMlGXqxQ.text: A wonderful first time experience here. As we often do on a first experience we over ordered and ALL WAS GREAT. I'm sure we will borrow some of their selection's to create at home.A separate menu with the specials included photos of each selection was appreciated. Nice touch with questions to our server Britney we let her guide us and she did not dissapoint. A nice conversation with manager Hanna about our anniversary made us feel like a regulars on our first visit. As it was Graduation night they were  accommodating all size party's with ease. Next visit we will sit outside. In all its delicious and charming.

Rz1Ny23etqxSi-eCVfEIiA.text: We arrived last Friday, 4/21 at 4:30 & seated ourselves outside.  This was to begin my partner's birthday celebration which always goes on for 5 days (like mine).  The place was very busy & had a few new servers; thus, we waited too long for our water & drinks.  In fact, the couple next to us received their drinks before us.  So, while my partner went to inquire, the food arrived (shortly after my wine)...   beef carpaccio, cheeseburger & the mozzarella salad.  He returned to the table with Chef Mike who profusely apologized & proceeded to take care of us with the old favorite eggplant shrimp.  If you've not tried that, do treat yourself !  The special surprise was birthday TIRAMISU which we gobbled down in 3 minutes because it was sooooo good!  And all the other food was equally as delicious.  I love the addition of that mozzarella salad which is substantial and, unlike 90% of the other happy hours in town, is a healthy menu item.  Our new server, Ashley, is from Oregon & a wonderful new staff member.  Chef Mike is from upstate New York & loves fishing, which subject will quickly engage him.  We've been frequenting Brio's since its opening and all these years have rarely, only rarely been disappointed.  With this little glitch, how can we complain?

1lzw0UuJinFyRoiiRQwAVQ.text: So sad! We wanted to love this place! Went for brunch and had the most annoying server... Finally ordered (we couldn't make up Our minds) and I opted to start with a salad and artichoke dip. Dip was okay. Nothing special. I'd love to mention the salad but it never came. Got the spicy chicken bacon sandwich. BEWARE it tastes like chipotle sauce and mayonnaise only! It was the most awkward tasting item is ever had before! French toast was underwhelming as well. Very tart with some gross lemon filling. But the fruit and syrup were delicious. Which we had to ask for syrup from three different people. Bc we were still hungry we ordered a side of scrambled eggs... Which took twenty minutes to arrive. Then I had to go to the bar for ketchup. It was just an overall poor experience. We wanted to love this place. The patio is very nice to enjoy! We had a great time people watching!

op9irQOtyE2otQLQ72Ln8w.text: Good solid establishment. Friendly, good serve, clean. Lovely outdoor seating.  Our server, Ashley, was friendly and competent.   Thanks, Brio!

obQDBaBSKMoS2J3OcUlfeg.text: When ever we come in, it's always beyond busy so rather than wait an hour for a table, we usually request to sit at the bar bc there's hardly ever a wait, service is quick and they have tvs for those days when we wanna watch a game.  Carpaccio is my FAV here, I crave for the damn thing. Unfortunately I get too full off of that and the dinner bread that I don't really get the chance to try anything else. DISCLAIMER: I don't eat very much so appetizers usually do me fine as an entry-- don't judge me.  The ONLY complaint that I have about our visits to this restaurant is that the parking SUCKS. We end up putting the car in Valet than bother with parking.

MlScvpLRPRRFAnVUiN57Pw.text: Loved it, we sat outside in the evening and we had a great time. The service was very friendly with genuine care. The food is outstanding!

A7bTsQSHfaKtRxC_fDhK9w.text: What a pleasant surprise that I received a phone call from the general manager and when I  return from vacation I'm taking him up on his. offer for a complementary lunch/dinner. The general manager was warm and friendly on the phone and I look forward to meeting him!

Ron6l_drz5kFoIZi9ONT7A.text: Dropped in for a snack at the bar and staff was very attentive and engaging.  I've got a goofy food allergy/sensitivity and the chef was prompted to come out and work with me on items he'd prepare to avoid said allergy. Awesome.

iPvQJvBVc67dxVMAU5SaZg.text: I went for happy hour. I had the shrimp eggplant dish, brio burger, and the potato skins. I liked the items in that order. The shrimp eggplant is  ridiculously tasty. Brio burger is better than average. The potato skins are forgettable. Service was good and the sangria is tasty.

fVyVOWVTp4p4MfypyXtd5w.text: Went for lunch today. I can't wait to return. Had a strawberry chicken salad. They serve you warm bread. Happy hour looks really good. I plan to return for that. The service was 5 star and the ambience 5 star and food 5 star. Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked so good. I will be back soon. Tivoli village is such a beautiful place too.

nE3G05D_qrWVXrgkX9NCVA.text: We went to Brio at Tivoli Village last night to celebrate my father in law's 60th birthday. I wish I could remember our server's name because she made the night (white, dark blonde hair pulled back, funny)!   The food was great. 2 of us got the gargonzola crusted beef medallions. YUM! One got tortellini and one got the gargonzola crusted lamb chops. We also had calamari and caesar salads for appetizers. All food was great. We had cocktails and then got a bottle of wine. The wine selection never disappoints. Toward the end of dinner, they brought out creme brulee with a candle for the bday boy which was nice. The table ordered dessert drinks (I had an amazing port wine!).   So why only 3 stars? We loved the service and the food. The problem was the fire alarm. It went off not once but twice during dinner. So loud thay everyone was plugging their ears. Strobe lights flashing. It took a very long time for it to stop each time. I understand that this might be out of the restaurants control, but they could have done something to appease the few tables of people in the restaurant. After the first alarm, a manager walked around apologizing. After the second, nothing. There weren't many people in the restaurant at 9:30 so it would have been a nice gesture to at least offer a drink on the house or something. No more apologies or compensation. It just seems a little unprofessional when we're spending $300 and had to sit through alarms twice.   If you can go and avoid the alarm (or don't mind them not caring if it ruins your dinner), everything else is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

niCco6pffT7V_xLwtSPFXw.text: Great happy hour spot! There are big, circular booths in the bar area that are perfect for a group of girlfriends after work. HH drinks are between $4-5 and appetizers are about the same and perfect for sharing around the table.  The place doesn't have a ton of personality, but the food, drinks, and service are wonderful.

A-cOApctOZEBBNctoZhwjw.text: LOVED THIS PLACE! My girlfriend and I were really bored one night and were driving around and just spontaneously decided to come here for dinner...   We were seated right away and we were able to pick our table we wanted outside. They were very nice and accommodating. Our waiter he was really nice however I think he was a little overwhelmed that night.. we got forgotten about a couple times, but seriously the food made up for it 100 percent.   I ordered a Mango Sangria and ohh let me tell you how tasty that was! Best Sangria I think I have ever had.   Definitely worth checking out. For a chain this place was awesome. The food was outstanding our calamari was cooked perfectly.. I hate when it comes out rubbery. Their caesar salad is so amazing as well as their Pepperoni and Sausage Flatbread... just writing this review is making me crave the flatbread again..

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So so good! Flatbread and Calamari!

0yAaa5SvuWFpJJxKw6kYDw.text: Wow! Waiter sucked she was not attentive this is  Our first time here she was chatting away at bar  Waited to get her attention for a while oh boy  Let's wait see how good is

HoiNwlR4b6rDPaO9CcZO8g.text: Tonight I visited Brio (Trivoli Village location) with a large group (about 25 people). They set us aside in a semi-private area and assigned us two dedicated waiters. If you take anything else away from this review, it should be that those waiters were exceptional. Really more than exceptional!!! As far as I am aware, they didn't mess up a single thing for the entire group, they were patient and attentive, my water glass was always full, I always had a drink in front of me, plates were cleared promptly and on top of it all they were friendly and engaged. And it should be noted that we were ordering off the menu, not working with a pre-fixed menu even though we had a large group.   The ambiance of the restaurant is great and they had a nice little patio (which we couldn't take advantage of since it was raining), everything was clean and not overly crowded feeling.  Now for the food. All of our food, including a full arrangements of appetizers ordered for the party, arrived to our tables timely and piping hot. The presentation was beautiful. Their drinks (especially the Italian Mule) were amazing. However, the reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that, for me, the food was average. I tried the tomato caprese, Margherita flatbread, the roasted garlic, spinach and artichoke dip, the sorrento chicken soup and fettuccini Alfredo.  With our group, we tried every appetizer on the menu and a good selection of dishes and desserts. All of their food was ok, the flavors were all a little too heavy, or the seasoning was a little off, or not quite as crisp was I would like. This being said, pretty much everyone else in the group was raving about how much they liked their food so this might come down to personal preferences but for me their food was average.   That being said, I'd probably eat their again if for no other reason than their excellent service.

GK7nrVpzlmcmlcE8Kcmuhg.text: I've come to this brio a few times this year, and each time it's been okay. It's located inside tivoli village and parking isn't overly complicated. Valet is also available. I would give 3.5 if it was an option.   The interior is very similar to all the other Brio's in town. The patio is a little nicer than the town sq location. The bar area is a decent size and has comfortable booths. The food is consistent as well as the service, which is a huge plus... however, there isn't anything overly special about either. They did accommodate my love for vegetables for an added cost which was a plus, but they were bland and i had to ask for more seasoning. It's Italian food, very Americanized and very commercial. I've attended the brunch on Sunday as well and they did have avocado toast which was delicious. Will i return? Yes. They have pretty decent happy hour which is always great with friends or for a quick bite before a movie with my guy.

djzNIt2ynnJZuelwGe4D5g.text: Shoutout to Gail for her excellent service!  The generous serving of Bruschetta Sampler was visually appealing and worth every bite. Tummy wishes fulfilled! It was "molto delizioso"!  I ordered the very appetizing and Strawberry Balsamic Salmon Salad, served with mixed greens, grilled-to-perfection salmon, grapes, Gordonzola and herb vinaigrette. Can a fish dish be refreshing? Yes!  My friend ordered the Mezza Chicken Limone (middle picture) with capers, lemon, roasted vegetables, and Yukon Gold mashed potatoes. Lovely!  Another friend ordered the Shrimp Mediterranean (top photo). Spicy, grilled shrimps served with orzo, farro, broccoli, asparagus, tomatoes, spinach, Feta, and drizzled with pesto vinaigrette. Mouth-watering!  I recommend this lovely eat-to-your-heart's-content restaurant in lovely Tivoli Village. Bring your visiting friends & family. They will enjoy it as much as you!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another friend ordered the Shrimp Mediterranean (top photo). Spicy, grilled shrimps served with orzo and mixed veggies.
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered the very appetizing and tummy-fulfilling Strawberry Balsamic Salmon Salad.
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The generous serving of Bruschetta Sampler was visually appealing and worth every bite.

srowlbrBbTVDAVMuOL926g.text: I've been coming to Brio for years. I have certain items on the menu that I absolutely crave (like the Sangria and Salmon Fresca) Well todays service was extraordinary as my bff and I self seated ourselves at the bar area. We were served by a bartender named John. I wanted to point out how incredibly handsome and sweet he is!! Best service ever!!! After I had 2 of the best sangrias in town I joking asked for some bactine for a burn I had on my shoulder from a curling iron and he went out of his way to get me some first aid ointment in the back room. Such a caring person! Seriously this shows so much of his inner character and compassion not just for his job but for people in general!

08EGrPe-f-6DnMBdwxo86g.text: Never a long wait. Wait staff is awesome on so many levels. Love Brio's loyalty reward program. Food is delish.

njY3-2iVXtNJjtEO00X43Q.text: I don't love chains and was not too happy when a couple that I was meeting for dinner made reservations here.  Wow I was wrong.  This place is DELICIOUS.  We had one of the best meals that I've had so far in Vegas here.  They are locals and have been coming here for years and said its a great spot, now I agree.  While the service was only ok, the food was delicious.  Being that I was with guests, I didn't take pictures of my food which was a little sad for me.  We ordered the spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer and for mains we ordered the chicken lemone, lasagna and pan seared salmon.  I love eggplant and that appetizer was so good.  It was extremely rich with a cream sauce but it was so flavorful.  I had a bite of my friends lasagna which was great and I had the chicken lemone and ate the whole thing.  I rarely like chicken from anywhere but this was so good.  Any chance that I get I will just come back to get that dish again.  I would try other things on the menu but I've been to one of these before.  For some reason though, this location does a really good job with the food compared to others.

Z5D_OFdY_Li21-72Di5FdQ.text: I love this place when I'm in the mood for back home Italian. I have to say, I've been here a handful of times and have only ever sat in the bar area and had apps (I'm a creature of habit!). The Italian Wedding Soup is some of the best I've ever had (seems to be served most Saturdays) - it's what draws me here. My PIC says the lobster bisque is just as good. The calamari is delicious, and is compete with banana peppers!! Finally, Vegas!! The bruchetta and flatbreads are also delicious; my favorite is the sundried tomato or the margarita. My only complaint: the wedding soup is a soup de jour, but should totally be available everyday.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the wedding soup!!
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful Christmas lights on the plaza fountain it front

cjlLMR1pEbLzQq7zCi47Zg.text: So I was gone for a few months & come back to go to my favorite happy hour & guess what! Everything changed, no more hamburger as well as other items like flat bread pizza removed & I asked for the hamburger off the regular menu (willingly ready to pay more) but removed totally. Asked what's happening & told new management. Well I I assume that had a problem making money & they figured removing items from the menu was the answer. WRONG because they just lost me as a customer. Maybe they need to look elsewhere for there sales or profit issues as removing favorite items of customers from the menu is not the way. Seems happy hour is not working out for them so making changes is one way to turn it into unhappy hour. Just charge more if u need, we can afford it as that's better than chasing us away, or why don't u stop doing happy hour if it's not working for your bottom line.

7ZpXHL43k6A6xsLuEv1Bsw.text: This establishment and management is horrible. I am vegan and they are not accommodating. The manager yelled at me and talked down to me in front of my friends. After pulling up the vegan options menu she still treated me awful. When trying to smoke my vape on the patio she threatened me.. I am beyond disappointed and wrote corporate twice. The manager is kaya Bozhinova... even her staff doesn't like her. Will not come back . Negative star

bupahGMbShfAUJQb5CMj4A.text: The food is good, the service is good, however They do not Allow you to bring your own wine. They will not allow it to be opened, not even with a corkage fee.  Not like they have that great of a wine selection either.  Needless this restaurant will be on my lower portion of my go to restaurant.

INYJAA4sPVZ3aGx7HIHrtw.text: Brio, as you probably know it's a chain... If you don't know that... Then stop reading this review because you don't deserve it :-) this Bree was pretty much like any of the real I've been to. It has all the same menu items affordable drink options and a happy hour menu. However I always love the environment. It's very bright and colorful and has a Tuscan feel to it. By the way, if you go for happy hour, make sure you get there a little bit before because they only serve it at the bar and people can be a little bit nasty and territorial about saving spots for other people. But that's not the restaurants fault :-)

Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ydY27-Hn86ZglX9KDkhxtA.text: Came during happy hour and was super happy with the quality of food service and price. Had the spicy shrimp and eggplant and was 5/5!! Will be back!!

r29tDXfLTdLPW-CQ5gkbIQ.text: Good decent Italian food. I've been to Brio's in Covington, KY and have had positive food experiences there as well. I got the lunch special which is a soup or salad and half entree. I had the Caesar salad which is your standard Caesar salad. I had the shrimp with arugula, and blistered cherry tomatoes atop an interesting shaped pasta. It needed more garlic and salt but otherwise, very tasty. Our server Jonathan, was excellent. It very pretty inside. If you're used to very good Italian food (which I am being from NY and married to an Italian man), you might be disappointed. If you're not, you'll be very happy with Brio's.

Vym09bqAQlFioam3YQQDKw.text: Super friendly service! Randy was great! Lunch combos are really good. The lobster bisque has delicious chunks of lobster in it. Very unique sweet flavor. Plenty of options for the combos. The wedge salad is my girlfriends favorite!

hIP35mlyJd-1ODCyBq6Rkw.text: This service is great. I really enjoy sitting at the bar with friends for lunch. The only bad thing I have to say about it is I think the entrees are a little expensive at times. However you get what you pay for. I wish they had more events outside in the patio. This spring should be a good time to throw any form of a neat app or a girls night out. I love the location at Tivoli Village. It's easy to get in and out of and feels very safe.

xHB24nfkNOeDh5-nx707mg.text: The service here has always been slow.  But according to other reviewers, the place is recenty under new management.  Well, as all the recent reviews note, this is not a change for the better.  The one thing that needed changing is the slow service, and it did not change at all.    What did NOT need changing was the menu but oh, have they ever gotten to work on that.  Gone is any lunch menu - replaced by a single menu that appears to be dinner pricing and all a la carte.  But are these the dinner portions?  Our server said they only have one menu now, but all our dishes were pretty small.  There are no sandwiches anymore, which was one of highlights of this place in the past.  I have to say, Brio no longer provides good value and in a town so full of restaurants I think this approach can't possibly work.  I know I won't be back anytime soon.

M6I7BcpA1R-gFW8eD1N1ng.text: This place is so so we were charged for our supposed complimentary first time dessert. The chicken was dry and it wasn't worth the cost thankfully we had a gift card. Won't be coming back. Also we called the next day to talk to a manager she said she would send us another gift card to come back and get better service. Have yet to receive anything. Save your money and go to Olive Garden it's actually better than this place.  It's in tivoli village so I expect the cost of the food is to keep up with the rent.

F0MhXDXxSX9RrFtSLBy18A.text: We had a lunch gathering for my son's 2nd birthday with my some of co workers. Our waitress was very nice, the food was good. We had Lobster Ravioli, Beef Carpaccio, Ceasar Salad, Lobster bisque, Vodka sauce pasta, Shrimp & Lobster pasta. The service was slow, it took us 30 mins for our pitcher of Red sangria that tasted like fruit punch. The chop salad i ordered never came. The food runner was very rude, he slammed the cheese on his tray and walk away after asking us if we want cheese with our meal.  All the staffs were always running around as if they were busy. It pretty empty in the restaurant.  We had to asked for our bread & butter 4 times.  My girl friend have always spoken highly about Brio, it's her favorite Italian restaurant. She was embarrassed that she suggested this location. At the end they did take off the salad I never got off the bill and also the lobster I was really watery.  We've been to other locations, and had never terrible service.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a0Hg9Y3POy_LxQ6gvn8_1Q.text: I just love Brio....they are very consistent. I can always count on Brio to serve me up some tasty vittles when I'm hungry for some good Italian fare2016  2018 Update....Omg placed order through GrubHub, never arrived. Called and spoke with Joe, seems GrubHub tablet has been 'missing' for at least two weeks. Claims stolen. Why hasn't management/GrubHub replaced the 'tablet'? A lot of missed revenue....

UmD2Y8eRyLXbIUnv6YVtzQ.text: I love this place. I love the lobster bisque!! It was delicious, I often think about it. I've loved everything I've ever ordered... The steak, the mahi mahi, the vegetarian ravioli, and dessert. Must. Order. Dessert! Get the sampler, the whole sampler. Yum

1MQOmJ0LNvxN-8_XfePAnQ.text: Brio is very good especially for the price. The lemon chicken is excellent service is good staff is mostly friendly. Bartenders pour a good drink especially if you are sitting at the bar and are specific about what you want (strength of drink and what not)

ZhOQM3NB4PW7dvSZpv9Eew.text: Always delicious. Still has the best lava cake I can find anywhere. The chicken limone is always delicious, as well as the Caesar salad. Pasta alla vodka was to die for! Also, get the bruschetta sampler if you've never had their's before. Guaranteed you will find a permenant favorite for the future.

uZHw-spkT9y4QC4XZOFDUQ.text: WTH BRIO you broke my heart.  I have visited brio in town square numerous times. but the Brio on Rampart is so much closer to my home. I came to enjoy their wonderful happy hour and great sangria and was heartbroken by the WORST SERVICE I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.  1) it took the waitress 35 minutes to take our order. fine fine i'll let that slide.. 2) the waitress didn't bring us any bread. we thought it was because it was happy hour but all the surrounding tables had bread.  3) we were sitting at a tiny cocktail table with 3 cups of water pitcher of sangria with 3 wine glass plus the salt/pepper sugar... summary. Not much room. when our food came he wouldn't take other dishes away. we asked him nicely to if he could take some dishes away and even passed it to him and he just walked away! HOW FREAKING RUDE. i thought he was going to put something down and come back because we CLEARLY had no room on our tiny little cocktail table to put 4 giant plates on the table and eat comfortably. but guess what. he left. like the jerk he is.  4) when we needed the bill to get out of this place the waitress was no where to be found. this was suppose to be a quick drink eat and go that ended up taking over 2 hours because the waitress forgot we existed.   the food was still consistent and delicious as expected. but nothing ruins an eating experience worse than bad customer service.  the worst part of this visit was not only was the waitress terrible and inattentive. the food server guy was also terrible. it wasn't just one person that ruined my night. it was TWO. TWO TERRIBLE WORKERS. i couldn't believe the lack of customer service we received at this place.  I'll never come back to this Brio again.

ve0NHwYL-Qn1RtBydKzvNw.text: The food is very good and I really like the ambience.  Lots of choices for trying to eat vegetarian and they're willing to improvise the menu if there's something you want. I'm still not sure about it's location in Tivoli, which appears to be a shopping center with only restaurants (?).

Rp28ZoCpKh572rOXyJh6VQ.text: Went during happy hour, which was totally loud and busy!  We got the last bar table.  It took a little while but finally someone took our drink and food order.  They forgot one of the apps, so we had to ask the waitress.  We also had to ask her repeatedly for refills.  Other than the waitress and staff who need a  bit more training in customer service, we thought the food was very good (vegs and hummus, spinach/artichoke dip, shrimp, caprese salad).  There are pita chips with everything, I'd like to see them offer something that's gluten free.  Overall, a good experience.

3oYLRnZ8h8jJWubS2QpGOw.text: We are a group of about 20 that goes to various bar/restaurants for happy hour.  On Monday 8/31 we were at Brio Tuscan Grille in Tivoli.  Although the restaurant was quite empty we were seated in the bar area with high bar stools and little round tables that barely sat 4 (some of our tabled had to squeeze 5).  There were only 2 servers.  One took the orders and the other delivered.  Unlike any other bar/restaurants we've gone to when it came time to get the bills we were told that we couldn't get individual bills.  We would get one bill for each table and it was up to us to figure out who owed what including each share of the tax.  After speaking to the manager, although she was very nice and smiley it still came down to; that's the way it is.  If you're a group of more than 4 don't go to Brio's happy hour.

fMMJ5xd2wccgS3oStFnE4A.text: Pricey, but you would expect that going into a fine dining restaurant.  Came here on a double date with some of our friends from out of town.  I forgot what cut of meat my husband ordered but we both agreed that it was one of the most tender steaks we have had.  May come back once in a while but probably wouldn't be a regular here because of the prices. Nice clean and welcoming environment.  Probably good for bigger groups looking for a nice place for a special dinner.

j5Mc5Z8VjZjpqaCPtphrQg.text: Good food, service is excellent.  A bit pricey for lunch, but overall a good experience.

F-jdDiGgNQkCzhkMamwoMA.text: Disappointing Easter brunch. Went to what was supposed to be their special Easter brunch today. Was told there would be the Easter bunny, which there was, an egg hunt, and special coloring pages for kids. Well, only the bunny made it. And the food selections were too basic: scrambled eggs, French toast, biscuits, sausages, bacon, potatoes. Also muffins and  Danishes that were obviously not made there. That's it. They even had a nice pre printed menu for the day. It's a pretty restaurant with nice atmosphere, but a real let down for special brunch.

to19e-cOD-JY_4udcgnzJA.text: Great lunch spot! See Candace at the bar...

4VN2eJG6irdQcika5drKvg.text: I would be such a happy camper if this restaurant chain opened up in California!  Their remoulade sauce and calamari is divine.  The shrimp and crabcakes with perfectly roasted vegetables (carrots, onions, peppers, asparagus, zucchini, etc.) are clean-your-plate ridiculous.  The cheesecake alone rivals the best with its cracked sugar crust, creme anglaise and peach melba (sweet raspberry) sauce drizzled all over its decadent behind.  Aww such bliss exists truly in a well prepared dinner!  The staff is also attentive and aware when you want to have a quiet moment or a full on party....

F9WOtjdG9b_McRN_OjfnIw.text: Lunch at Brios - Our 3 plates were a TRIFECTA of PERFECTION. My Steak Salad was great! Service was A+ too. Highly Recommend Brios. Enjoy =)

RoMnsdrnFcjh26FYJoMFCw.text: This location is 10x times better than Town Square. Plus we had an amazing waitress. Good job and keep it up!

JDP1a2Y6MYfyfuikTxVeVQ.text: After not loving our first experience at Brio, we visited for a second time with some friends to see if things had improved. There was nothing particularly wrong with our experience, but it wasnt mind blowing either. The service was adequate and we enjoyed dining outside. The bread given as a starter was good and my wifes Caesar salad was tasty. I ordered the seafood pasta and three of my clams were not opened, they could recognise this before sending it out. My pasta had way too much sauce and the fish was almost invisible. One of the meals came out with the wrong noodles but they apologised immediately and made a new one quickly without fuss which was great. It feels like Brio is trying to be upscale but cutting costs on the food. There are several Italian restaurants in town where the food is spectacular and while Brio is decent, it doesnt meet the level of some of these other places.

4Jk3GxfCA4gWAO5xCYynWg.text: Wow! I can't believe how good this place was.Surprisingly of the 93 reviews, no one mentioned the grilled mahi mahi with farro, spinach and a tomato basil vinaigrette. The plate was light, super tasty, and addictively good. I actually wanted MORE as I finished my last bite (a rare feeling for eating out). I substituted fries for steamed veggies. I was also surprised at how "inexpensive" it was - $17.50 a plate is less than mahi mahi plates at places of similar caliber (i.e., McCormick's and Salt Creek). Would love to visit this place again next time I'm in town.

9WqGpqjIScrC10o8ZSnzrw.text: I liked the Town Square location the one or two times I was there. But the food I got at the Tivoli location was mediocre at best. The sweet potato and chicken risotto ($16.25) was gummy and tasted like paste. The fettuccine napoli ($15.95) was better, but nothing stellar. The best thing I tried was the kid's cheese pizza. Yeah, that means the place is kid friendly. The prices are reasonable -- although from what I hear happy hour is the best time to go since apps are $3 each.

_SBFxJMswXSspzd4hul9Jw.text: They have an awesome happy hour, but unfortunately we missed it by 5 minutes. No one else's fault but ours. I had a corona and my husband had a couple long islands. The bbq chicken flat bread was good, nothing special. This place kind of never hits the spot for me, and the food is always just O.K. This time we even knew the assistant manager but it didn't help that the restaurant was so crowded and servers looked a little overwhelmed. I really like the atmosphere thought, so might go back again for happy hour.

yfg7JdBFBly-58y7L69R2w.text: Love brio always the best food

vGUFgd6vhtGzbpVBfV5XWg.text: Good food, good service, nice decor. A little on the pricey side but overall a very nice place for dinner.

6GJJovVzJdn3TU6SIJn3Ag.text: Came here for the lunch happy hour and I have to say that Brio maybe possibly have the best happy hour I've ever had! The food portions are very large, the prices are great, and the service was phenomenal! Our waitress (I believe her name was Mary, short reddish brown ponytail) was so sweet, she constantly had a smile on her face and was so attentive even though she was very busy. So excited to have discovered this happy hour and my boyfriend and I are looking forward to coming back as soon as possible! Thanks Brio

BxE-cntCmCXPYY-4WucGbw.text: My waiter was great and my drinks were great.... the food was not good at all!! The lasagna use to be phenomenal but now it is straight garbage- they have lessened the meat that was in it and added Alfredo sauce. Mixing Alfredo and Red sauce in lasagna is absolutely disgusting!! They need to return to the original lasagna..... further, when I walked in the host completely ignored me and acting like I wasn't standing there, then seated the couple behind me. I will not be returning to Brio.

PTa_-dthvLKojhyY5QoKJw.text: Well the best thing is that they offer a happy hour at 9pm (last hour before closing) not just drinks but bar foods too. Very nice. Area is nice a little but quite for a Tuesday night. Lol.  Drinks could be a little stronger but for the price decent.

vQp3m7UWUpdXs1OHFTHQww.text: Whenever I want consistently good food and friendly service I go to Brio... It never disappoints.   The location in Tivoli village is pretty busy on weekends and Friday night so be sure to call ahead to make reservations. :)   Food Recommendations:  I highly recommend the calamari! It's very good and comes with 2 types of sauce.  The Caesar salad is also great!  For main courses I suggest the steak salad or the Gorgonzola steak medallions. I've tried other things on the menu and always come back to those two!  The lava cake is also pretty good!   The service is consistently good as well! We had a waiter (Alberto I think was his name) that was super attentive and made the experience fun!   If you have never tried Brio I recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava Cake with vanilla ice cream

wf7IinYXJ2-A5_Y90G_DYQ.text: We came in with less than an hour of closing- the lady who seated us was professional and very kind! Bread was at our table quickly from when we sat. Our waiter, a guy with some cool funky hair, was wonderful! He got our apps and dinner to us quick. The eggplant and shrimp- so delicious the shrimp is seasoned perfectly, and I don't even like shrimp that much. The lobster bisque- my boyfriend loved it so much. Not disappointed at all. I got a chicken and angel hair pasta dish- I'm kinda a snub when it comes to pasta, but there was nothing to complain about! My boyfriend got the crab cakes- the veggies were pretty salty but the cakes great! We got mini cheesecakes to go we didn't want the staff to have to wait on us past closing: not really fair. My only complaint about dinner is that our table wasn't cleaned off completely. But will be returning again.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy shrimp and eggplant delicious
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crumbs on the table

7amord9TD4J3M_HNKhcMIQ.text: Visited on Valentine's day. This place was pack and it didn't seam like things where being handled very well. Well we didn't know that the system went down and they just needed an extra min to get a work around plan together. After being seated we had Jennifer as a server. Super nice gal. We've never been in a place where the sense of urgency was so high. The food runner was actually running at some points, (it was scary) managers where bussing food as well. For it being so busy the food came out with perfect timing and tasted fantastic. Huge applause to the guy who was bussing the food out way to hassle I hope the waiter take care of you.

9cUZT9EYlEH3vKLhze4X8A.text: Probably the worst service we have ever had in Vegas. Server forgot silverware, didn't bring it even though we asked her to, and basically forgot about us the entire meal when it was not busy. We will not be returning and my husband felt he completely wasted money on lunch here.

XD4DJVC3qjxDM6lIHAB_qA.text: The Bread and ice tea are very good but the other meals were terrible. Chicken Lemon was not good at all the server got our order wrong. There were 9 of us so that could have been why. Not sure I am going to us the free appetizer card.

_X5CwcXSga5QBWpT8-wg2w.text: Went here for lunch today and ordered the chicken Marsala. It was amazing and the vegetables were fresh. I love grilled veggies. I wasn't disappointed at all and the service was great. Definitely will come here again

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XeTddWb2Sda-gu0jmJt6Yg.text: Amazing food and more amazing service. Strongly suggest being served by Frank! The absolute best waiter on the planet! He totally made our night!

y3wNhBGx-2XuNxlSSEcq_Q.text: Terrible food, ok service. Worst Bloody Mary I've had in my whole life. For the cost and quality I would've / should've gone across the street to echo and rig...  Got the Sicilian omelette and it was as if they took a pasta dish and added eggs, bad. Lobster bisque tasted like plain butter, gross.

GXY12yMgob5EzLwq57Q1RA.text: First time here on a whim for lunch with my friend and her daughter.  Customer service rocked. Loved that our waiter was honest and told us the girls could share one kids meal because the portion is so large. Guess what?! He was right. The girls couldn't even finish it with splitting it. They got Mac n cheese which was extremely cheesy goodness. Thick not runny and I made sure to steal a bite... Hey I had to make sure it wasn't poisoned right!? ;)  Us moms decided upon something light and refreshing since everything on the menu looked heavy. Soup and salad it was. The salad was just okay, the dressing was good. Some type of vinaigrette. It was chopped into tiny pieces with feta cheese, tomatoes, black olives, cucumber an romaine lettuce. Very large. Then the soup was lobersterlicious!! Aka, lobster bisque. Oh my god, I cannot stop raving about it. Creamy, buttery, lobster goodness. It was rich, and delicious. Large portion again. I downed that sucker almost licking the bowl. I will come just for that, for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids Mac n cheese
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque

FJo9WdcSZ9NXBlJKooi_pQ.text: I came here for the first time for Easter lunch with family.  I understand that it was a crowded and hectic day that may account for the lackluster food, but, still, I think the food should hold up, regardless.  One of us had the brunch item of French Toast; another had a club sandwich; I had the salmon salad.  The food overall was just mediocre.  Good enough, but we won't be back.  My salmon in the salad was quite delicious and cooked perfectly, but the bed of greens was not high quality and the tomatoes were cut into tiny, tiny little pieces -- obviously to use in all the other dishes but weird for a salad.  The grilled asparagus in the salad was withered and too tough to eat except for the very tips. I couldn't even cut the stems with my knife.  The 'shoestring' potatoes were a nice touch, but not too many of these. I chose to omit the feta cheese, so that was the extent of this salad -- good salmon, poor greens, tiny bits of tomato, tough asparagus, and good but sparse shoestring potatoes.   Beyond the food, the place was really too loud to have a good conversation -- it was crowded, of course.  The decor was outdated.  Service was cordial but slow, but I attributed it to the busy day.  I see others have commented on slow service, so it may not have been due to the Easter Sunday crush, but I won't be coming back to find out.  Too many good restaurants in Las Vegas for me to come back here.

m-B2Y86LgTJ-66FVPU_h_w.text: Brio is definitely a house favorite for my family and I. We're definitely a regular for multiple reasons!   From the lovely ladies who greeted us to the front to the gentleman that continued to monitor our table to make sure our drinks were refilled as well as our bread basket. Our server was and always is very friendly and needless to say patient. We're pretty indecisive mainly because every dish is so great. I usually don't step out my comfort zone and try new things but here I have no issue picking something new! Yes, I'm that annoying customer who will ask the server what their favorite dish is. I wanted something spicy so I got a pasta dish and as I write this review I've forgotten the name. The point is though you can't go wrong with whatever you choose.   One thing I will recommend to fellow yelpers is you have to, HAVE TO try their Spicy Eggplant and Shrimp. Don't let the eggplant part scare you off. I know it's not everyone's first choice but you can't go wrong with this dish. It contains pan seared shrimp, Romano crusted eggplant and the best part the black pepper cream sauce. It'll immediately turn into one of your favorites.   Also, this location had a great happy hour with live music on the patio! It seemed like everyone was enjoying their time while we choose to sit in dinning area.   Great service, great dishes and a nice atmosphere; WINNING.

3vOLMghSmF0FROOZIcr5fw.text: Im always excited to go to the Brio at town square because it's fun and full of people. I'm never excited about this Tivoli location and I'm not sure why.  The food is the same and it looks nice. I think it's just the quieter vibe of Tivoli village. Also once u eat at Brio there isn't much else to do here at Tivoli. At town square there are so many shops, bars restaurants and the theater to visit.

YXImsp9_oAVbJHWG43oC9Q.text: I had a reservation this afternoon for two. We arrived and they did not have a patio table available for us so we opted to wait at the bar. Approximately thirty minutes went by and we were seated.  As we sat there, we noticed three servers greet the table next to us. Meanwhile, not one server approached us. After about ten minutes of waiting, we decided to just leave and have brunch elsewhere. We were excited to try a new place for brunch, but didn't get the opportunity and we won't be back. There are way to many restaurants in this town with better service.

dPDDdi_rzdf7Z3OQoXsUjw.text: Brio is absolutely AMAZINGGGG!!! We love bringing all of our out of town guests here. The happy hour is just so HAPPY! We love the Tivolli location because of the cuteness factor! The drinks and food are great!  One little thing did happen last time we were in which NEVER EVER happens. They were out of our favorite dish :( the beef carpaccio. It was so sad because we normally both order one. It was still a great evening and we will be back soon for the beef carpaccio!!!

OSTFF5IMtVIUXatDdyAe7w.text: Had a wonderful experience tonight- sat outside to enjoy a glass of wine and appetizer- our waiter was the best- so polite and professional. Clifton made our experience special! Love going out and being able to enjoy the beautiful outdoors. Thanks Clifton ~ we will be back soon and will hope to have you with us again.

iZww1frAeAhk9mW99P9p0A.text: Beautiful setting! Superb ambiance! Lobster bisque is delicious.  The Ravioli is awesome.  Service is always good to excellent.  Entree Salads are huge and wonderful.  I love Brio Tuscan Grill, as do many of my friends from Vegas and St George, Utah.

pJ2qkiwBMdMrfvwH6tvJwQ.text: This is very close to where I live so my gfs and I enjoy coming for their happy hours. The food is amazing, service is good too.
