dyhDP69cjQ6bOepWw7b_zw.text: Last night we went to Brio! This was only my second time there but a couple of friends and I got to go to celebrate our friends birthday. It was pretty busy, but we had a made a reservation so we got sat right away. Evan was our server. He was amazing! He was very attentive, and kid friendly. Which is huge for me! I have two kids. He recommended the shrimp and eggplant and the shrimp & lobster fettuccine, both of which were delicious.   To top it off, Natalie the manager took care of the chocolate cake we ordered for our friends birthday. We were pleasantly surprised by our experience at Brio and we will definitely be back!

PyBmm9lzAxHAIdp5bR1IIg.text: Anti-climatic.   This place has all the things that would make you think it's amazing. From the location right in Tivoli village, to the elegant decor and upscale service.   We decided to try it out for lunch. I ordered the pasta carbonara. Even the waiter was like, "Oh that's a really good choice!" with enthusiasm when I ordered. Great, I thought, I'm getting excited. When it came, honestly, it seemed like it was reheated leftovers. The outside was cold and dry while the inside was piping hot (almost like as if it was out of the microwave). The sauce was not saucy, it was dry and not at all creamy that you would expect from a carbonara. Extremely disappointing. I would rather spend $5-$10 less at a competitor restaurant that has way better quality of food.   My husband ordered a salad and shrimp pasta. They didn't have the house salad made at 12:45pm for some reason? He had to substitute for a chopped salad. That plus the shrimp pasta were mediocre at best, and unimpressive, especially for the cost.   The service was great and the only reason for the second star to be honest.   Needless to say, we'll definitely never be back.

NbODSPUMUGtkNDEIJJk4vg.text: This restaurant is tucked away in Tivoli Village. It's a bit of a drive, across from the Suncoast Casino.  The decor is subtle Tuscan, open and comfortable.    Our drinks were excellent!  Some of the best mixed drinks we have had.  The drink menu is varied and interesting.   The Italian food was very well prepared, and had excellent flavors.  And - it was not heavy.  We ate meals and left feeling satisfied but not overly stuffed.  Just the right portions.  Service was attentive and pleasant.  For us, a lovely restaurant experience.

2azdTDeluFdkFlYOjM19Mg.text: We went to the Tivoli village location on S.Rampart. I usually go to the Town Square location. I would of rated it a 5 star if our waitress gave our table of 10 people better service and if our desserts had a better presentation and tasted better. The Town square location is always better in those areas. So we shared appetizers which was Beef carpaccio w/ mustard aioli and parmigiana| Jumbo Lump Crab Cake| Lobster Bisque|  For dessert~ Chocolate Molten Cake w/ Vanilla Bean Gelato

BD0x0xOuHxbA0Nf045K5Jw.text: The food here is delish. I think you can't go wrong in whatever you order here.   Service on the other hand is hit and miss. This review is averaging out our multiple visits of family dinner and lunch outs at Brio. A few times, our server took a while to even get our drink orders, and deliver our food. The other guests have done and left, our food was nowhere near being served. We honestly thought we were forgotten. Other times, the service was spot on.   Just don't come here when you're hungry since the service can be hit and miss. We've made that a point now before deciding to pick Brio for a meal out. With kids, it can be quite unsettling and temper-flaring to be waiting for service AND your food for a loooooong time.

w5M1WHbGIl4ChtRbuK_pTw.text: Good food, terrible service. Went on a lunch break with 3 others. Took way too long to get our orders taken, never got drink refills. Even after I placed the empty glass at the end of the table. When asked if there was a vegetarian option for soup, the way Edgar said no seemed almost irritated and not empathetic at all. Edgar never checked in on us to make sure we needed anything else, which, we did. He didn't seem warm or friendly or seemed like he liked his job. I gave 2 stars because the lobster bisque and salads we all got which were delicious, otherwise a bad service experience would've been a 1. I also wish he asked about the bill instead of assuming we all wanted to pay together.

MZ9QcrHFHkxsQpQu4vVOoQ.text: Mmmm it's aight It's a nice restaurant with a nice ambiance  The menu is good!  Quality and taste is good  Honestly probably wouldn't come back again bc it wasn't great  Service was decent :)

qvV6IwRHvsjPYrvg96meww.text: One of my favorite restaurants to just grab a couple drinks and appetizers. Food is always delicious and staff is very attentive.

zx_y9hn3Mna7tBSGIcCNBw.text: My bestie and I love this location. The food is always on point and they have a decent wine list. Their house wine is also very good. Mike was our server on one of our recent visits. Mike gave us the perfect amount of attention. He was so terrific that we nicknamed him Magic Mike! Thank you for a great experience!

sRl745um0bjBB1hrZMD3Gw.text: Somehow even after being in Vegas for a while, tonight was our first time at Brio! We had a delicious meal. Great garlic spinach and artichoke dip, yummy salad and lasagna and good wine. The best part, though, was the service. Michael was our server and he was fantastic. Very attentive, friendly, will definitely be coming back and asking for him. Thanks Michael!

7HollC07lI19YU3D4G4nVA.text: We met another couple at Brio, at TIVOLI VILLAGE on South Rampart for dinner.  We made reservations, it was a weekday and around 5pm.  There was not a lot of people so the service was great.  We had a waiter check on us continuously.   We were seated in a booth that was specious for four.  The restaurant it self was clean and inviting.   The food was tasty and served hot, every dish looked delicious.   Everyone in our party was very happy with their selection.  Only one draw back, what Italian restaurant doesn't serve meatballs.  They offer a list of pasta dishes, an no meatballs, not even offered as a side dish.  The waiter offered a meat sauce,  instead.   The meat sauce was good, had I wanted meat sauce.  That's the main part of any good Italian dinner.  The meatballs make or break the cook.

OfcsHXmhj_7MaU8V6HmhHA.text: Happy hour review only.  Brio Tuscan Grille's first location in town is at Town Square, and that outpost is far more accessible to me normally. However, some friends and I had just wrapped up our first stop of a happy hour crawl at another Tivoli Village destination, so I was more than happy to take a short walk over here.  Happy hour here is Mon-Fri 3:30-6:30pm, and we were able to find one of those U-shaped booths in the bar area to enjoy a comfortable meal. I was disappointed to learn that they have only three beer options ($5 each), and I didn't feel like trying any of what they had on hand or partaking in the other drink options ($5 martinis on Wednesday, $5 wine glasses with expanded selection on Thursdays, $5-6 cocktails), aside from fun and surprisingly coconutty sip of my friend's Cosmopolitan.  However, the food menu ($4-6) was more than enough to keep me entertained. I was pleasantly surprised that there are more options than at sister restaurant Bravo Cucina Italiana, which is located near me in Henderson but never truly impressed me for some reason. I enjoyed pretty much everything which we shared at our table.  Margherita Flatbread ($4): very crispy, cracker-thin flatbread with fresh, traditional toppings. Fun, but not very filling.  Buffalo Chicken "Nachos" ($5): potato chips cut not-so-thinly with a surprisingly amazing supporting cast of sauces, cheeses, and of course Buffalo chicken (mildly spicy at best) made this the one that I'd pick as my favorite out of the meal. I didn't even order it, but I'll strongly consider doing so next time.  Warm Margherita Dip ($5): a very creamy cheese blend with delicious tomato compote on top and crispy, charred ciabatta to play vehicle. Another to add to my reorder list.  Beef Carpaccio ($5): plentiful plate of thinly-sliced beef with mustard aioli, a mix of greens including arugula (my fave), and capers. Parmesan cracker to boot, although it's a bit awkward to break for sharing.  Black Pepper Shrimp ($6): shocker of the menu simply due to huge potion. Amply sized shrimp atop squares of crispy eggplant, all in a black pepper cream sauce. Would've been my fave if it had been just a touch less salty.  I'll definitely have to find an excuse to visit the other local Brio now that I'm aware of what I've been missing out on, but this one is a good alternative if you're anywhere in the vicinity and would be happy not to wait at all to find an open seat for happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Pepper Shrimp ($6 happy hour)
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Carpaccio ($5 happy hour)
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Margherita Dip ($5 happy hour)

Qgq4Zi1aRozM0OB8UoP3cg.text: (Happy Hour Review)  Recently came here for Happy Hour after a day of shopping for some new furniture, last one being nearby at Living Spaces in Boca Park, across the street.   Conveniently located in Tivoli Village, in one of the "corners" of the round about, directly across from Echo & Rig. This location doesn't seem as big as the Town Square location.   Since we were there for Happy Hour, you just walk to the bar area and sit down at any open area. There was a small table open between two parties so we sat there.   Beef Carpaccio - Shaved tender beef, field greens, capers, mustard aioli, Parmigiano Reggiano, Parmesan flatbread  Regular item i've always gotten during Happy Hour. Simple carpaccio brightened up with capers and aioli.   Margherita Flatbread - Vine-ripened tomatoes, Mozzarella, basil  Originally my mom wanted to get the caprese salad for the mozzarella but i told her we had the same mozzarella at home. Got this instead. Really thin, crispy flatbread with paper thin slices of tomatoes and basil. Mozzarella was kind of missing. XD maybe that was paper thin as well and melted away... Mildly plain tasting though the thin, crispy flatbread was yummy.   Potato Skins - Applewood bacon, Cheddar cheese sauce, green onion, lime crema   Surprisingly, i liked this one the most. Fingerling sized potatoes baked/fried/whatever'ed to point with some crisp edges, crispy bacon, and fresh green onions. Ask for a extra side of the sauce ! (this was the waiters suggestion) Though it tastes like sour cream, but makes sense if it was a lime cream. Lol   White Peach Sangria - Chardonnay, Peach Schnapps, strawberries, cherries, citrus fruits  Light tasting sangria. refreshing though on a hot day.   I had some pineapple drink with pineapple soaked vodka, and some other stuff which tasted like pineapple juice. That was pretty good too except i think they put too much ice, so mine disappeared pretty fast.   Overall, can't complain about the happy hour. Served it's purpose of giving alcohol and snacks for a cheap price ! Ha ! this was my super early dinner because i had to sleep early *snore*

Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruchetta
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio

99-1NzF8FmBvI4VbI1JBhg.text: Nobody up front, when you come...  Top water...  Restaurant where you have to wait for service and when someone show up... asking you for a minute.   Asking what's his favorite pasta... "not sure... but all of them good" ahahaha...  "Leone cafe" 50 feet away... much better... and cheaper

9fWHzWqbLQUWtcFbNWm_vw.text: Before you get to deep into this review, this is a happy hour review.  I didn't do the full dinner.  I finished my meetings for the day and am from out of town so I did a little "Yelp" research for a good happy hour place.  The reviews were pretty good so I trusted the reviews and went for it.  The hours of happy hour are 3:30-6:30pm M-F.  I had two good glasses of cabernet for $5 each and an amazing beef carpaccio plate for $5.  This was basically free in my book.  Anyhow, the wine was superb and the beef carpaccio was delicious.  Besides the price, the product was way better than what I expected.   As Arnold said, "I will be back"!  Give it a try.  Be sure to ask for Jen!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

em1WlmI69pIxClB68J03-A.text: Met some friends here for dinner and drinks and we were all very pleased! Quality of food was excellent, value was great and Biff, our waiter, was exceptional. He was helpful with the menu, attentive and pleasant throughout the meal. Two must have items: Carpaccio + wedge salad.

xWAqOTm93vuHMwlirckTGg.text: Used to be my favorite place for a happy hour. Unfortunately happy hour menu not as good as it used ti be. :(((( Too bad, we are not coming back.

2MDVrEEYn2ZTbk5p0TAYSQ.text: Brio in Summerlin is top notch. Love the atmosphere at Tivoli. It's a perfect spot. The salmon Fresca is to die for.  We are never disappointed. The staff is wonderful. Sitting out you feel like you're in Italy. They have one of the best peach bellinis ever. Be sure to try it!

Imls3AdzT1KbHg5mPoy-WA.text: This review is for their happy hour. Went with some girlfriends after looking at Brio's impressive happy hour menu online.   It didn't go right from the host stand. The guy there looked at us like we were an inconvenience, no smile, no greeting. We told him we were there for the happy hour. He told us to find a place at the bar, it was open seating.   We found a spot, really uncomfortable high tops. They have a few booths which were taken. My friend ordered their tropical Cosmo which tasted like syrup, had barely any alcohol. I ordered Pinot Grigio which was good. They have $5 wine specials on Thursday.  We tried the margarita dip, margarita flat bread and crispy shrimp brio. Our server messed up the order and got us potatoes instead of shrimp. I would give 5 star to the margarita dip, was probably the only thing I would remember from this visit that was good. Service was terrible, I would give zero, no one seemed to care about customers, our server was terrible, he never refilled any drinks or checked on us. We had to hunt him down for everything.   Definitely not worth coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 wine special
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

mlghLuP0_C0dIe_kEKbGQQ.text: Trying desperately to rate this restaurant 4 or 5 stars but every time it is service !  We were seated and it took 20-25 minutes before our waiter came to our table and another 10 minutes to get our beverage!  It was the busser that was AWESOME and brought us straws and lemons   !  Also, the food runner took back my angel hair pasta which was bland no EVEOO or FRESH PARM!  and 2nd time sous chef got it perfect!  At this point our waiter failed US.  We still tipped him & honestly we should have requested the tip go to the busser and food runner!  The Bisteca was PERFECT

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée Light, Silky , Sweet DELISH
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Shrimp Eggplant DELISH
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal Margarita, Creme Brûlée, Spicy shrimp eggplant appetizer all DELISH

ztsum9LyTDQQVTrdBzpjyg.text: this is for the Happy Hour only.  it is GREAT!!! all the HH food is only $2.95. we had both the flat breads,  slice steak bruschetta (my fav) shrimp & eggplant, ravioli caprese and pepper formaggio dip. i highly suggest all. the service was great. the waitress was really helpful, friendly and courteous to us tourists.  we were there on TUES nite around 4pm and is was already getting crowded. right across from the SUNCOAST CASINO. we had a great HH.

AaSnJtCcBi9X2gt-eBWW3g.text: What a fantastic Thursday happy hour this place has! Delicious $2.95 appetizers, $5.00 martinis and great atmosphere. Though happy hour is limited to the bar area and outdoor couches, Brian the manager was kind enough to let us enjoy happy hour at the tables on the patio since the place was so packed. I wish I could remember the name of our server because she was excellent! The bartenders, Alan and Ashley make excellent drinks and always have a smile on their faces. Living in Vegas I've gotten used to the ubiquitous bratty restaurant managers, servers and bartenders who act like you owe them something - they should take a lesson from the staff at Brio Tivoli Village - they are amazing and I can't wait to go back!

jKCyrQESYi8OVBcgsYYYUg.text: solid food, great salads, good service.  comfortable and pleasant setting.. good bang for the buck.  what else do you want?  hot sourdough bread?  they have that too..  super nom nom.     the summerlin location is def mellower than the Town Square location.

lW6sFTqcIPcWYFvqlC_gVQ.text: I like the vibes of Italy @Brio, the food is great especially the happy hour @the bar! Check it out!

qZ3hJpEbhLbfSLCATXRRCg.text: Love this place, something nice for summerlin.  This is a great  restaurant for birthdays, date nights, dinner with my friends etc.  Great service above average for price point in fact.  It is often crowded but always seem to get a seat with no wait unless I'm with a group. Love the mints when you leave.  I have been getting the Shrimp Verdutta which I can't eat all at once but always take home and eat the next day too.  SO good.  I easily would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice dinner not over priced.  Just took my parents here in fact.

W4l7VWAugo5iSP2ZGQvoDw.text: I normally go to the Brio in Town Square as it is closer to where I live; however, I was on this side of town and decided to come to this location with a friend. It was setup very nicely, although I prefer the look and setup in Town Square (Thats just personal preference). The food was delicious as always and the staff was there to service, very friendly!   The staff did seem a little "on edge" and checking everything, but that is okay by me! I also think they were like that because it opened very recently, so they are still getting into the routine. Regardless, simply wonderful! I am sure with time this location will be just as popular as the Town Square location.

ZI8YV2YPRrmuASSHlRML0A.text: My dinner here was quite a pleasant surprise. I was at Tivoli Park for an event and suggested Brio for dinner since we were there. I dined at a Brio at a different location, but it had been a few years. We had to wait for a few minutes, but that's expected on a Saturday night. Once we were seated, our server took our drink order and then our food order. The wait wasn't very long and the food was delicious. I had the Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. My partner had the lasagne. My meal was absolutely scrumptious. I was hesitant about ordering it, but my server guaranteed me that I would enjoy it. He was right. I tasted the lasagna and it was cheesy and tasty. There was nothing special about the service. It was average. The restaurant was a little louder than I. Ike, but once my meal arrived, I easily forgot about that. I'll definitely go back more often.

7QX2fwizXMk5LdrMkk5LMQ.text: Brio is a great place for happy hour. Tasting plates are $2.95. The carpaccio and shrimp tini are awesome. Thursday is Martini night. The bartenders and servers are very friendly and we always have a good time

yCuu8D0RY5cPkm8znaDFGw.text: We went for the amazing happy hour deals, but the bar was too full for us to find a table for our girls night out.  We sat on the patio instead and had the greatest server ever, Brandon.    The strawberry basil lemonade was incredible and the food was so tummy.  But the True highpoint of the night was Brandon.  He was kind, funny, knowledgeable and clever.    If you have Brandon as your server be kind, he deserves it.

gTj7qDJktrJkHr-d4U9IKw.text: Nice atmosphere. Reasonable service on a very busy night. The roasted veggies were good. The lemon chicken was hard and dry, not at all warm and they were stingy with the butter. We had to ask several times for more bread and butter. This was not my typical experience here, the lunch experience was much better.

-TbmPBvIBMxWKZhvCiQ-pQ.text: I like Brio. I have been there several times but the service in/at the bar is, simply put, TERRIBLE!! very disappointing !! bartenders are rude, clueless.

VbgeavMswduzMhNm7TYNRw.text: Brio is located in Tivoli village off of Rampart and Alta.  It is probably the longest standing restaurant in Tivola as many others have gone out of business or relocated since Tivoli opened (Petra, Radio City Pizza, etc).  The ambience inside is comfortable.  The service was attentive and helpful.  The food was okay, but could have wowed a bit more.  I had the lamb chops which were inconsistently cooked (some rare, some over), but the flavor was good.  My partner had the beef medallions with asparagus coating.  These were also pretty good, but nothing I would return for.  Overall, I think Brio was a good one time experience for me, but maybe I will try out their happy hour after reading some of the other reviews.

-zZFDgGGOIGOq9TdkPovHQ.text: My husband and I recently got married in Las Vegas.  We live in Orange County, CA.  I called several restaurants to host our dinner for 50 people.  The management at Brio was more than helpful and made me feel comfortable and at ease at hosting the dinner.  We had never eaten at a Brio restaurant. Picking a place to eat from out of town is a little scary.  We were more than pleased.   They did an amazing job at securing our group in the back with a semi private area yet still part of the restaurant.  50 people sat comfortable.  We had our own table for two in the middle of our  group.  The tables were beautiful.  Everyone raved about the food and choices offered on our preset menus.  We had our own 3 servers and they did a spectacular job.  Thank you for completing our wedding day.

HGECCOY6bZMT_zcbUBHpnw.text: Brio is amazing hands down but the service is what really puts any restaurant over the top. I've never received such amazing genuine service from everyone that works at a restaurant. I sat at the bar this time and Terri was the bartender. If you ever have the chance to interact with her consider yourself lucky. She is so full of energy, fun, and attentive. She became very busy the day I was there but she always checked on me to make sure I had everything I needed or wanted. She's funny and all around a good genuine person. Every server that passed by me always asked how I was doing and how my food was. Jessie one of the managers is the cherry on top of amazing service. He is always cool calm and collected and I see him running around with the servers helping them out. He's a genuine guy who cares about the way his restaurant is ran. If you're looking for good food and GREAT service this is the place to be!!!

CSKAJjcP-GnjAMjg-rJBLg.text: Delicious food, great portions and kid friendly. I always order the Mahi mahi or whatever seafood dish they are offering. Waitstaff are wonderful and attentive. 4 out of 5 stars for the hostesses. Ive gone in quite a few times and its always teenage girls standing there talking to each other, offer me no smile or greeting upon entering or leaving. Had a nice talk with the manager that was more than open to hearing me out and agreeing there is a problem. I will be back for the delish food for sure =)

h1oWstt0RIxO-1q8YyGl5w.text: We had a very nice dinner last Saturday night. The restaurant is a bit noisy but we were by the kitchen which is very open and visible. The service was very good and personable. The lobster bisk we had was ok, I didn't really taste any lobster. My wife's raspberry mojito was sweet but no punch. The dinner itself was very good, and they didn't overwhelm us with to much food. Then we busted the bar, and all the bar tenders were friendly. Over all this restaurant is worth the visit. Make reservations if your going on a Saturday.

Mm5Z_l3siR3ohNw9JBJPig.text: My daughter in law treated me to lunch at Brio. I was pleased with the Gluten Free Menu, and had the marinara pasta. It was good, and it was wonderful to not have to worry about being glutened. The waiter was attentive. I like the atmopshere, it was warm enough to be seated out doors.  The only downside is the car entrance to Tivoli being out front, although there was a minimum of distraction from the cars. I will go again.

EgXf83TGQ3WSBjKYlvVAmA.text: I have heard good things about Brio, and when my friend asked me to go with her, I was like "sure, why not? Maybe this will be my new place to go". but it's not...  When we walked in, I thought the decoration made the place feel so empty, maybe we went at a slow time? But I don't like the decoration at all. The waiter that served us, according to my friend, was a bit annoying. I thought he was okay, definitely not great though.  We had the spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer, I thought that one wasn't bad at all, I actually liked it. My friend and I shared a pasta (I don't remember the name), and I thought it was alright, it wasn't appealing. For dessert, we had creme brulee and tiramisu. The creme brulee was good, unlike most people, I like the filling more than the caramel part, and their creme brulee has more filling than other places, so I was very pleased. On the other hand, the tiramisu wasn't that great, there was a strong rum taste in it. Maybe it's just me, I don't like that having too much rum in the tiramisu, so it was bad to me.  Overall, this place is only a one time thing for me, I don't think I'll go back unless I want to give this place another try.

otz2njhLiiTjQV03VCdxQg.text: I have  been to Brio a few times and am always satisfied. My party and I are a,ways seated immediately other then one time when we had to wait maybe ten minutes. The staff is very prompt and friendly.  The food is delicious! My taste buds have never been let down! There are a few things I would change if I could,the volume of the place is always a little loud for my liking for a sit down restaurant,,it's so open and loud it's impossible to be an intimate dining experience.  But  other then that,it's a great place to get some amazing eats! The quatro bruschetta is devine!

mREKhu96Ex-g5hqBS8SmXQ.text: Our staple happy hour place for Italian!  The $2.95 appetizer menu is so great!  Try the Brio burger, the ravioli caprese, and the sausage and pepperoni flatbreads pizza!!  Great outdoor vibe to just chill when it's decent weather :)

d2aE0rB4HLjx7qFNaT25fA.text: Love Brio! We met a group of friends for Happy Hour last Thursday. Exceptional HH menu with a very nice selection of $3.95 small plates and several wines and mixed cocktails below $5.  We had several rounds of appetizers (definitely try the shrimp and eggplant dish, the flat bread was popular with the guys).  Everyone appeared very happy with their drink drink selection. Service was good and the bar was very busy. No wonder!  Good job Brio! When will you be in La Jolla, CA?

io4oan9tJu8QzZtEzbm6tg.text: Saturday, Brunch. Outside. Mojitos. Perfect. Service was great. Not too pushy to get us out of there. (they were busy) I hadn't tried this part of the the menu before and wasn't excited about it but the omlet was just fine. I usually eat the crab cakes at the location at Town Cener. But, the service there has gone downhill. It's like McDonalds Ronalds playland when you sit outside there. It sucks. You try and have a great meal and surrounding you is kids crying and running. Yes, I said running, around you. Nobody seems to notice ? I told the server I wouldn't be back since that was the 2nd dinner I had that experience. Apparently is not just a family restaurant,it's kiddie land....So, stick to the location on Rampart, so far, they haven't gone downhill...

jQC76pTM1ux8qGQFIU7pjg.text: My husband and I going out for Happy Hour every other Friday night.  We go to a different location every time as there are so many different places in Las Vegas.   Brio had advertised a $5.00 Martini. I selected one of the specially priced Martini's but when I received the bill, I had been charged $8.99 for it. I asked my server and she ignored me.   The $2.95 small plates were good but after being charged incorrectly and ignored, I'll never go back again.

yuQgxCiFobbYo4cuXw2OmA.text: This was a fun last-minute lunch place that I and a few friends visited this weekend. I had heard about the place but had never been there. WIth this being the first day to really feel like summer (well, summer in Ohio, where I'm from) I really enjoyed sitting outside and enjoying the sunshine, the breeze and the passers by (including Carrot Top, who said hi as he ambled by). The atmosphere was fun and casual- I really liked the view of the outdoor section where diners sit separated from the sidewalks of Tivoli Village by an attractively scalloped, metal "fence."  Aluminum-colored heating elements spaced throughout the outdoor area looked sculptural and artsy.  Large umbrellas protected patrons from the bright, hot sun.  Our waiter, Brian, had a great personality and made the experience even more enjoyable..  I had the risotto with chicken and the tossed salad for about $14.00. It was tasty, but I liked my friend's shrimp version better.  The crusty bread served before the meal was quite enjoyable.  A couple of us had the wedge salad, which was accompanied by a gorgonzola and garlic dressing that, in my opinion, was light and not overpowering. My friends loved that it had bacon.  I would definitely come here again and bring family or friends. Now I want to see what it looks like inside!

iocFicBhFUnMaN1M-MacKA.text: i went here will not go back. went with a party of 12. really lousy servixe i ordered veal parmesan it was greasy taisted bad was really a thin slice and the sause taisted canned. we also order seafood fettuccine and it taisted good but  uhhhh where was the seafood? also when i asked the waitress why she kept walking away and not take my order. she said because she didnt like me. Id like to add to this review i received a call from the manager it was sort of strange and hanging said he would call back but never did. I pray i never have to spend good money at this place again. Portions were just cheap.

MeMR_CfK424Pz1zHxpvU4A.text: The staff: Somebody's always smiling, so that's a good sign.  They're cordial and they know their menu.  Most of the servers I've had there have been very friendly, got the time to know us and chat it up a bit.  Sometimes we come when it's busy and we don't see our server much; which is fine, I don't like when people hover anyway, but it would help if we didn't have to wait for them to walk by so we could ask for something.  The goods: Incredible happy hour.  The Brio Burger is probably my favorite thing to get but I've tried just about everything on the HH menu and I can't remember disliking anything.  The basic menu can get a little pricy.  I ordered a salmon salad something or other once, $14.95.  I won't say it wasn't worth the money because, oh my God it WAS.  But, I'm just saying, pricy (at least for me).  I love their dessert display.  We do something similar at the fine dining restaurant I used to work at.  They bring the plate over so you can look at your desserts.  Very good eye-catcher.  I always order the chocolate cake thingy (I should really learn the names...but whenever I order I sort of just point and say, "I want THAT.  Please and thank you.")  Their raspberry mascarpone cheesecake is heaven.  It melts in your mouth and the crust is the only thing left to chew.  The atmosphere: I think in all the times I've come here I've only sat inside once.  I love sitting outside watching the shoppers of Tivoli Village.  It always kind of freaks me out though when one of the valet boys starts running for a car.  I have to turn around and see the red uniform before I realize it's not some guy stealing a lady's purse.  Other than that, everything else is great.  The lighting adds a lot to the ambiance, from the restaurant, and other shops alike.  And my friends and I are always listening intently to the music, trying to guess the language and what they're saying.  I think coming to Brio is going to end up being a weekly thing for us.  We're all kind of night owls these days and we've got to start somewhere, best to do it where we can fill our stomachs and prep for the night ahead.

_x3pm1Dg4KyxseYJjG3JHg.text: Over priced food and not that great. Have been here several times and each time I get even more disappointed as the portion of the food reduces and the prices increases.

HIX7EgUe59wzlFFfRyBsgg.text: Service was great from the moment we walked in until the moment we left!   We were seated outside, our drink orders were taken promptly and the bread basket was brought to our table soon after. We started off with Caesar salads, then I ordered grilled lamb chops with mashed potatoes and my gf ordered angel hair pasta with grilled salmon..... everything taste great!! Cooked to perfection. Our drinks kept on getting refilled, they were never empty and dish pick up was quick.... they were "on it". For dessert they brought out a variety of dessert samples to our table for us to decide on . We ordered tiramisu and berry cheesecake... they were very good.

X961FRMALTRMJacd5JJn0A.text: I have been dining here for about 2 years. The carpaccio, steak salad, & tomato soup are delicious. Happy Hour is wonderful for a meeting with friends. My family & I  return for the superb service.  We always request JOHN every time, he is a huge part of the reason we return quite often (so ask for John).

3GrpIxm9dN5-2EVXBn-E0A.text: After a terrible dinning experience somewhere else last night Mandi at the bar cheered us all up. We walked into reverse happy hour and a bright and helpful smile from Mandi. Thank you for turning our frowns upside down. A consistently great place to eat as well.

VgXXrCA5QhyeC-DOKUN8rg.text: Very nice place. Great food. I tried the mixed grille. I love the spicy aftertaste. The lobster soup was very good.

STq6YOYMimEJaOJb4iMm5g.text: My husband and I were in the bar last night 4-22-16 at a table . It was not real busy but our waitress made this one of the worst experience s ever at Brio and we love Brio.  Her name was Megan , she didn't seem to have her head in the game ,but could find plenty of time to talk to coworkers at the bar.  It won't affect our dining at Brio in the future.  But we'll make sure Megan doesn't wait on us.

RoRgJVQIrdMWRjd0bQbxKg.text: I'm glad there are so many great reviews here.  Too bad mine won't be one of them.  Went there for brunch and I ordered the Ham & Biscuit Benedict.  The only thing warm on the plate was the hollandaise sauce and even then it was barely warm.  I would have liked to have told the server that everything was cold but, sadly, she didn't bother to check back to see how everything was.  I don't know when the potatoes or asparagus were prepared but I'm not even certain that they were made the same day.  Tasted like leftovers that I could pull out of my own refrigerator.  Maybe it's that particular dish that they don't prepare very well but I did not enjoy my meal or the service.  Atmosphere is nice though.

-3jqa0y3VAd447_n-krMZg.text: Sat at the bar last night and had an exceptional experience. The food was outstanding and the service even better. The little blonde bartender customized martinis for both my husband and I and they were amazing. We had the Shrimp and Eggplant appetizer since the bartender suggested it so highly and it was the best item i have ever tried at Brio. Finally a place in Summerlin with great service, food and drink. Truly the total package. 5 stars to Brio in Tivoli Village!

QTI3Eyym7F6_tX8nXZhGLQ.text: My first visit here involved waiting an hour and fifteen minutes to be seated and a waiter spilling red wine on me. But you know what? I had such a great time; none of it even mattered!   It was girls' night out with my pregnant best friend from high school. We had some catching up to do. Our waitress, Amanda, was so much fun!  She kept us laughing and entertained. She mentioned that she was not on the floor that often but that she really enjoyed it. I'll give her credit; she is the best waitress I've ever had anywhere, hands down. She is fabulous.  I really wish I could remember the names of the plates we tried. We had a spicy pasta, pizza, and spinich artichoke dip. The food was fantastic!   The manager came over and apologized profusely for the mishap with the wine. She gave me her card and told me to bring in my dry cleaning receipt and the restaurant would reimburse me. Eh, clothes can easily be replaced. I was not going to let spilled wine ruin my night.  I really appreciate her offer, though, I won't be dry cleaning my jeans. They ended up comping our entire meal!  It was appreciated but definitely not necessary as I wasn't upset at all. We were so incredibly grateful.  Overall, great experience. I would definitely return.

WSFLKZj54apOQ-ioTtzLFQ.text: Loved it Great Italian food great service my new favorite pasta place. Can't wait to try more

Si3ucK2a4mcmYeymNUH0mQ.text: This is my favorite happy hour in all of Vegas! $5 drink specials and several food items for $2.95!! And it tastes good! I've been here more times than I can count and keep coming back. The outdoor seating area is limited so you may have to wait for a seat.. the seating is better at the location in town square.

w9p0WdLrVeJP_UfzEkUyaA.text: I've had lunch here a couple of times and dinner once.  I love the patio seating and people watching.  The food is good, and the service is better than you would expect from a chain.  I love the different items on the lighter side menu.  Great place do dine with friends.

OZ9e_0N2MeVMGd1zSFRXSQ.text: Although the food was decent, the service here was horrific. My husband is allergic to onions and asked about a particular entre. He was assured that there were no onions in this meal. When the food finally arrived (after nearly and hour) it was full of onion. When we said something to the waiter, he proceeded to argue with us then laugh at my husband. Another waiter noticed the incident and promptly stepped in to try and make it right. We ended up paying for a meal that wasn't even touched and not once did my husband receive any sort of apology.

ykyY5BAc9-tsC3qgQmh0EQ.text: Good food in a nice and relaxing setting.  I come primarily for the Beef Carpacio - a huge platter of very thinly sliced raw beef, drizzled with a delicious aioli, a healthy sized salad in the middle, and big Parmesan crisps.  It's delicious!!!  We've had the pastas, lamb chops, steaks, and other entrees here.  Generally speaking we find them to be a bit salty for our taste, but the portions are healthy and the quality of ingredients is very good.    Overall a pretty consistent restaurant in a nice setting.  We've been to both the Town Square and Tivoli Village location and have enjoyed them equally.

u7bkapzFrL6xJU6hVjKDhw.text: You cant go wrong with Brio, I have been to both locations Rampart and Town Sq and they have a good happy hr menu along with a lunch/dinner menu.. if you are looking to eat dinner at one of these locations, I recommend making reservations. Service is always on point and there is always something for everyone with in your party..

5Y-gGgqD0rZGN7RsojjMuA.text: I take clients here because it's a place I can always rely on. The food is consistently fresh and expertly-prepared, with a professional and gracious staff, and an outstanding interior and atmosphere.

6kuMFz-1hyz6KpdmM8WgBA.text: Great service and food. Highly recommended and perfect casual lunch and dinner place for everyone.

6HXlNo0Zk9574MAa8PLrgQ.text: I love this place! Eveytime I come to Las Vegas I stop here!

FukSWcAq128bRqdW1QaFCA.text: Amazing Happy Hour!  They have really good food during their happy hour. (aka: Tuscan Taster Bar Menu)..and the portions are enough to fill you up.  It gets a little busy on Thursday with their Martini special, but is always a fun time.  Happy hour is only available in the bar area, so get there early to claim your seat!  I highly recommend the cheeseburger and fries (and it's only $2.95!).

DgxJClvhElxuJoqzD4MoEQ.text: Beautiful location!  We have eaten once outside, and twice inside.  The service has been very nice each time.  I've had the Mezza Chicken, Eggplant Pomodoro and the grilled Salmon.  I would order each of them again, very delicious.  The calamari on the other hand was too salty for me, but others in my party enjoyed it.  The Quatro Bruschetta was disappointment.  I did have a bruschetta on the specialty menu with proscuitto and asparagus that was very tasty and I would have again.  I don't recall the names of all the drinks that I have tried; one was a martini with Absolute Raspberry, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice (missing some ingredients).  It was incredible!  The only problem was that it didn't come in a bigger glass, (careful, this one goes down quick).  The other was a strawberry lemonade with fresh strawberries, fresh basil and prosecco.  I know, fresh basil seems strange, but I'm going to try and make this one at home, I loved it so much!

NauyMUzGdRL5KBRk_bK6iA.text: I went for my birthday lunch today. They were pretty busy for lunch. We got seated within 10 minutes, by the friendly hostess, at a lovely corner table near the kitchen. Our server, Tom, was on his A game. He greeted us and immediately got the drink order. What I appreciate is communication, and he let us know that he'd be right back. While taking our order, I let him know that I had a birthday voucher for Shrimp Scampi and beef medallions and my friend got the Chipotle Chicken & Bacon Panini with to Ceasar salads, in addition. The best was when Tom asked me how I wanted the medallions cooked. I asked Tom what the meat was and he said 'cow'. AWSOME! I laughed. The salads came right away and were delicious. Plenty of dressing and parm (the way I like it), with sweet Romain lettuce. Shortly after, came the fresh flat bread and bread basket with butter that tasted like it was homemade. This Brio seems more open and brighter than it's big sister. The food came the second my salad dish was removed and it looked beautiful. It tasted even better. It was an amazing birthday lunch and I am happy with our service from Tom. Thank you, Brio Tivoli!

8KY9h28AUFdufl1TvM6fgA.text: My family and I were celebrating my mother in laws birthday, when a pigeon that had gotten into the restaurant pooped on my sister in law!  It did it twice; the first time we thought someone had flipped sauce on her, and three of us helped her get it out of her hair.  The second time, we looked around and noticed the bird above her head.  The staff was disgustingly unprofessional, insulted us with a 20 dollar gift card after we spent 500 dollars on food (that's not even enough to go back and have the meal paid for!!), the waiters and waitresses laughed, told other guests, swore, and mocked our family.  Your staff implying that a filthy disease ridden animal defecating on guests near the kitchen of your restaurant is out of the company's policy to make things right makes me shudder to think what else you would not help on.  I've had better customer service in every single other restaurant I've ever attended.  To make matters worse, when posting complaints on your Facebook wall, after talking to my sister in law who ever manages that account LIED and said she was fine with how things were handled!  Your customer service is disgusting and as we now see on more than just your one restaurants standard.  We are a family of 20 adults with in laws, 30 grandchildren and have been established in Las Vegas.  Your lack of class and neglegance has lost all of our business and all of extended family and friends business.

SGJ0zPyXEqsrZOVPKtCIvw.text: I love me some Brio! Yeah I am sure this will be a real balanced review...  At any rate I really enjoy the Brio at the Town Square location and thought I would give this new spot in Summerlin a try for a casual business dinner. I will save you sometime and just let you know it was a real solid choice. The food came out very quickly and the happy hour specials were priced rather inexpensively. Mid way through our meal the executive chef made his rounds and made sure to say hello to every table and introduce himself.  I have to say thats a rarity and the touch was well received.  I honestly have no problems recommending this place to anyone as the bruschetta choices are all amazing, the Veal Milanese was great, the ravioli were cooked to perfection, and the wine list had some great choices for excellent prices.

ag1TALf2VMM-zpy77-Evbg.text: burnt dry chicken, way over cooked prime ribs. Very unacceptable. Price was higher than it was worth. There was no effort put into this food. It was rushed, fast food style. burnt.

GaAL6ZxXHwU9LSHjbf8kzw.text: Food was fabulous! Came here for a late mothers' day dinner, best service I think I have ever received at a restaurant. Great job guys !

LiCwPuPb12S0YM_wVQnKvQ.text: We were so excited to have Brio come to Summerlin.  We decided to give it a shot and thought we would have to wait for seating.  We were very pleased we did not have to wait long at all.  We were impressed with the menu selection and had heard many great things.  This set our expectation high.  The food was good we ordered steak and pasta.  The service however was lacking.  Our water glasses were not checked and we were seated right next to the kitchen.  The manager was on her cell phone in the open kitchen having an emotional conversation and the staff did not appear to help each other out.  One of the waitresses was crying and two appeared to be angry at each other.  We highly value service and on our visit it was lacking.  By the end of the meal we were discussing that we would have enjoyed a meal at Carrabbas more.  It may have just been the evening we decided to go and we have discussed giving Brio another try, it wasn't bad but it was only OK and we were hoping for WOW!

Ua8TRoENhAIviN-mFtLqhg.text: The service is terrible. The girl who sat us was rude. It took over seven minutes for anyone to even acknowledge we were there.  After we finally got drinks and a menu, we were hurried to order our food. When our meal arrived, it was cold and the flatbread was soggy.There's too many good restaurants in this town to deal with bad service and mediocre food.

ZX8eEljzuurd11qQCsdB4A.text: Just had the Sunday brunch at Brio.  The crab and shrimp cakes were delicious.  Service was awesome today!  Location is beautiful.  I have eaten at the Brio at both town square and Tivoli and been very happy with both locations in as Vegas.

wpPcjSPmbhzNCoYAWXDMpA.text: This is our first time trying this restaurant. The location of this place in Tivoli is beautiful. As well the interior of the restaurant. The server we got was nice and helpful. Stars for the looks but the food was even worse than Olive Garden which I'm giving 0 star. My husband and I have traveled across U.S. and even out of the country and that's how we learned how to love food. And we love love love fried calamari. The calamari we got was too much breading, tasteless and hard. The worst calamari we ever had that we could not even finish it (and I hate wasting food). And the lasagna and pasta we got were OK(i would say applebee's quality)

nJWZR8kvap4_u5zQyKmCYg.text: really hard to go wrong with Brio. great food, the staff is always very pleasant to deal with even when they are super busy and you know they must be stressed

Lldit8JYxVyK71AlIynQ6Q.text: location is good, Service was great but my food I have to admit was ok ordered the seared shrimp risotto was salty and oily, unexpected?? But i was hungry and ate it,as I came with a big party and did not want to complain,, but it seems the chicken and sweet potato risotto,looked more like risotto, mine look like a red mess,, maybe I will go back and try  their martini thursday, happy hour...

oQCJWGmnUhl45wNE7Q8tYw.text: What to say...  The appetizer we had at lunch is the only reason they are getting two stars instead of one.  The artichoke dip was pretty good, nothing super, but pretty good.  Had the shrimp and crab crepes for brunch.  Scrambled eggs, shrimp, crab, and asparagus rolled up in crepe served with fresh fruit and fried red potatoes.  Sounds awesome.  It was far from it,  To start off the smell of the over ripe melon in the fresh fruit overwhelmed my plate with a horrible smell.  Strike one.  Next I moved to the potatoes, over cooked to the point that  they were black and burnt to a crisp.  Strike two.  Next the crepes, the eggs were over cooked and dry, there was not crab or shrimp in them, the asparagus was flavorless and overcooked, and the hollandaise sauce taste like something out of a box or package.  Strike three.  Sadly they had a fourth strike as well.  Everything on my plate was the same temperature, the crepes and the potatoes were cold, and the fruit was warm.  I try to give everyplace a second chance, but I am not sure this place is worthy of that.

sDKfUmX5GckH6h3AiKZWjw.text: Based on reviews and the location I wanted to check this place out. Ambiance is nice...Happy hour might be great, as the bar area was packed...But the food?  Horrible!  Let's just put it this way. I felt like like I swallowed the ocean after eating here. Everything was waaaaaaay over salted. Over seasoned as well. Even the greens salad. We ordered the sampler bruschetta, stuffed peppers as an appetizer and split the risotto with roasted chicken for our entree. The bottom-line is the flavors were just not there. I noticed they have a pizza oven, so maybe their bar food is good. But, I would highly NOT recommend this place for dinner.

5cm75oDL3Aegh-fTffzipw.text: Had lunch with some friends that live in Summerlin area.  They said Brio is a mixed  bag, sometimes good, sometimes average...Service was good, food better than Olive Garden.  probably would not go back.....

-s4zFIiaDctvANzeGkWUfg.text: I love this place. Perfect every time. They hit the mark on food, atmosphere, price and service.  The complimentary bread basket is fresh and served with real butter. Most recently I had the fettucini rustica (ordered it with rigatoni instead).  Lots of chicken and sundried tomatos, but not oily and heavy like the penne rustica at Olive Garden. Very attentive servers. The only criticism would be the noise level.  This was a business lunch and at times it was a bit difficult to hear one another.  Must have been all the enthusiastic "yums".

6PLlbmBfoKDcKYZp8x57cA.text: pretty good restaurant . service average . had the chicken lemon which was very tasty. price seemed reasonable .

g4zGuxZA9ZwKKNBNyZuO2Q.text: Good food that's consistent at a descent price. Would go to again, try the pasta Brio with extra chicken

jJEfcsuHjleKy_SbEqFz-Q.text: Great service and great food. Our server is MichaelS and he did really great, friendly and professional! Burger was ridiculously awesome!

MxSaOVct_0P8GwqFY3a2Mw.text: The food and service was amazing.  We celebrated my grandmothers 85th  birthday here and it was amazing.  We had a party of 15 and the servers were really on top of it.  Really love this place.

9Jw2g4vXTTgA7yIsmHrjjg.text: Five minutes after submitting the below review, I received a call from Jesse the General Manager.  He was very apologetic for our experience, and promised the service would improve.  So, I will be coming back with a follow up review after we visit gain, but I do have to give cud-dos to Jesse for the quick response to my email.  Never again will I visit this location on a busy night with or with out a reservation.  I am so frustrated with the service we received at the Tivoli Village location.  First of all, we had a reservation for 7pm last night which I had made on Open Table.  We arrived at 6:50pm and were told it would just be a few minutes.  We told the hostess we would wait in the bar and we ordered a bottle of wine with the intention of having a glass and taking it to our table.    By 7:30 pm, we went back to the hostess and told her we were still waiting.  She told us that were a couple of people ahead of us still, so we returned back to our seats at the bar.  At 7:40pm, our bartender Jose notified Jennifer (I believe, tall brunette lady working the bar) that we were still waiting.  She immediately contacted a manager (didn't talk to us, did this on her own initiative) who told her (and then she told us) that we would be next.  Finally, a bottle of wine down, we were seated at 7:55pm for our 7pm reservation.    I finally asked for a manager and was greeted by a manger (he didn't introduce his name) and voiced my frustration about the delay.  He told me that "we are busy today" and offered an appetizer which neither my date or I were interested in.  Instead, we told him we were ready to order and would like to order a bottle of wine (I made it clear we didn't want a free bottle)  but again had to wait nearly fifteen minutes for a bottle.    Anyhow, the risotto I had tasted hot but tasted as if it had been cooked early in the day and had been reheated several times.  Honestly, the whole experience was rushed and non romantic.  I was treated as number, and not as a customer.  Horrible experience, and the lack of remorse from the management really made this a bad experience that we will not repeat.

-Mp30XQgAxgt8-PMGGZl5g.text: My friend and I were driving looking for a bite to eat and went in last min tonight for Pasta, Happy Hour Food and Drinks.  We sat in bar area..Megan was our server and a guy named Dillion (her busses) and  another guy who was the food runner who's name I can't remember (although I wish I could) but my service was amazing.   My friend and I BOTH work in the industry and were so blown away at the TEAM work!  We ordered two orders of beef carpaccio, spinach dip and a pasta vodka dish along with several drinks....one drink I even asked Megan our sever to surprise us and it was a delicious concoction I would have never thought to create.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6XIIps7euKeEnJmBNKZ17w.text: This place is amazing. My husband and I came here after our wedding ceremony with our group of 29 people. There were a couple more people than we had anticipated. I felt awful because we had to ask for more table space for an already large party. But the staff was on it. They were so understanding, and when we apologized, told us not to because it was our special day and we shouldn't be sorry for anything. They were so accommodating and gracious. And the food was amazing. The lobster bisque was phenomenal. My best friends husband hates seafood, and even he loved it. I also have a friend who's vegan; they  crafted a dish just for her. My sister-in-law has a shellfish allergy, and they accommodated that without hesitation as well. By far some of the best service I've ever had at a restaurant, and the food was beyond worth every penny. So delicious!

d4C36fH8ec9qNkbWnUm1UA.text: Loved loved loved it. Great treatment, great food and atmosphere! A top favorite of ours to visit and order delivery from with #doordash.

oiqxQa50W9GkrLWxOVGBMA.text: Jenny went above and beyond to take excellent care of us.  We'll be back.  Thank you for really taking all of our needs into consideration.  I am so glad we didn't go to Echo & Rig!

cPrYBaofp6_5ryFg92pvAg.text: Good happy hour. Our server was friendly and very good. One of the other servers that helped bring out our order gave us a little attitude (brunette) when we asked for another setting. Bartender seemed a little slow....took a long time to get our drinks. But even with that, we'll be back.

TKS0oTVULKJLw55V2NjLmw.text: Wow, 5 stars food and service!! I am here from out of town I sat at the busy bar for food and drinks - both bartenders so attentive and made the best drinks.  The food was delicious and came out in a timely manner!

qPUy9P6ipyDO8t2UBeMjsw.text: Brio was wonderful, great food at wonderful prices, the selection was great, everything tasted good, we ordered beef tartar that was humongous and tasty, and they white egg veggie omelet. The bread was hottttt and fresh and the butter was tasty the combo was dangerous lol  Go there and check it out

Nno1cJwICDmStoyc11ZsNw.text: We had the calamari, salmon salad, and the warm chocolate cake. Everything was barely adequate. The cake was actually warm fudge, the salmon was over cooked, and the calamari was a cheap tasteless imitation of what used to be a really good dish. Extremely disappointing! Maybe the one on the boulevard is better. I'll give that one a try before giving up on them completely,

FfICXegVSrdDbMVWb6WFSg.text: We went here the other night with friends and were extremely impressed with not just the food but the service as well. Our server Frank went above and beyond to make this a special night for all. He was so on top of everything that the "spell" of enjoying our meal and company was never broken. Thank you so much for a wonderful time! We will definitely be back!

kYBgmzR3ukRZlJ_hnllOag.text: Came here for HH a few hours ago. Food is always great here. Bartenders made great drinks and were very accommodating. My favorite HH items are the spicy shrimp and eggplant dish and the flatbread.  The cheese dip was good as well.  This is definitely a great happy hour place. Will be back this week for sure. Amazing how they have all night happy hour that started at 3:00pm.

Qbzi0FVGj8-FrR0IDtYbKA.text: First time dinner experience last night at Tivoli Village with family made my day.  Serving staff were wonderfully helpful and with 8 of us and a vegetarian nearly everyone chose different items from the menu. Not a complaint anywhere. The service, Food, Wine and Tiramisu for dessert. Everything was exceptional and the portion sizes were very generous in every dish.  Will be back very soon. Thanks for creating a beautiful family evening memory.

q6jT-mpjieTp7X9crFY2OQ.text: My wife and I came here for our 29th year anniversary on 10/2/18 for dinner. The host was nice, and he seated us in a nice booth. Unfortunately, the waiter assigned to us must be in a bad mood or in a rush. He did not introduce himself, I asked about their "craft beer", he said all they have is in the menu. So we ordered a beer and margherita drink. For dinner we ordered Campanelle Carbonara ,Grilled Chicken Marsala "Under the Brick, and Caramel Cheesecake for dessert. The food was good not great, but I'm satisfied. The waiter never once checked on us if we needed anything which I was hoping for a glass of water. I wish that they would train all their waiters to be more polite and friendly.

bY9Jln5WFm_uNd2-p-lxRQ.text: This is another one of those places I've visited a dozen times or more in a variety of locations, but seem to fail to check in most of the time.  The accumulated experiences mandate that it's time for a review.  For a chain, I think it's one of the better ones.  Brio's food is consistently good and most of the time, above average for a chain restaurant.  We find ourselves going there with some frequency lately since this location is just a few miles from the house, in the nearby and still growing Tivoli Village.  Easy to get to, great underground parking (a huge plus in the summertime!), and a nice place to stroll after overeating.  (Yep, it's gonna happen.)  The food:  Two visits ago I had the Pasta Fra Diavalo.  Not my first pasta dish here because they do a great job with not overcooking the pasta.  The flavors were wonderful as alway and the dish was served at just the right temperature.  I don't know if they heat their dishes, but I noticed that the bowl didn't cause the pasta to cool rapidly--something that happens too often at many restaurants.  During my most recent visit I was able to sample a number of new tasty menu items:  a fresh Caprese Salad.  It was especially specially fresh and had just the right amount of dressing to allow the mild tomatoes and mozzarella to shine through.  Next the group of us shared a Sausage and Pepperoni Flatbread, cooked well so that the flatbread was at just the right place between soft and too crisp.  Next, Black Pepper Shrimp featuring middle-sized, peeled shrimp served on slices of eggplant and drizzled in a fantastic sauce.  Brio found a great way to combine shrimp and eggplant into what became an instant favorite.  I'll definitely order it again.  I sampled Brio's take on bread pudding for dessert and was pleasantly surprised.  I wouldn't normally order bread pudding, but I'm glad I had the chance to try this.  The portion was just right to follow a full meal and the pudding and sauce were delicious.  I'd definitely get it again.  The beverages:  If you're in the mood for a little wine with your dinner, I recommend the White Peach Sangria.  I'm not a fan of sweet wines or drinks, but this was nice and refreshing, and not too sweet to keep me from enjoying it.  The service:  Top notch for this kind of restaurant.  The staff is always there taking care of you, but they're not in the way or hovering.  I also love that they'll always tell you the specials, then make recommendations if you prefer.  I almost always ask and when recommendations come, they seem genuine rather than what might otherwise feel like they were told to push a particular dish that day.  Overall, well done Brio!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A calamari special, with two different sauces.  Delicious!  Cooked just right and not too much breading.
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special:  Fruiti di Mare over angel hair pasta. Very tasty!

wKSf7NqQ0VVthykpXnkZcQ.text: Been for happy hour only I love love that salt and pepper shrimp so good and the moscal mule. Bree was the bartender super nice helpful and made great drinks we will be back !

q3ZJmRYCqjLK8s2MiqHmSA.text: Although I must have been sat in the worst seat in the house, the atmosphere in this Brio was still excellent. My guest and I were seated right after a supremely difficult woman, the type that just makes a fuss about everything. This made for some interesting dinner conversation, to say the least, and the staff seemed to handle her well. Certainly better than I could have! I came to the conclusion throughout dinner that our waiter was not supposed to be taking care of our section but was just picking up the slack for another waiter or trying to get some extra tables. Even despite this, I am certain I will be back.  First off, the bread is sourdough! Any restaurant that has a default option of sourdough bread, sign me up. I had the lobster and shrimp fettucini and a chopped salad. Other Yelpers don't lie when they praise the chopped salad here! The shrimp and lobster pasta was as good as any I have ever head but still when I come back I think I will order a chopped salad. On the menu it is $5 and comes as a side, so maybe order two and ask them to combine it into a bowl. I am honestly surprised there is no entree option for this salad but I guess most people don't come to an Italian restaurant to have their cheapest salad option. It is that good though, so do yourself a favor and order it!

P-JROjez5_zx96rdwxQDHA.text: Who can eat with a fork this size?  No salad fork, and a serving fork (only the have we asked) for eating one's meal.  Tonsil operation with each bite.  Management vacant as hell.  For $130 before tip (for 2) one would think it would be better.  24 minutes for our meal with wine (rush rush rush) and 14 minutes and check still not picked up.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iyqXIX7TLOrYhc7TnkthNg.text: For a chain restaurant Brio is always on point. The food is excellent quality and well prepared. The service and experience is consistently good. Service was most excellent at this location. We enjoyed the appetizer flat breads and my salad was excellent. We were in a business meeting so the waiter was great about keeping water and soda glasses filled without interrupting us. Great experience.

E9izdfZFqpfl4Bw7oJA8Bg.text: Came here for the first time Monday night for a birthday dinner of a friend. The service was fantastic don't remember his name but looked like a young Charlie Sheen.  Answered all questions on our meals and they were delicious.  Compliments to the chef and his team. Will tell people to come to your great restaurant.

ws3kSZENaiYu0NOHLeb1HA.text: Love coming here!  Jeffrey, Mandy and Wendy are awesome bartenders! Always service with a smile! Wish I could come by more often! One of my favorite dishes is the black pepper shrimp with eggplant!

Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome martinis

k2Pm7Od0RU-mydLsjKBbaw.text: Arctic salmon  That's all I gotta say! The food there is great! Nice a fresh and always plated looking good. Unfortunately the service I had at the bar was straight up crap. He got our order after a little bit than didn't even make our cocktail until 25 mins after and poured two waters 15 mins after ordering. The food took a listle while to come out as well. He didn't ask or check up on us really at all until the very end of the meal whitch when i had the plates stacked in front of me. We would definitely come back and give it another shot maybe this time at a dining table.

_mAdwZSAmHdag4X6rvlfjg.text: I love this place. I've tried both locations on town now (Town Square & Tivoli) and I've had 2 great dining experiences.  Very cheap happy hour at the bar from 3:30pm-6:30pm and reverse happy hour from 9pm-close where all the food on the happy hour menu is only $2.95! The only drink specials I saw were $5 martinis on Thursday's.  Service was friendly and very welcoming and the food at is amazing. I recommend the Pasta Brio, which is rigatoni with a seared mushroom and peppers sauce, the Pasta alla Vodka, homemade pasta filled with ricotta, and the seared shrimp risotto is also delicious. Portions are good for the price and the menu has a lot of choices.  This is my favorite Italian restaurant in town. Everything is a hit in this place and if you haven't tried it yet you should get in your car and drive down there right now.

RU-k_j0nH27w5nhVTMg-mA.text: Good food, great prices of Happy hours as usual but again disappointed by the service. No smiles, no sincere services by hosts and server. What's wrong with this place?? It was much better before. It's getting worse and worse every time I go there.

dHiIe2HLfP9a_BDKQGjMqg.text: First time in this new location.  Meh.  Looks like they've fizzled out. Noting special. Nothing really good.

xhADo6es08aZwkfBoO9Vng.text: I left 4 star reviews previously, decided to come back to this place. Being at the restaurant for the third time, I am convinced that Brio became one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

xfaQt9Pk7PS86-pu9_ZJZg.text: Came here on a Friday night, we waited over 10 minutes to be greeted by our server. I know they were busy but everyone was just constantly running. I feel like they were under staff. Our server never offered more bread, only came by once to see if everything was okay and even forgot to split our order. It took him a while to come back to drop the check at the end. Overall very frustrating experience even though the food was good.

nuL8kpAqov83GmSzRxp7wQ.text: 1 star for the server in the bar and the manager. Went in early during happy hour. Was seated immediately, greeted by male server and drink order taken. Server said he'd bring a happy hour menu. Another food runner/server brought the cocktail to me and I waited 15 minutes...for a menu.   5 stars for the hostess (all of them, actually--every time). I asked to be reseated and the hostess was extremely apologetic and quickly took care of the issue. She had the manager take me to a new table. When I explained what happened to him, he said nothing, but "Would you like to order off the bar's happy hour menu in the main restaurant?" While I appreciated that offer, an apology would have been the appropriate action, talking to the offended server would also have been an appropriate action (I doubt this happened). I've eaten there dozens of times and this manager is severely lacking in customer service skills.   5 stars for Jennifer the new server. She was friendly, knowledgeable and turned my dining experience around. Thank you Jennifer and the hostesses. Brio almost lost a neighborhood customer.

ugPnWC8IUxXYdbkJ10WW_g.text: Normally i don't bother with town squaresince it's not my scene   but friend wanted to come for happy hour.  Service was great,  our waitress was friendly and attentive. The happy hour food and drinks were good,  the artichoke dip was delicious. The pineapple drink had a good balance of flavor and alcohol, forgot its offical name.  It was a nice atmosphere even when it got crowded.

VRsW7-qGmQku1UxUIHoFew.text: Customer service is horrible here. The server had an attitude like they didn't want to be there. The food was bland, the soup was warm. Bad experience. I read the reviews I guess I probably came at a bad night.

_WqIdJPH3Y0w3yVUSWSl2Q.text: Food & service was okay.  Maybe it was the time of day, but I counted 15+ employees just standing around by the kitchen area. No kidding! Probably wont't eat there again.

cYCSra_BB1TyqUHDY2Qx1Q.text: I love Brio!  This is a favorite place to gather with girlfriends.  The food is always great tasting and the service is quick and polite.  Their lobster bisque is delicious!  I love getting their lunch lasagna and salad...perfectly satisfying.  My friend had her baby shower here - we were able to order a bunch of small plates and everything was perfect.

Zwrq0X1m_XYaY_0Z7T8hJw.text: A great place for Happy Hour, sit around a high top, and chat and mingle.  My Red Sangria and Burger were okay, maybe I should have ordered less standard fare.  Next time!

Mp-G4zAGpcVtOfATviMFCQ.text: I have been to Brio multiple times and we always leave satisfied. They have cheap lunch specials which are always tasty. Last time I ordered a chop salad and a flatbread for like $7 and I had left-overs!  For dinner they have great pastas and meat dishes. I also love their panini's and salad combo. They also have weekday specials with $5 martini's on wednesdays!

yADj-yTg3I2znkM8Vs3kHg.text: We've had many meals at Brio and usually enjoy the food.  The ambiance is pleasant and you can't beat the outside patio on a nice day.  We went several weeks ago after the lunch rush to sit outside and enjoy the sun.  Service was fine, but we were disappointed the the pasta dishes we ordered.  My husbands pasta was lukewarm as was mine.  Mine came with grilled chicken and vegetables - those were hot, but not enough to compensate for the barely warm pasta.  And as for the grilled chicken on my pasta, it had the flavor and consistency of something that came from Sysco or US Foodways.  I'm not saying it was, but it definitely didn't taste like it was freshly cooked in house.  The bread and the butter was delicious.  The wine was excellent.  We'll go again as it's part of our neighborhood restaurant rotation, but I'm not sure I'd order the pasta again unless we were assured it would be hot.

qcbKiMlmtZZXM9QzCfY0-A.text: Came here for dinner with the family the day after Thanksgiving.  It's located in  Tivoli Sqare,  The food was above average, restaurant is very nicely decorated, and the service was ok.  The price, $$$ not worth that.  I'd come back if there is no other place to go.

ICbAmqEt3BoAWgSCizW7nA.text: i was really disappointed at the price for the food we got.  My "spicy" pasta had little flavor.  The pasta itself was mushy.  Hubby got the lobster ravioli, his favorite meal, with a vodka sauce.  Again, no flavor, just mush.  The two starts comes from our server Frederick who was on top of things.  Drinks were always full.  Bread refilled.  He also brought us a free dessert.  The chocolate mousse was wonderful.  I would not go back

LU1T-1_WicrKTKixgiGhhQ.text: The beef carpaccio is the best thing on the menu. With those free crackers they bring. They should bring more. Seasoned to perfection... Way more!

tVh7cSUN_8pFzkS2q_BPSA.text: My husband, daughter, and I were checking out the beautiful newly opened Tivoli Village last Thursday, and Brio Tuscan Grille was one of the few restaurants that were 1.) already up and running and 2.) had a wait less than 20 minutes during the lunch peak hours.    The service was FANTASTIC, and that is probably because they just opened and are still in that "honeymoon"  phase.  Along with crayons and the kids menu to color, they also brought Pizza dough for my daughter to play with. They even offered to cook it for her when she was done- but she was having too much fun just playing with it.   I have never been to a Brio Tuscan Grille before so I had no expectations.  In fact, I didn't even know it was a chain restaurant at the time. Nonetheless, I am a fan of the food.  I ordered the Fettuccine Rustica and I highly recommend this dish if you like sun dried tomatoes.  I added the Bistecca Ensalata for an additional $3.95 and this salad was a meal in itself.  It was so delicious and so filling- I may just get a whole order of that next time since I am a sucker for gorgonzola cheese and bacon!  My husband ordered the chopped salad to start with and the Shrimp and Crab cakes.  It had only come with 2 average sized cakes, but they were so flavorful and surprisingly quite filling.  We ordered the kids lasagna for my daughter, and for $4.95- this was practically an adult serving.  In fact, the three of us shared it because it was that big, and that delicious!   The dessert display looked too fabulous to pass us, so I ate about 1/4th of my delicious pasta and had the rest packed up to take home.  We ordered the creme brulee and the raspberry cheesecake and both were the perfect way to end such a satisfying lunch.  The total bill for the 3 of us was less than $50. And it was well worth it- the ambiance, the service, the food were all great.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert options presented at the table
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top: shrimp and crab cakes. Bottom:  fettuccini rustica

KIW848hMHfCqha2eKS7SIw.text: Everyone's talking about this place and I finally had a chance to go with my girlfriend's. We went during their happy hour and the food was great. Each of us ordered the Brio burger and let me tell you, I was impressed that it had great flavor, yet it wasn't heavy like some burgers at restaurants like this. My only compliant was that I ordered it medium, but it was slightly over medium.  However, it was still moist and juicy.   The beef carpaccio was delicious and so was the fried cheese ravioli.  For drinks I had the peach white sangria.  It tasted great and was very refreshing. The prices are the best I've seen yet for happy hour.  I spent about $13 for the burger, carpaccio, and drink.  Not too bad, especially when you're on a budget.  The service was also good. I'll definitely be back.

MuhywSwlTuo3Uukus36RtQ.text: Last night (New Year's Eve) was my first time at Brio, and my friend and I came in for dinner before going out. It was busy, which was expected, but were able to find a perfect little table for two in the bar area. I'm not going to sugar-coat it - once we sat down, we waited for a really long time to get our order taken, to get our wine and bread, and to get our meals. But on busy nights even at good places, things can go wrong - and I'm a firm believer that it is 100% about how staff and management handle themselves. Brio did an excellent job at recovering our experience. Our wine order wasn't put in and we had to flag the manager down after 15 minutes of wondering what was up, but she got our wine to us, and took the glasses off the bill. In fact, while we were having dinner, our server even brought us over two extra glasses. (The wine was delicious, one of their pinot noirs, but I can't remember exactly which one.)  I didn't know what to expect out of our food since I'd never been here, but I was really impressed - the food is so good! I had a hard time deciding between their chicken pesto pomodoro, the pasta alla vodka and the pasta brio, but I decided on the pasta brio (rigatoni, roasted red pepper sauce, mushrooms and grilled chicken) since it's their signature dish and came highly recommended by our server. It was SO delicious and very flavorful - it wasn't spicy but still had the kick I crave! My friend had their chicken pesto over angel hair and didn't really love their pesto- according to our server it isn't True pesto - its base is chicken broth? So maybe that was why. But he ate it and had some of my pasta brio, and we both agreed that dish was incredible.  Coming in on such a busy holiday, I think everyone at Brio handled themselves very well, even when there were mishaps. The atmosphere was really nice - had good lighting and seemed sophisticated but also jovial. And you can't beat the location - Tivoli Village is so pretty. I loved our experience here and can't wait to come back and bring my husband!

JZz0ivj6k6LZzKrnYNK5bw.text: Excellent food and wine.  The guy who brought our water and soda was funny and attentive.  Our server Julianne (girl) wasn't very impressive though.  My son is autistic and he shook her hands, after she took our drink order, my son wanted to shake her hands again, and she said "no more, we already shook hands."  I was shocked!
