a8SvIuUdhYyJJEFfK_G6TA.text: Nothing worse than ordering your food, going to the bathroom to wash you hands, and watching a server walk out of the bathroom stall and then walk straight back out without washing his hand and start serving people's food. While you stare at the sign that says "all employees are required to wash their hands" . . . . Never eating at this location again.

NfxUQRwUe_3x8zGX7AoQxg.text: Oh Brio's HAPPY HOUR is probably one of my top HH places! You can not beat their $3.95 appetizers and $5 drinks! Well actually before their apps were only $2.95 but hey it's only a $1 increase.. I can handle that! Haha my must haves when I go are the beef carpaccio & spinach artichoke dip! My man and I usually share the burger as well.. The sucky part about this place would be that you can never tell if you're going to be able to get a spot or not.. The best place to sit is inside in one of the booths or outside by the firepit if you have a big group but it can get pretty busy.  ... Boo! But hey what can you do..!?  Tip: It is right in front of the COMPLIMENTARY valet! easy and fast~

ozGWQIVRsaBUsisoguXu8g.text: Though we live pretty close to Tivoli, this was our first visit to Brio for dinner.  Our last attempt was for Happy Hour a year ago, but we bailed when we were directed to sit on the side of the patio in which every seat was in full sun -- and it was 112 outside!  Happily, though the temp was five degrees hotter tonight, we ate in air-conditioned comfort.  We were with friends who are soon-to-be locals (if the husband ever gets his way), and our waitress, whose name I unfortunately don't remember, was extremely attentive and efficient throughout the meal.  For starters, we ordered the Bruschetta Sampler platter.  None of us realized until we were biting into different tastes that it was made up of all the different bruschettas they offered.  Some had prosciutto, some broiled tomato, and some were heavy on the balsamic (this is a good thing).  We enjoyed it a lot.  We also liked the Spinach and Artichoke dip, with the crunchy triangles of flatbread that accompanied it.    Brio tends to have a Mediterranean flair that tries to up it a notch from straight Italian, but for me this wasn't a plus.  I do love the food at Mediterranean restaurants, and am also a fan of Greek cuisine, but I'm not keen on feta cheese.  While trying to decide on an entree, almost everything I wanted to order had feta.  Happily, I was able to substitute gorgonzola in the Mediterranean Shrimp dish I settled on.  I could have also changed it to parmesan.  Four nicely-broiled shrimp sat atop a delicious melange of orzo, farro, broccoli, and artichokes.  I haven't had farro before (though I have a package of it in my pantry waiting for me to cook), and I liked the nuttiness that it added to the mixture.  If I hadn't already been full from the appetizers, I might have thought that there should have been one more shrimp on the plate.  Then again, it was 14.95, the shrimp were meaty, and I was stuffed before I started.  Two others ordered Chicken Milanese, and the third had Filet Mignon, which came with veggies and his choice of crisply roasted potatoes instead of the mashed it came with.  I didn't taste them, but they looked like a small version of potato skins without all the toppings, and he really liked them.  The Chicken Milanese was covered with mozzarella, which is unusual.  Add some red sauce and they would have had chicken parm.  That was served with a side of linguine in a plain tomato sauce.  The chicken was reported to be tender and perfectly cooked.  We shared a bottle of California Riesling; I think it was Wente, and wasn't overly sweet or dry, just right.  My only nit was the bread, because the dense bread with the hard crust that I love turned out to be sourdough.  I don't like sourdough, but others will disagree with me.  Other than that, it was a very enjoyable meal.  And we'll try Happy Hour again if the heat wave ever breaks.  Like in October  :)

402xwVuJgqzzkCpOjNdYqw.text: Excellent evening, and wonderful spot for a date. We were seated quickly and greeted right away by our server. She got us waters while we looked through the wine menu. Brought us back bread and waters. We ordered wine and shortly after, our meals. Our meals came out quickly and hot. It was delicious. He ordered a steak and I ordered a pasta dish. Our server checked on us several times, bringing us more wine, more bread and refilling our waters. After eating, we paid our bill and sat and talked until we noticed a line forming at the door. We felt bad for keeping a table so we moved to the bar area for more wine. The staff there was attentive as well. The bar area is a nice area on the side, I think next time we might try sitting outside by the fires. We'll definitely be back.

f1v6-WF2DwZxPg0OKeRMvA.text: "Well I'm satisfied!" Nothing to complain about. My waiter was cool and my food was great. A late summer night, with an outside table, helped me enjoy the lights from the village. The Cabernet and fresh bread was tempting. Wooded base cab and a Caesar salad helped tempt me for my later entree. Ravioli, sauteed mushrooms with a white sauce helped me enjoy this dining experience. A Samuel Addams helped close the night. Ill sure return for another grace keep evening at Brio's

5OPiRws0-0Uz8M8EvdIf6Q.text: Ask for Gus! He's a great server. He was so friendly and very attentive.   My roommate and I decided to come here on a Thursday night after a long day of work. We had to wait about 10 mins to be seated. But once we were seated, we were greeted right away by Gus. We ordered: the spaghetti bolognese, beef carpaccio, caprese salad, lobster bisque soup, and calamari.  The spaghetti bolognese was so creamy! It was amazing. The beef carpaccio is ALWAYS on point. So flavorful. The caprese salad was... eh, nothing special. The lobster bisque soup was some of the best soup I have ever had, to be completely honest. And the calamari was nothing short of yum. For dessert we got the chocolate cake with a side of vanilla gelato. It was okay, nothing spectacular. But I'll definitely be back for the beef carpaccio and lobster bisque!

Our server Edward was very attentive made sure we had everything to our liking and was very caring that we were happy. The quality of the food was excellent. XjQikoJPRFzd6DWu2E2-gg.text: I hadn't been to Brio in a long time but it was great coming back. The service was good and came right when I was ready to order.   I ordered the spaghetti bolognese and lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was amazing as always. It was very creamy and the lobster was plump and flavorful. It's just too addictive! The spaghetti bolognese took much longer because they messed up by giving what the chef called spaghetti but was actually not. It was wayyy to thin and flat to be spaghetti. They remade it using actual spaghetti when I explained what spaghetti was LOL. (I would know because it's what I order every single time aEverything was very good and the view from Brio was beautiful on a sunny Saturday with the harvest festival going on in Tivoli Village.

Chicken Marsala had good flavor but over cooked mushrooms and very little of them. In the pesce picatta the fish was cooked well but, the dish overall had no flavor. I was expecting lemon and caper flavor instead it was bland. We had to ask for more Marsala sauce and picatta sauce which made up for initial lack of sauces.

CvcfqHmBDxaAVGu0dvfKkg.text: Came here for my daughters birthday dinner.  Everyone liked their food, the service was excellent.  My food could have been better but I should have went with other people's recommendation who have eaten here before.  Let's start at the beginning. We ate on a Saturday night using a reservation for a party of 8 (easy breezy).  We were sat very quickly after checking in.  If we didn't have so many people it would have been perfect to sit outside.  After our order, the food came out within a reasonable amount of time.  The portions are generous and you could probably share, in fact if you are craving more than one thing, I would probably suggest having on person order one dish and the other person something else and then sharing.  Especially if you order Chicken Milanese and Lasagna for example.  You get two nice pieces of chicken when you order the Chicken Milanese.  If you order the way Brio normally makes Lasagna it will come out with mostly Alfredo sauce and some Marinara (red) sauce.  Ask for it in all red/Marinara  sauce.  That's they way most of my table had it and they were happy.  I had it with Alfredo, not that it wasn't good, but the creaminess of the Alfredo kind of softened the great taste of a traditional Lasagna.  I would have been better off ordering it the way everyone else did.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-nCVVkvl7AUxG79acpNfqA.text: Been going to Brio for several years now, used to frequent the Town Square location but recently started going to the Tivoli one more often. I have to say, this location is great! It's an open kitchen and you can see pretty much what happens in there. The chefs, cooks, & servers seem to have a great dynamic -- service is great and food gets out quick.    I've had most things on the menu, but I'm very partial to the Double Cut Porkchop with Gorgonzola crust. Amazing! Also, the cauliflower side is my favorite.   Don't sleep on the Mascarpone Cheesecake as well for dessert. 10/10 would recommend.

mFIegeYIeJht3amrqFp-bQ.text: An upscale Italian restaurant.  Today a group of  us decided to try Brio's brunch out and we were pleasantly surprised.  The breakfast side of the menu was very small, yet simple. It contained the typical eggs, potatoes and bacon dish.  However, the brunch side of the menu contained a number of their top selling menu items.  They also have a small brunch section of paired drinks as well.

7ZNtrtDRqRA2OLlX8SUjxw.text: Talking about a disaster. I am writing this review immediately after one of the worst services i've experienced ever. I have never been so ticked off by a server in my entire life. The service provided by this server named Monica (as indicated on the receipt) in the outside area was just pathetic.   Our friend arrived at the table early and got a table on the outside. But when we arrived, because we had our dog, we requested a different table where my dog could be better isolated from the rest of the crowd and the two other little puppies near by. The reason for this was that even though my dog is friendly but she loves food too much and she begs other people for food. When we asked for a different table, what we got was a sarcastic response from the host that "well your server won't be (name)." nevertheless, she reluctantly left all the menus and left. I was pretty annoyed by that response but decided not to let something like that messes up our perfect morning.   Well that was just the beginning. Our server Monica was just awful. I don't think she knows how to smile. My mother asked if there was any breakfast entree, she snatched the menu from my mom's hands, turned it around and tapped on the menu to show her the two breakfast entree. I almost stood up in my seat to confront her but my mom kept me on my seat. I then said I am not ready to order yet because we just sat down, Monica just turned around and left. There was no "I will give you guys a minute to decide."   The service remained laughably bad throughout. She only gave us two water even though we had a party of 3. I needed a coffee refill; I gotta ask someone else for it. I needed water refill; Glgotta ask someone else for it. I needed a change of your drink because a bug fell in it? I asked politely and she gave me a dirty look, turned around without saying a word. She then came back 5 minutes later with the drink and left it on my table without saying a word and then turned around and left. It was like if I was causing her the biggest trouble in the world. Never once did she come by check how we were doing like the other Brio servers would do normally. Never once did she come by to refill any of the drink we ordered.   The only thing that stopped from me going to a manager just now is because we didn't want to mess up our perfect morning with a friend we haven't seen in awhile. But the more I think about her pathetic service, the angrier I get. Her service was unacceptable.   My family is regular here and they said this was an isolated incident. But still this was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. I am in disbelief that this type of service is allowed at a Brio resturant. I am reasonable so I will give one star for the good food and the other servers who were great at helping us becuase Monica couldn't. In all honesty, the experience deserved not a single star.

Pxf3d7yF2UPLDwUTZjVRAQ.text: A nice place, with a good location. I liked the atmosphere, the food, and the service! Started with the Kale Caesar Salad, which was tasty. Then, I had the Lasagna Bolognese, which was also very good. A nice, balanced flavor. The Caramel Mascarpone Cheesecake was very light for a cheesecake, so it didn't fee like a brick in my stomach. I enjoyed it! Overall, I really liked Brio. You won't feel awkward if you dress up, or dress down. Definitely, give it a try!

-9dGuaCLo80kgkp4iBBG6A.text: Chicken pesto pasta was very Bland and simply put a glorified Top Ramen. Sorry guys who missed the mark on this one!  Although the dish left something to be desired the decor was very elegant and a very pleasant dining experience.  10/13 very impressed that within days I got a phone call from the manager at Brio.  She was very apologetic about my disappointing experience and even sent me a nice personalized note in the mail.  I look forward to trying a different dish and hopefully it will be a better experience. Look out for an update!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful Decor, food just okay
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland soupy this pesto pasta was simply a glorified Top Ramen.

cPpep-tq4p-rzxm8_p4FTg.text: This restaurant used to be so good, The last two times my salad was awful. it was merely chopped iceberg with a couple greens. It used to be all mixed greens. They are obviously attempting to cut corners... I won't be back.  Thank you for responding Bravo B however I must tell you I've already spoken to a manager twice to no avail....it's just not the same quality that it used to be, unfortunately....

78ynmnm4Gu_B3jMIfB6kQA.text: Beautiful ambiance.  Very good service and delicious food.  The menu is extensive.  I can always find items I'd like to try.  It has a resort atmosphere with the high ceilings and lush decor.  It's definitely a place to bring someone for a special event.  There is a happy hour but I've never been there during that time.

u3u6ZUoSuWb5x2qQQU9n7Q.text: Got to try this place because while in Vegas - we met up with family and they recommended this place to meet up and I am SO GLAD they did!  I had their Brio Sliced Steak Salad - This was SO GOOD and I LOVED it.  The salad had tender slices of steak with a chopped salad that had a delicious balsamic dressing along with tomatoes, gargonzola, mushrooms, spicy pecans and I think there was a bit of creamy horseradish that gave it that perfect BITE with the steak!! Wish they had this dish at home!   We also had the special which was the Seared Scallops with Risotto - I think my hubby pretty much inhaled this dish and the plate licked clean!  Other family members had the Lobster and Risotto!  The TAIL was HUGE - they LOVED it and each of the risottos were paired with wine which went perfectly with each of the dishes!  We were so stuffed we couldn't eat dessert but i have to tell you - the food, service, atmosphere was PERFECT! We sat around and enjoyed our meal and company with water glasses getting filled and just great service all around.  I actually wish we had a Brio Tuscan Grille in the bay area but at least now we know a go to place when in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliced Steak Salad - THE BEST!
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Scallops and Risotto
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special of the Day - Lobster with Risotto

518KGCVng0dIEAIRKQOj5g.text: This place used to be great - maybe they are just having one of those days today - but they can't even seem to give you a correct wait time for delivery pick up.  Was told 15-20 min, which seems pretty standard at 8pm -- showed up 30 min after order and was told it would be another 10 min.... this was after waiting 5 for someone to show up at the host/hostess desk... I was hoping that the food would taste as good as memory served me and at least be worth the annoyance- unfortunately, quality must have been on the chopping block here... $55 dinner for two ... such a waste - I chose this over the Olive Garden for flavor and over Maggianos due to the fact they get my order right only half the time.  BUYERS REMORSE all the way.  Food was bland and flavorless - tasted like reheated Olive Garden and for 2x the price! Plus the wait I would have had at Maggianos along with the aggravation of being quoted the wrong pick up time and offered empty apologies. Unless you're good with overpaying for a low quality meal, I would recommend elsewhere- there is an Italian place down the street that at least still takes pride in quality food and customer service. Will not be back ever again; a shame - I have had birthdays here, brunches here, date nights here and it was always fairly decent.  It has been about a year since my wife and I had the taste to swing into a Brio - but will not make that mistake again.

Nn3ZerD1Uv7JUt_OHcH0CQ.text: I've got to say that I've never had a bad meal here.  Lacked in the service department the last time I went, but the food was fantastic!  Just wish the overall experience was equal to the food.  For the price and locale, the level of service has to be a step above the rest.  I won't hold it against them though.  In the words of Governor Schwarzenegger, I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tivoli Village, on a Sunday afternoon....
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In case you are wondering, yes it is as good as it looks.

aF4AtlDSBm-Hfd_5qUEUMQ.text: Haven't been back here in about a year now I remember why the service by the waiter was  pleasant but he wasn't very attentive to our table our empty dishes sat there at least 3 rounds didnt offer to refill our drinks i finally had to ask after the fourth time he stopped by the table.  The food it self was for the most part better than last time.  The shrimp and eggplant was way better its was seasoned perfectly the calamari was lightly battered and the margherita flat bread was great.  The lobster bisque was very tasty.  The disappointing item was the chicken caesar salad the salad was blah and the chicken was ok don't get that. Otherwise it was good the score reflects the overall experience.

pspMQkSniQ2AKaZTkhOFiw.text: We asked to sit outside. The server didn't show up for 15 minutes until we asked the host again. Then she showed up, no apologies or concerns about us waiting. Then showed up the complimentary beef carpaccio from Manager to accommodate for delay. We've had much better service and food. Still love this place. But the service could be better.

0k0BwoSy8uQToSNZVAwNBQ.text: I really only want to give 3.5 stars.  Went last night for happy hour.  There were 9 of us.  The food was awesome!  Really loved the black pepper shrimp and the burger!!  The busser was attentive as well!!  Unfortunately the waiter seemed to not be very interested in taking care of us.  I specifically told him when there were only 3 of us there that I wanted what I ordered to be on a separate check that would be brought to me.  At the end of the evening I asked for my bill only to be told that it was all on one.  He then stated he hadn't heard me.  Did say that he would handle it but then STILL brought a single check.  Had to ask for bread three separate times which was finally brought by the bus boy.  We will be back ONLY because the food was really hood but will hopefully get a different waiter!!

hygZlS9t4T6m3kp29ue5gg.text: This review is for happy hour in the bar only.  If you are lucky enough to grab a table inside or outside before 630 pm you are definitely set to enjoy a budget friendly happy hour.  It was a Wednesday night about 6pm I was lucky enough to grab a table in the bar area.  It was very busy.  There was some weird guy playing a guitar and singing to keep me and my friend entertained while we waited for the table to be cleared and cleaned.  Not sure if this is a regular thing for brio now providing live entertainment but it was the first I have seen. In any case he was ok, not terrible.  Lol. Our waitress I believe it was Monica K. ( at least that's the name on our receipt) was great!  She ended every sentence with..."it's my pleasure".  Even though it was obvious she was slammed, she never lost her cool and never lost her smile.  She came around to let us know last call for happy hour, which was greatly appreciated.  We ended up with three martinis, one spinach and artichoke dip, two brio burgers and one chocolate cake all for $40.87.  What a steal! Especially since the food is great too!  Burgers are juicy. They have a great variety of items on their happy hour food menu.  In addition to a happy hour drink menu, brio offers $5 martinis all day Wednesday's and $5 wines all days Thursday's. Give it a try and check it out. They have a big outdoor patio.  See you there!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great happy hour prices

Y7dDZQlMeHW__Min3wUkrg.text: I am constantly surprised with how much we enjoy our time, food, drinks, and the staff at Brio.  Whereas most chains fall short in the personality department, the bar crew here is supreme.  Mandy, Kelly, Jim and all of the rest of the team know how to hustle and entertain while keeping the cocktails and delicious cuisine flowing. We started coming here for the unbeatable $3.95 happy hour menu (3-6:30 and 9-close weekdays) , but now it has become high on our go-to list of places to feel amongst friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best...Mandy!

tHib9emqsG09rnf98v3yiA.text: Dinner tonight at Tivoli Village:  Beverage: Peach Ice Tea.  Yes! Appetizer: Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip.  Yes! Entree: Campanelle Carbonara.  Yes! Dessert: Caramel Mascarpone Cheesecake.  Yes!!  Yes, Yes, Yes, and Yes.

X-IgywLmrRimLVm8YdZYpw.text: Really good Italian. Ambiance is great as well. A very short and simple menu, something you find in select places such as this. I've eaten at the two Vegas and Houston locations, and they are all consistently good. Versitile. A great place for a drop in, date, or for a finer flair.

FHwmy27vPlQAJN6x1ju44A.text: Loved our food but what made the date night special was Meagan!  We asked her opinion on all of our choices & she was spot on each time.  She even recognized that my 2nd Cucumber/Basil Gimlet looked wrong but had me try it before taking it back. She made our once another outing great. The food oh yeah the food was fantastic!  Pasta Pesto was so light & perfect for a hot night & my hubby's was heavier, beef & pappardelle but oh so yummy. Thanks Brio for making our evening away from a toddler so awesome!

jjma-sMjaxqUyELT8usuZg.text: I'm going to agree with my friends Stefany and Clint.    I must quote Clint, "The food is medicore at best".  We went there with my son and his wife. The last time I went to a Brio was the Town Square location, with my wife, on our second date, four years ago. It hasn't improoved in that time.   My chopped dinner salad was a good portion, but very dry and tasteless.  My wife had the "big" pork chop. It was big and meaty, but very dry. My daughter in law had a chicken dish worthy of a cheap buffet. I forgot what my son ordered, but I tasted it, and it wasn't very good.  The service was very good. Our bread baket was constantly refilled, our drinks always full, and when my wife complained to the manager about her dry pork, the manager did offer a substitute, but we were already full (mostly of bread).  She did send a comp'd desert as a way of saying "sorry".  Even though the service was very good, I would say it was a Rich Man's Bucca Di Peppo, with smaller portions, and an alternative for a High School Date to The Olive Garden.

t_T4SHyqNp-_lXmWGNocDA.text: Brio had great atmosphere and food!  Cocktails: cucumber Basil gimlet, was so super tastey.  It was like freshest, coolest lemonade I've ever had. My favorite item by far and it was only $7.50! I also had a glass of Sketchbook pinot noir and it was nice with dinner and reasonably priced at $9.00 a glass.  Food: The caprese salad was good quality ingredients and reasonably portioned. My only complaint is it def needed more balsamic. Their balsamic is a good one by the way. We also had the lasagna bolognese. This item was really tastey. Nothing crazy extravagant and certainly nothing to complain about. It was just a great item  The prices were pretty good in my opinion. 10-20 a person without drinks. When we got there we were seated on the patio. The weather was fantastic so that only added to the awesome atmosphere.   My only complaint for the evening was our waitress. She was a total bug a boo. I felt rushed and like she wanted us out of there.  However, the staff was amazing other than her and I can tell she was the only annoying staff member.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from our table at brio.

EVL1JMxzDDhiBQwsRfMBLA.text: Meh. Chain restaurant... 'nuff said.  8/6 visit.  None of the food was that good - I ordered the Balsamic Braised Beef Short Rib which was under-seasoned, bland and absent much flavor (er... saaaay Balsamic vinegar!?); my daughter ordered Pasta Alla Vodka which was slightly better.  Substantial portions, neither was worth taking home as left-overs.  The wine pour was mediocre.  Appitizer of Artichoke Dip was the star of the show; dessert of Dolchino Trio was great.  Server was friendly enough, but service sucked (disappearing for long periods of time; needing to be reminded of our requests numberous times - frankly I think he may have just had too many tables, despite the nearly 7p seating and a 1/3 full restaurant).  Hostess was wonderful, both being on the ball once we arrived; stewarding a late arrival back to our table; offering to charge my phone at the front when I was looking for an oulet.  Bigger price for an Olive Garden experience.

isgICwPGbX_ZPcFGxQve7Q.text: Best Happy Hour in town! It's Martini Wednesday !! $5 martinis. And great food, lots of choices!

JcHn_z7C4Qnvs2WMVPQRzg.text: Recently we celebrated our Anniversary with Friends at Brio Tuscan Grille. The service was very good along with the terrific Italian cuisine; grilled salmon, mouth watering grilled pork chop (bone in); savory lobster and shrimp linguini, delicious veal scallopini and more. Our waiter refilled our water every 10-15 minutes, or as needed.  We are definitely coming back.

rXwAvVFS8IWTOReH4M1JOA.text: This is one of those restaurants you shouldn't decide on eating at based off of reviews. You really have to make a trip and see for yourself if you like the food. For me, the pasta dishes taste different than what are considered "normal" Italian pasta dishes. The chefs add something to them (I think) that make them taste... I don't know... just different. It's simply not to my liking. Still, the quality of the food is great (you can tell). The ambiance of the restaurant is beautiful, and service is always good. Also, it's clean.

H3249GHhmdl_EZwSg19P8A.text: This has been the BEST restaurant we've ever been to in Vegas and I've lived here my entire life!!! We had the sweetest waitress named Mary and the General Manager made our visit incredibly inviting. The food was insanely good! Not one thing was off on our visit. Our kids had a variety of dishes and raved about it the entire night. They loved the pizza dough they sent out for them to play with. I ordered their wedge salad and everyone wanted to have some. It was the BEST salad I've ever had!!! Seriously, if you haven't tried this restaurant then you're REALLY missing out!!! We live 55 minutes from this location, but will make the trip just to enjoy quality food with our friends and family. 5 stars really doesn't do it justice. Keep up the GREAT work Brio Tuscan Grille and staff!!!

FCXqCrILIcszx2jdnhLqqw.text: The quality of food at Brio is a pleasant surprise.  The lunch menu has a lot of variety and I probably would have been happy ordering one of 4 or 5 different things, but lasagna wins almost every time, and Brio's version is quite nice.  It comes with your choice of 3 different salads (chopped, Caesar, or house) and I was very happy with the chopped.  Far more than a boring plate of greens, and it isn't drowning in dressing.   The lasagna arrived not long after, and it's made with white sauce, meat, and the usual noodles/cheese/sauce.  I dove in and was a little sad when I took the last bite because for a second, I contemplated ordering another.  It's nicely balanced, has just a teeny tiny amount of burned edges of cheese/noodle.and the meat is moist, like a meatloaf.  Mimosa wasn't anything to get too excited about, but the raspberry gelato (not on the dessert tray) was the perfect amount of dessert.  Allegedly Brio may make its way to California, and I can't wait!  So much better than Olive Garden!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch size lasagna
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad

Sxg_R8JVGsVAOuPHgMLJNA.text: Loved this place service was excellent waiter was ver thoughtful we went there Thursday Jan 26 party of 5 food was great the only thing we couldn't find a handicap parking anywhere close outside matter of fact never did find one anywhere atmosphere was very nice  I has had the lobster and stuffed shrimp everything on the table was excellent

13SDQ8IEnoWuVfZdm98v4g.text: Great! Went during happy hour, although they were busy the food and the waiter service was fast and efficient. We had four happy hour items and 5 drinks for $40.

TJJjY-IEfwEpLCKgIlSlWg.text: Great food and beautiful location. Perfect place to chill with a drink and an app. Would recommend to anyone.

p7-i5g2J0ER9hEicWei_wg.text: Been here twice now and have been very impressed. First time was for dinner; great food! Second for drinks; very strong! The service is the one thing that really stands out. Every member of the team always has a big smile on their face and they are very polite and helpful during interactions.  I will definitely be back and highly recommend Brio to everyone in Vegas.   Keep up the good work!

mm60wR66HKbNaFBoY8EM7A.text: Excellent food & great service! The staff was prompt and the food was delicious. Nice plating. I especially enjoyed that they have a lower calorie options menu. Did not expect that from an Italian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0nUm3JCDPFSUZyWc3k-LqQ.text: Awesome service, awesome food! I met some friends for a late lunch and had the chicken marsala, wow!! Very flavorful & good portion. Our server was on top of it too and had a fun personality. I will definitely be back!

yeGjmSHwwJoeZJLxCoxIcg.text: I've been here twice and Brio has done just swell. Start with a decent wine, of which they have many. You don't have to break the bank to get a good one. We found a nice Ruffino that we liked so much, we had a couple bottles. Small groups do great here -- especially in the sharing department. (The bread/cracker basket is dangerous, be forewarned).   Now, should you order the carpaccio appetizer (which I recommend you do), be prepared for a large portion that you'll either share, or have no need for an entree.  Good meat, tangy argula and shaved parm: all good.   This second time, I was set to have a salad but randomly queried if there was anything not on the menu. Gazpacho I was told, and yay to that!  It had excellent flavors, and a pleasant texture, complemented with just enough kick. Mmm. And it was cold, of course. Truly an excellent way to start a meal -- especially since it was, um, 110 degrees outside -- at least!  Despite the weather, we were very comfortable inside. Service flowed effortlessly -- or maybe that was the wine. Still, I enjoyed a very good Filet, cooked to order. This is not a steakhouse, of course. Rather Brio has many things they offer - with a Mediterranean way about them. Entrees are typically served with their mashed potatoes (which I couldn't imagine), but our Server was flexible: she easily swapped the spuds for spinach.   The pastas looked, and I'm told, are good. There was a nice salmon a few folks ordered. Tasted it myself, and it was perfectly fine -- with some memorable flavors that right now I forget. Really, there were no sour notes here. Which leads me to dessert --- always fun with a group. We tried several, and they were all outstanding. Seriously, we must have had three or four we worked on. Top things off with good coffee, or espresso, and you're good.

YjKVYX8-T_H5AKx-0wDcKg.text: Great place to come with the family. Great geill, amazing steak. All around nicer Tucson grill.

MLK_Lo_k0WTCxUXXod5cLw.text: I love Italian - Armani, Dolce and Gabbana, Prada, Fendi, Missoni, but......  I must admit, I'm not a fan of chain Italian restaurants. I was raised by a real Italian mama and nothing comes close to her sauce, her meatballs, her pasta dishes. I am terribly critical of most Italian restaurants and therefore am very hard to please.   I will say that Brio Tuscan Grille has thoroughly impressed this Italian palate. I avoided it like the plague when it opened at Town Square, but when it opened at Tivoli I decided to give Brio a chance. One chance!  Well it turned out one chance was all it needed because Brio knocked my Italian socks off.   The pasta alla vodka was tremendous, with ricotta stuffed pasta in a cheesy cream sauce. The top was sprinkled with pancetta and basil and the dish was large enough to bring some home for lunch.  A friend ordered the lasagna and it was huge - seriously enough for two people.  On my most recent visit, we decided to hit the bar before heading over for some wine tasting. What a treat we found in that bar....in the form of a $2.95 menu!!! Wow, it was awfully tasty, and with such selections as ravioli caprese, shrimp and eggplant (EXCELLENT) and a gigantic burger. Oh and Wednesday is Martini night - $5 martinis -- yippee!!!!  Good food, good service, good prices. Seriously, what's not to love?

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli Caprese
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Shrimp &amp; Eggplant
Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brio Burger

MwoGyCZJfycOkS2iMMfjaw.text: Great Italian food. Try the steak salad on the lunch menu. Very good! This location and the Town Square location, both have consistently good food and great service. The Tivoli Village location is closer to home, but they are both good.

nuDBsAs4vFiCU64MKrBISQ.text: Once again, Brio was a great dining experience. We dined on steak salad, carpaccio and succulent lobster risotto. Delicious sangria and black raspberry martinis were exceptional. Of course, our server, Julio, made the night even more special. His professionalism and attention rate him at the top in people skills, making this dining experience an epicurean delight in a most comfortable and relaxed ambiance. Thank you also to Jesse, manager extraordinaire, for his most personable approach and care. Happy hour is very special!! Dinners are divine! Sunday Brunch is a must!! Experienced them al!! Enjoy Brio!!

yOMuBY_yHyDDJFkzXaV56w.text: I have never dined in the restaurant, i've only been here for happy hour in the bar.  I've been here multiple times and i have to say it is an exceptional deal. I've had everything off the happy hour menu and its extremely fresh and still pretty big portions. The only thing I wish was them having a better beer selection, but I can not complain because their food makes up for it.  So stop by after work and enjoy a nice fresh happy hour meal.  3:30-6:30 is the happy hour time!

fj_cZ8aeqDkZZ9ArR1dUDw.text: Happy hour here for the 3rd time and although, the other times were awesome as well, Mandy and Kelly have made this experience personable and fun! The positive vibes are just what a happy patron thrives on! Highly recommend coming in for the yummy food and good energy at the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Brio Tuscan Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FtpgCPkGWCqGU3dQJpSlXA.text: These please is very dear to me it's where my girlfriend and I had our first date back in 2013 it's now 2016 and my girlfriend took me out for my birthday these evening and the food is always good you look around and the waiters are fast and always moving the food came out fast and it was nice and hot. What made this evening AWESOME was our waiter ALBERTO he was very friendly and always attentive he had like 6 full tables in our section and he was on top of all of them really kind, efficient, and really felt like we were a priority to him will definitely be going back more often and hopping to have him as our waiter

-Nrk07T7TkNsc-71OvyWWA.text: PLEASE go here for dinner ! If you're not feeling pasta they have GREAT steaks ! The service was so wonderful ! Everything about it was perfect ! I was able to cut my steak with a butter knife ! A BUTTER KNIFE PEOPLE !!! Please try it if you haven't ! Not to mention GREAT PRICES !

UkPQD-UmtkCh8Kn0uti5ew.text: Stellar customer service, in this city these days, say what?!!  It's True folks, Tivoli- Brio blew me away with their attentiveness and spectacular customer service during my dinner last night.  Greeted by two perky hostesses the (I assume) Manager escorted my date and I to our table.  Before we could even place the cloth napkins on our laps our server was at our table kindly taking our drink orders.    Sifting through the menus placed on the table, wine list, dinner menu, I stumbled upon the GLUTEN FREE menu! Yes, a special menu just for me.. My excitement continued when I browsed the decent list of gluten free options, including pasta.  Fellow allergy sufferers would agree that most restaurants name their basic protein dishes their "gluten free option's"..pause while I yawn.. But I digress.  I thoroughly enjoyed my Cesar salad with CRISP, fresh Romain lettuce, dressed to perfection. My taste buds were then taken on a gluten free amazing pasta trip that was out of this world..  Two glasses of wine and a full belly later, this girl was a happy diner.  The manager checked on our table while we dined, bussers were exceptionally attentive clearing plates promptly, and our server was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive as well.  All in all I give this Brio (2) very solid thumbs up.  I sincerely hope they keep up the above average customer service and delicious gluten free menu options.  West Side, should we meet again and I am in the mood for Italian food, Brio you're at the top of my list!

oJSpZ43u_WZ01ipnI_LkNA.text: First time in, food is very good, staff is very friendly, I would give it a 5-star but, they need a little more assistance with the food servers. Even though our server was very nice and very helpful, you can tell that she was rushed, Not stressed, just rushed. She needed some assistance which I didn't see anybody else helping her. Besides that, I would highly recommended for a very good experience in dining.

Itq3G7EBwmZrM-Hsa21EJw.text: This place is awesome! The food, the atmosphere and everything else! My best bro n i went here for happy hour and the food is awesome! We got two brio burgers, Carpaccio, and we got the italian lemonade and the white peach sangria! Everything was amazing and the bill was very cheap!  Jim was the best bartender ever! He had the best hospitality and was very friendly! Hes awesome! Keep it up Boss and thank you for everything!

S_PjT979MCdbfP_PoZtR8Q.text: Maybe we just got a bad night ,but the food was not that good very salty. I gave a 2 star for the service the waiter was outstanding. The prices were very high for what you got. Definitely better Italian food restaurants in Summerlin.

r_kZ5eKGWbbOvz3fY04GYA.text: Went here for afternoon drinks and appetizers. Our server Andy was super nice! The outdoor atmosphere was perfect for a beautiful Saturday afternoon. Both the food and peach bellinis were delicious!

Vn5mKVJFa-boG7ajeaWSQg.text: THE best Italian food . Decor and a service are 5*.Eggplant appetizer is one of my favorite ever. Everything tastes delicious.

2oek3tqfPxJuc18g2VamCw.text: Love their food! We had my daughter's baptism party here and the manager Jenna was very nice and helpful during the arrangements.  The staff was very attentive the only thing is that it seemed they tried to get too many of us to sit in a too small of space so we were a bit squished. Other than that the food was of course excellent.  We also have been there for brunch. Their breakfast food is not as good as their regular stuff. Love the location. So nice to sit outside in the evenings and look at the surroundings.

CWnFmqcNIwUzNHYxzrLQjg.text: I think you have to adjust a little for it being on Valentine's Day and bearing that in mind it was good. We got there 20 minutes before out 8:45 reservation and were hoping to be seated earlier, but unfortunately it was just super busy and we were seated at res. time. We spent some time looking over the menu and it did take a while to order. My gf ordered the shrimp and lobster pasta which she said was very good if not phenomenal. I ordered the filet only to find a few minutes later that they just ran out. So, I went with the New York Fiorentina which turned out to be quite good as far as New Yorks go (not usually my favorite). Grilled and seasoned very well which is a must for the chewier cut. Overall recommended with friendly and professional service.

i2u754imYq8swlbq9hK2_g.text: Haven't been here in a while so went back to renew acquaintance on a Thursday night. Dinner for three of us was excellent - fish and angel hair pasta for dad and son, chicken limone for mom. All were very good and just as expected. Service was fine with no slip-ups.

BowdKK_-OBxG5XWyfzB89g.text: We sat outside since the weather is getting nicer to do so in Las Vegas!!! Some friends joined up for happy hour as Brio is about the best in town. Sometimes the service at this location is questionable but this visit we had great service and, unfortunately, I cannot remember her name:(  As always, the food and drinks were great!

813cfe-iHMj-_whta8lmFA.text: LOVE BRIO! Their menu truly is for everyone! They have such a great selection..especially their "light menu!" I rave about their chop sald.. seriously one of the best I've had even for just a simple salad! Their servers at this location are OK. The past 2 times I haven't had the best service, and I was actually surprised that the service on a Monday afternoon was terrible. Took quite awhile for everything and the busser decided to take our dessert before we were even done with it.. said he would bring another one because it was his fault, but never returned with another dessert. Oh well. Will always come back to Brio though!

FLvi8nuN1H8XRHlRmnzOAg.text: We love Brio and come here pretty often for good food. Tonight we had the usual spicy shrimp eggplant, as always it was spot on. We also tried the sausage ricotta flat bread, was pretty good. My husband ordered the sausage tomato pasta, spicier than it looked. All in all the food was good. Would be giving 5 stars but our service was a bit slow. All of us were very thirsty and our server seemed annoyed that I wanted her to take down our visit credit. So that was a bummer for one of our favorite places to eat.
